Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Senior Analyst, HCM Systems will be responsible for performing system requirements analysis, functional system design, integrated testing, and solutions maintenance of the HCM Oracle Applications. As an Applications expert, this position is responsible for the successful implementation of technology solutions in the Corporate HR, Benefits, Payroll and related business areas by following Securitas SDLC and Agile Project Management, Change Control and testing methodologies.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED

Supervision will be provided by the IT Director, HCM/WFM Systems

SUPERVISION EXERCISED

No direct reports but will manage projects utilizing internal and external team members.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Systems Design and Implementation

Responsible for implementing and supporting multiple Oracle ERP Cloud core HCM applications
Provide expert solutions in the Oracle ERP Cloud core HCM modules: Recruiting, HR, Benefits, Payroll and related applications.
Maintain Oracle configuration changes in respective HCM application areas.
Work with Business Analysts, Process Owners and End Users to analyze business requirements.
Support configurations, customization, reports and interfaces, testing and user training
Develop test scenarios and test scripts in the impacted solutions to facilitate appropriate integrated testing.
Implement new system solutions and lead system testing and resolution of system issues per Securitas’ project management methodology.
Work closely with applications Support group to ensure proper post-implementations handoff.
Closely work with the project team members responsible for developing reports, interfaces, data conversion programs, and application extensions
Create and maintain system/application documentation (requirements, processes, procedures)
Provide applications knowledge in evaluating and improving current business processes.
Provide expertise on new application releases and new functionality in HCM modules

Advance Level Support

Provide cross-module and cross-functional area integration support.
Ensure integrity and accuracy of all application system setup information.
Interact with technical/development professionals in the design and support of required specific customizations, interfaces and extensions to the Oracle ERP Cloud applications.
Support in the investigation and resolution of reported system issues. Provide system information, utilize diagnostic techniques, guide the efforts of the production support and interface with vendor support as required.
Follow prescribed methodologies and processes in completing Oracle support and implementation activities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS AT ENTRY

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s degree in business or technical discipline preferred.
MBA or CPA a plus.
Prior experience in Oracle implementation projects (full lifecycle)

B*usiness and Technical Experience*

5-8 years of Oracle Cloud HCM or similar experience implementing and supporting some combination of Oracle HCM applications such as: Recruiting, Talent Management, HR, Benefits or Payroll modules.
Experience working on Oracle’s Cloud-based ERP system or a professional who has transitioned to Oracle Cloud HCM, coming from a major ERP i.e. Oracle EBS, PeopleSoft, SAP is desirable.
Hands on experience in requirements gathering, design, development, and testing of Oracle HCM Cloud applications or ERP software.
Excellent planning, organizing and project management skills.
Ability to work independently and recommend industry-best practices based on business requirements
Ability to take part in cross-functional discussions to analyze requirements and recommend solutions
Experience in solution architecture and writing functional specifications, functional solution design for technical development in a clear and concise manner
Excellent business process knowledge of the following: Standard HR Processes, Payroll rules and requirements and overall understanding of HR Compliance.
Business process analysis and redesign experience, strong business analysis skills, process mapping, business process redesign and implementation
Knowledge of all phases of Systems Development Life Cycle is required.
Ability to analyze complex data and develop recommendations and solutions
Experience in creating reports/processes utilizing BI Publisher; HCM and Payroll loaders, Fast Formulas, OTBI (Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence), PAAS ADF framework & Extensions are desirable.
Experience converting data from legacy systems.
Experience in developing and executing test plans is required.
Experience with BI reporting technologies, Oracle Business Intelligence, Cognos or other similar tools is a plus
Hands on experience with ERP cloud security and workflows is desirable
Samples of design documents as well as operational documentation may be requested.

Competencies (as demonstrated through experience, training, and/or testing):

Multitask - Ability to manage multiple tasks at one time; quickly and accurately shift attention among multiple tasks.
Communication – Ability to present and explain ideas in plain English to a wide range of audience (technical community, business community, management). Read, write and speak fluent English, using appropriate grammar, style and vocabulary.
Critical thinking - Demonstrate a systematic approach in carrying out assignments. Is very orderly and excels at cutting through confusion and turning chaos into order.
Problem solving – Demonstrate a strong ability to identify, analyze and solve problems. Unusually decisive in handling difficult business problems. Translates problems into practical solutions;
Client service – Consistently ensure that the team provides the customer with attentive, courteous and informative service. Derive personal satisfaction from delivering great service.
Excellent interpersonal skills.
Ability to adapt as the external environment and organization evolves.
Carry out all responsibilities in an honest, ethical and professional manner.
Create and maintain strong positive relationships with business partners across the organization
Act as an advisor to the business on areas possible improvements, efficiency, and best practices

Multiple opportunities for qualified candidates to advance in our rapidly growing company.

This is job entails a lot of volume and we need a candidate who can work under pressure with the ability to multi-task.

Company Name: The State of New Jersey Judiciary
Job Description:
AMENDED

Amended to revise salary

Should additional positions become available with five (5) months of the closing date, the applicant pool from this posting may be used to fill additional positions.

When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court.

Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.

The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.

The New Jersey Judiciary seeks an experienced business analyst to work under the general direction of the chief or other supervisory personnel in the Automated Trial Court Services Unit (ATCSU). This unit is primarily responsible for business analysis and user requirements gathering; workflow analysis; development of project plans; user interface; system testing; and user training and support.

The unit works collaboratively with court case processing managers and staff, information technology managers and staff, and others to plan and implement large scale Judiciary information technology projects. It also provides ongoing customer support and delivers presentations, when necessary, to various customers located throughout the state. Experience with all stages of the SDLC, PEGA and Agile methodology is preferred.

Note: The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 3 days of work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.

Example of Duties:

* Writing specifications for new applications and enhancements

* Recommending process and design changes to case management systems

* Analyzing business procedures, workflows, policies, and standards to identify appropriate IT solutions for the business community

* Creating and managing project requirements with related project milestones and schedules; formulating reports to track/monitor project progress

* Defining and documenting customer business functions and processes

* Acting as a liaison between stakeholders and software development teams

* Communicating and collaborating with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements in delivering business requirements documents (e.g. UI designs, screen-flow diagrams; wireframes & user interface specification documentation)

* Developing test scripts and performing a variety of system and user testing across multiple platforms

* Coordinating regularly with ITO and business users

* Designing and conducting presentations and training sessions to internal and external customers (including judges, court staff, attorneys, and other governmental entities)

* Conducting interviews to research and analyze work methods, processes and programs

* Planning, organizing, and facilitating meetings or site visits with primary stakeholders

* Providing helpdesk and on-site user support

* Performing other related duties as required

The selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.

Salary range is $64,964.77 - $104,621.19. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range.

Job Requirements:

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and one (1) year of professional experience in: analyzing, designing, programming, troubleshooting, resolving technical problems, testing, defining business requirements, training and/or installing computer systems applications OR planning, acquiring, installing and implementing telecommunications facilities and services, wide area networks, or local area networks OR generating and maintaining system software.

Substitution: Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.

A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and two (2) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and three (3) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

A Master's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity may be substituted for the required education OR one (1) year of experience.

Education Note: Degrees conferred outside of the United States must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service. (See www.naces.org/members.html)

Residency Law: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), also known as the “New Jersey First Act,” all persons newly hired by the Judiciary must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey.

Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.

Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

To Apply:

Applicants can click on the ‘Apply on Company Site’ button to apply by November 24, 2023.

For additional information please visit www.njcourts.gov and reference Job # 2022-08815, Business Analyst (Information Technology Analyst 2.)

The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to Justice.

Summary of the role

Reporting to the Director of Strategic Pricing & Business Insights, this role is responsible for providing decision-making intelligence across all our US businesses. In a cross functional role, this position supports and collaborates with others in order to develop and review various KPIs. Through analytics the incumbent helps understand the product life cycle faster and develops insights that allow the organization to make strategic decisions in support of the company's mission. This position develops and utilizes the databases and tools necessary in monitoring, reporting and providing strategic advice to market access decision makers and other areas of the business.

Key responsibilities

Support the Director of Strategic Pricing & Business Insights in the analytics leading to the development & deployment of BI reporting for key channels (prescriptions, sales performance, managed care landscape, etc.)
Act as a key business partner to the corporate headquarters Finance team for Gross-to-Net reporting, accruals, month/quarter close and prior period adjustments, and variances analysis
Support the rebates processing activities and active maintenance of managed care agreements to ensure all the agreement and initiatives with our payer and channel partners are captured an reflected in a timely and accurate manner in our financial P&L
Partner with internal teams to analyze ROI and investment decisions including, but not limited to, In-Licensing, Marketing programs, copay programs and salesforce productivity metrics
Showcase initiative to establish new processes to support commercial decision-making
Perform strategic intelligence monitoring of industry trends, through attendance at industry conferences & online research
Support to outsourced government pricing activities

Qualifications & Competencies

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, economics, or equivalent combination of education and work experience
Minimum experience of 3+ years in a similar role. As an asset, have evolved in the pharmaceutical industry
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI and can manipulate large, multi-dimensional data sets in order to analyse, report and manage dashboards and performance metrics.
High proficiency in Microsoft Office environment. Knowledge of Microsoft BI and data sources (Symphony, IQVIA) preferred
Strong business acumen, analytical and problem-solving skills
Autonomy, agility, and desire for continuous improvement
Shows potential to prepare and deliver effective presentations that story-tell with data

Senior SAP Business One Implementation Consultant

Work with an Award Winning Top 10 SAP Gold Partner and catapult your ERP career! Drive the delivery of implementation services related to SAP Business One in cradle-to-grave implementation projects, including functional requirements, implementation, go-live, post-go-live, and SAP Business One support. Be part of an organization that puts client needs at the center of all engagements.

THE COMPANY:

Clients First provides tailored and scalable financial and ERP systems and services for growing small-to-mid-sized companies so they can achieve enterprise-level results. With a proven track record of successful implementations that span 30 years, a career with Clients First is a commitment to the integrity of being straightforward. Our transparent, knowledgeable team is looking for a direct and honest professional ready to help push our clients to the next stage of business growth without overselling or under-delivering.

If you're ready to join our group of driven technology enthusiasts, helping deliver real business process solutions to customers across North America, read on.

THE POSITION:

As an independent team player, you will consult with your client and team members and assume responsibility for performing implementation tasks and producing quality deliverables in every interaction.

· Directly responsible for keeping SAP Business One projects focused on effective outcomes

· Employ consulting best practices in discovery, business analysis, and process documentation

· Leverage experience and skill to help client organizations benefit from innovative solutions and ideas, leading to an increased need for products and services from Clients First

THE REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree in Business or Computer Applications or equivalent work experience
SAP Business One implementation experience a MUST
SAP Certifications are a bonus
End-to-end ERP implementation experience
A background in consulting
Strong technical understanding
A desire to learn new skills, approaches, and technologies
High standards in communication, follow-up, responsiveness, documentation, etc., both internally and externally
Strong communication and project management skills

THE RESPONSIBILITY:

· Lead project coordination, including managing 3rd party vendors, integrations, and upgrades, and working directly with clients on their customizations, training plans, and data migration

· Demonstrate knowledge and comfort with manipulation of data files, working with relational databases, and other data manipulation activities

· Prepare functional specifications for implementations, enhancements, integrations, custom reporting, and other technology projects

· Take charge of project quality by directing the testing and troubleshooting processes and acting as the client's initial support and issue resolution level

· Independently manage competing projects and priorities while maintaining a high level of service and responsiveness

· Employ consulting best practices in discovery, business analysis, and process documentation

· Assist customers to implement Best Practice Processes

LOCATION:

This position can be based from our offices in Holmdel, NJ, or Palm Harbor, FL. This position can also be remote for the right candidate who has a home office, excellent work habits, and an ability to work in a team-oriented role from a remote location.

TRAVEL REQUIRED:

Travel for the Senior SAP Implementation Consultant will be between 20% and 30% of the time and is dependent on project location and project flow.

SALARY & BENEFITS:

Clients First are not only dedicated to putting our clients first, we're dedicated to putting all our people first. We believe that well cared for people produce their best work. We're happy to offer highly competitive salaries, bonuses, and incentives along with a robust benefits package to every person who works on our team.

Compensation includes a competitive salary plus quarterly and annual bonuses.

Benefits Include:

· A 401k plan with a dollar for dollar match up to 4% of an employee's salary

· Paid group life insurance program

· A contribution toward an employee's enrollment in Aflac Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospitalization plans

· Paid Long-Term and Short-Term Disability

· Employees start with 15 days of Paid Time Off, which scales as years of employment increase

· Clients First supports employees by providing partial payment for United Healthcare Choice Programs as follows:

65% of the cost of the United Healthcare Choice Plus 250 deductible plan for the employee and their family
70% of the cost of the United Healthcare Choice Plus 500 deductible plan for the employee and their family
75% or more of the cost for the United Healthcare 1500 or 5000 high deductible plan for the employee and family
Clients First pays 56% of the cost for the Dental and Vision plan for the employee and family

WHY JOIN CLIENTS FIRST:

As an outcome-oriented, collaborative team of technology enthusiasts, Clients First provides an environment built for the pragmatic, passionate professional. With a laser focus on helping our clients succeed with every project, you will have the opportunity to put your experience and knowledge to the test every day. We offer the proven methodology and framework to help your clients succeed and give you the chance to do your job the way you believe it should be done. Together, we will deliver projects that meet and exceed our clients' needs while staying on budget, in scope and planning for the future.

As a multiyear Bob Scott Top 25 VAR with a portfolio of solutions and applications that meet the needs of the SMBs across the United States, Clients First is a leader in ERP and back-office solutions from SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, Acumatica, and more.'

Job Title: Retail Systems/Business Analyst (ONSITE in Glen Rock, NJ)
Job Description:
Business Analyst

AAC is seeking a Business Analyst for a rapidly growing client, who can thrive in a scaling organization and can lead and drive business analysis. The successful candidate will be a confident people person who can become an immediate asset and adopt a hands-on approach to their role. MUST BE A US CITIZEN OR GREEN CARD HOLDER TO QUALIFY.

This position will be at least a 6-month engagement with a strong likelihood of extensions. This will be primarily on-site in Glen Rock, NJ at the beginning of the engagement, and it will likely transition into a remote role once up to speed.

This is very much a hand’s on, broad role that will directly contribute to the automation of several business systems, data collection, and more. As such candidates need to be comfortable working with multiple stakeholders over all aspects of the business. They will report directly to the Director of Data and Applications.

Key Responsibilities:

Perform business and financial data forecasting, reporting, and operational metrics tracking as required for all aspects of operations
Analyze financial and business data – and create financial and business performance models for decision support
Document current transaction flows and help improve these flows
Make reverse engineering changes that may be made in the flow of sales data in middleware
Report on business and financial performance and prepare for regular leadership reviews
Analyze past results, perform variance analysis, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements
Evaluate financial performance by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts
Maintain a strong financial analysis foundation creating forecasts and models as required to support business cases
Work closely with the group accounting team to ensure accurate financial reporting and decision support
Lead with the tracking of Supplier Contract completion and tracking of all ancillary income and collection
Perform market research, data mining, business intelligence, and valuation comps as required
Provide analysis of trends and forecasts and recommend actions for optimization
Guide cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures
Recommend actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses
Identify and drive process improvements, including the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports, tools, and Excel dashboards

Experience & Skills:

Financial and/or data analysis experience in an enterprise-level role, with proven experience in a fast-paced working environment.
Experience with finance/retail systems in an enterprise environment (i.e. ERP implementation/upgrade, procurement systems, inventory systems, etc.)
Strong IT skills including advanced use of Excel, Microsoft Word, and Power Point
Strong experience working with diagram programs such as Lucid or Visio
Analytical Thinking: The ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach
Fostering Innovation: The ability to develop, sponsor, or support the introduction of new and improved method, products, procedures, or technologies.
Technical Expertise: The ability to demonstrate depth of knowledge and skill in accounting, financial management, business analysis

Preferred Technical Requirements:

· Experience performing analysis with retail financial systems such as POS systems, Inventory mgt. systems, and cash management systems

· As Is and To Be process mapping

· Building test plans

· Change control experience

· Azure or AWS cloud certifications

Experience with Python, PowerShell, and VB script
Knowledge of SQL

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Statistics, Finance, Business Administration, or that of equivalence

IT Lead Product Analyst MedTech Education
The IT Lead Product Analyst MedTech Education will own the vision and prioritization of the Event Management and HCP Engagements platforms features to meet business and technical need.

Description

The Business Warehouse (BW) Analyst would deliver BW initiatives/projects for Benjamin Moore & Co. and will provide technical and business expertise in terms of solution development and implementation in terms of report development

The role will primarily interface with the Business Intelligence, Enterprise Architecture, ERP, PMO, and Infrastructure groups to deliver these initiatives. The role responsibilities include business requirements analysis, solution design, program development and unit testing, quality testing, UAT coordination, and overall day-to-day issues/support management and system monitoring which may include coordination with an offshore development team and system support.

Job Responsibilities

Responsible for technical analysis, design, development, testing, and deployment of reporting capabilities for maintenance and enhancement of SAP BW 7.5 on HANA or above to support business analytics and reporting requirements
Should be able to work independently in analyzing data requests, documenting business requirements, and designing reporting solutions related to BW
Independently gathers, analyzes, and identifies opportunities for enhancements, works closely with Business and Technology partners to seek and provide smart resolutions to business issues
Translate the user requirements into functional and technical design, application configuration, and testing scenarios.
Develop/Build extractors, ADSOs, Composite Providers, CDS, and Open ODS Views including Bex queries to meet business requirements.
Develop Real-Time data models for reporting and analytics.
Develop ABAP programs, user exits, routines and activate business content.
Performance tuning for high-volume and complex information delivery scenarios
Adhere to BI/BW best practices and standards to maintain a stable Business Information environment
Monitor BW runs, communicate, and troubleshoot issues related to BW
Optimize end-user data access response times
Design processes to minimize data quality risks and proactively identify potential data issues
Prepare project-related documentation (functional design, technical design, test scripts, end user training) during the differentstages of a project



JOB REQUIREMENTS

Education

§ Bachelor's degree in Business (or Management), Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline, or equivalent work experience is required



Experience

Must have a minimum 6 years of technical experience with SAP BI/BW with 3 years of experience in BW 7.5 on HANA and higher
Experience with Native HANA Modelling and Business Objects Suite preferred
Experience in the configuration of BW data objects including InfoObjects, InfoSources, Transformations, ADSOs, Composite Providers, CDS and Open ODS Views
Experience in LSA++ architecture
Experience of ABAP, SAP query, SQL
Experience with BI/BW Upgrade projects
Understanding of SAP ERP modules O2C, P2P, R2R, FI-CO, Supply Chain.
Should be able to reconcile ECC data with BW data



Other Key Qualities and Skills

Should be able to work independently with minimal supervision
Should be able to work in aggressive timelines
Strong interpersonal skills, analytical skills
Strong process orientation with significant attention to detail

End to end delivery and support responsibility for all Verizon FIOS, Mobility & 5G FWA (Fixed Wireless Access) e-commerce solutions & Systems.

Lead the design and architecture support for tactical and transformative ecommerce 24x7 solutions.

Partner with onshore and offshore design team to create and optimize UI, UX, usability and functional experience of digital sales and cross channel experience.

Lead creation of “minimum viable product”, prioritize critical tasks and enable test and learn approaches to iteratively deliver technical and business solutions.

Lead design of load and scalability testing and successful execution of testing & tuning.

Deliver results within budget, time, quality and strategic and tactical key performance goals.

Document and comply with software quality, data security and compliance processes.

Create proposals and present effectively to a diverse audience; manage stakeholders.

Hire, retain, develop high performing motivated talent and leaders both onshore and offshore. Manages teams in both direct and matrix structures. Manage multi-skilled global contractors and employees.

Drive employee satisfaction and engagement for the Digital organization.

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

Job Title: JR Consultant / Business Analyst, Digital Supply Chain
Job Description:
People-Centered. Great Place to Work.


Are you looking for the opportunity to work in a JR Consultant / Business Analyst role for a trusted advisor in end-to-end supply chain strategy and operations? Look no further.




At Supply Chain Wizard we provide consulting services in the areas of Digital Supply Chain, Digital Factory and Track & Trace, along with digital solutions for our clients working on a global, regional, or local level across North America, EMEA and APAC. We are a trusted partner to our clients who depend on us to deliver expertise to augment their operations & strategic programs and we aim to exceed those expectations, realized with a dedicated team working on a firm foundation of shared values.




Our values: Quality-Obsessed, People-Centered, Long-Term-Focused, Impact-Driven, Fact-Based.


Our values guide everything we do. They motivate our attitudes, actions, decisions and relationships with clients and with each other. They define us.




The Role


As a Jr Consultant / Business Analyst, you will support a variety of business operations and activities for several of the firm’s corporate initiatives including Customer Relations, Marketing & Communications, and Knowledge Management. You will also work with the client services team to support project managers on client deliverables.


As a Jr Consultant / Business Analyst, you will be working on Digital Supply Chain and/or Track & Trace strategy and execution of projects for multiple clients. This role is a cross functional role where your project engagements will vary between clients, mostly life science industries, and vary between management consulting supporting activities as Business Analyst and Project Manager, to more data driven analytics and even cooperation with SCWs product management team developing latest improvements to our solutions and hardware.


This is an excellent opportunity to be an integral part of a high-growth, high-impact organization, to operate within cross-functional projects, working closely with project stakeholders, subject matter experts and client leadership to achieve success with high-quality deliverables. The magnitude of projects provides a solid foundation for development, skill enhancement and ultimately help foster your career.


The Requirements


The ideal candidate will possess the following attributes:




Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Business Management or similar programs. Master’s degree preferred.
2 or more years of Jr Consultant / Business Analyst experience, ideally in (digital) transformation projects.
Experience in Pharmaceutical/Life Sciences/Medical Devices Industry preferred.
Expertise in IT, Manufacturing and/or Supply Chain processes & systems preferred.
Strong organizational skills.
Strong presentation, PowerPoint and data visualization skills.
Business Process Mapping skills.
Tableau, mySQL, R experience is a plus.



About Us


Supply Chain Wizard is a management consulting, digital innovation and solutions firm, and a global leader specializing in serialization and traceability, supply chain strategy and operational transformation programs with the presence in North America, Latin America, Europe, Middle East and Asia. Supply Chain Wizard partners with organizations in designing, developing, and implementing digital solutions using state-of-the-art technologies such as Internet-of-Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and Blockchain through its Cloud Platform to enable end-to-end Digital Supply Chain Transformations in Life Sciences & Pharmaceutical industry. Serving some of the world's largest pharmaceutical manufacturers, contract manufacturers and packagers, Supply Chain Wizard is dedicated to adding sustainable value through data-driven decision making from Shop Floor to Executive Boardrooms. This is the place to grow your career.




Learn more about us at supplychainwizard.com.

Job Title: Business Analyst Connected Planning - Recent Graduate - Summer 2024
Job Description:
Who are we?


We're Bluecrux. Pleased to meet you! Founded in 2011, Bluecrux is a value chain consulting and technology company. Our experts and software solutions help to transform today’s supply chains into smart, efficient, and fully integrated value chains. We believe that only true collaboration leads to innovation by converging at the intersection of our knowledge and our customers’ ambition and linking expertise with technology and problems with solutions.We’re a community, a movement that’s built at this intersection, which we call “the Cutting X”: it’s where supply chains evolve, and value chains are forged. Our client portfolio includes some of the world's largest companies, including Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Roche, Bridgestone, Oatly, and many more. Our desire to work closely with them is also reflected in our global presence, with offices both in Europe and the US.


What will you be doing?



You'll start immediately in a visible, autonomous role as a project member in one of our running planning tool implementation projects. We implement ANAPLAN, and advise on the added value of this tool to our customers within different industries such as chemicals, food & beverages, and manufacturing.
You will be part of a project team that is a mix of internal colleagues, supply chain planners, and managers from the client side, and you'll be doing stuff like this:
You support client workshops to gather requirements and understand the challenges tied to their planning and broader supply chain.
In close collaboration with your project lead and a solution architect, you will translate the customer's requirements into the Anaplan language in the back end and build user-friendly dashboards.
You gather the data needed for the Anaplan models in the data hub to have a single source of truth within the company.
You build the Anaplan modules and dashboards, often in a co-build mode with the client's model builder. You focus on usability, user experience and engagement for this planning tool while adhering to Anaplan’s best practices.
You perform end-to-end acceptance tests, user training, go-live and hyper care of the newly developed solution.
You will have the opportunity to work on projects that last approximately 4 months, which will allow you to learn very fast about various industries and companies.

Is it you that we are looking for?



You have that interest or your first working experience in Supply Chain Processes and Data Analytics. Ideally, you have had an introduction to Supply Chain Processes in a minor or major within degrees like business engineering, civil engineering – operational research, applied economics or within an MBA program.
You can demonstrate profound analytical and problem-solving skills.
You're a team worker and - player who can also perform well without much supervision.
You're open to feedback and always looking to enhance your collaboration.
You like to be challenged daily and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
You are flexible and willing to travel as our projects can occur at our customers' offices worldwide.


What you'll love about working for us...



A great place to work with lots of growth opportunities, where we make room for initiative and allow you to enhance your personal and professional skills, but most importantly: there is room to be yourself!!!
You will be part of a great team of hands-on, inspiring and enthusiastic supply chain colleagues.
A competitive compensation package, including a generous PTO program, medical and optional dental insurance, a bonus program, and a 401(k) plan with fixed employer contributions.
A hybrid workplace: a combination of home office and on-site (in the New York City area).
We know you by your first name and don't let titles or levels withhold us from being truly aware of your talents.
Team events & fun such as team building & sports activities.
Please note that sponsorship for a visa is not available.

Job Summary

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Business Analyst to join our dynamic team. The Business Analyst will play a crucial role in analyzing business processes, identifying areas for improvement, and proposing innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and productivity. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a deep understanding of business operations and technologies, and will work in an agile environment of product, design, and technical partners to increase adoption, value, and drive operational efficiencies for our clients.

Responsibilities

Requirement Analysis:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather, document, and analyze business requirements.
Conduct thorough research and data analysis to understand industry trends and best practices.
Translate business requirements into clear and concise functional specifications.

Process Improvement:

Identify inefficiencies and bottlenecks in existing processes and propose optimized solutions.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to streamline workflows and enhance operational efficiency.
Develop and implement process improvement strategies to drive business growth.

Data Analysis:

Analyze large datasets to extract valuable insights and trends.
Prepare detailed reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to interpret complex data sets.

Systems Integration:

Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of new systems and applications.
Conduct system testing and validation to guarantee accurate and efficient functionality.
Troubleshoot and resolve integration issues in a timely manner.

Project Management:

Assist in project planning, monitoring project progress, and ensuring timely completion of tasks.
Provide regular updates to project stakeholders on milestones, risks, and challenges.
Support project managers in coordinating activities across various departments.

Stakeholder Communication:

Act as a bridge between technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring clear communication of requirements and project objectives.
Conduct presentations and workshops to explain complex concepts and proposed solutions to diverse audiences.

Requirements

Proven experience as a Business Analyst or similar role.
Experience with business process modeling and workflows, and process improvement.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques.
Technical systems and process-oriented mindset.
Project management certifications such as PMP are desirable.

The Business Analyst will document technical solutions to business challenges, to advance the company's efforts, by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements. The Business Analyst will follow the proper process and procedures by using the templated project artifacts and carrying out the project activities as stipulated by the IT Program Management Office.

. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis.

. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.

. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, Use Interface Document, User Stories

. Work independently with users to define concepts and partner with Project Managers

. Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans

. Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team through which requirements flow.

. Develop requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language.

. Create test cases from user scenarios and assume the testing lead role when necessary

. Ability to collaborate with senior leadership, senior technologists, Business Partners and people at all levels to define business processes, analyze operational efficiencies, implement creative solutions and measure delivery results

. Understands the business processes associated with the project and ensure the solution is designed and built to meet business requirements

. Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.

Job Title: Tableau Experienced Business Analyst / Data Analyst
Job Description:
The New Jersey Turnpike Authority is need of a Tableau experienced data or business analyst. The ideal candidate should have at least 5 years recent working experience with Tableau.

Under the general direction of the Assistant Director of Data and Performance Services, the Business Intelligence & Business Analytics Administrator develops, maintains, manages, administers, and supports the Authority’s data warehouse. The position focuses on identifying opportunities to create data marts and data warehouses, which will provide upper management with reliable information in order to make informed decisions on day-to-day business objectives, as well as, long term projects. This position also includes a wide range of responsibilities and duties regarding business intelligence and business analytics tools, and platforms, which are in accordance with the Authority’s goals and requirements.

1. Work with other departments to prioritize business and information needs, as well as, identify opportunities for improvement.

2. Collaborate with team members to collect, standardize, and analyze data.

3. Acquire data from various data sources; primary, secondary, or tertiary, and maintain databases and data systems.

4. Structure large data sets to find usable information.

5. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies which optimize statistical efficiency and quality.

6. Filter, “clean,” and troubleshoot data to correct problems.

7. Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques and apply business intelligence and business analytics tools to visualize the data.

8. Design dashboards and reports from different data sources.

9. Establish and maintain best practices, which include defining governance processes, policies, guidelines, roles, and responsibilities.

10. Review policies and procedures, as well as, roles and responsibilities to adapt to, evolve into, and remain compliant with business and/or regulatory requirements.

11. Serve as the in-house expert on data visualization.

12. Enable users to customize reports without requiring programing support.

13. Ensure projects hit milestones on time and escalate to proper stakeholders as needed.

14. Solid understanding of project management methodology, including the ability to troubleshoot project roadblocks and proactively seeks solutions to meet deadlines.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.

2. Five (5) years of experience with Tableau.

3. One (1) to three (3) years of experience with data visualization tools.

4. Working experience as a data analyst and/or business data analyst a must.

5. Practical work experience in developing and maintaining dashboards and visualizations in Tableau.

6. Ability to write queries, reports, and configure dashboards in Tableau.

7. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.

8. Strong knowledge and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects), databases (SQL and Oracle), and programming languages (XML, JavaScript, and ETL frameworks).

9. Knowledge using statistical packages for analyzing datasets such as Excel, SPSS, and SAS.

10. Strong analytical skills and ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

11. Strong interpersonal, communication, and group collaboration skills.

12. Ability to work with diverse teams.

13. Ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple priorities, independently and as part of a team.

Job Title

Senior Business Analyst

What does a successful Business Analyst do?

They will drive requirements gathering sessions in project meetings with the client and work with cross-functional client stakeholders to complete application requirements and scoping. This is a key role focused on championing and establishing product requirements and ensuring that the organization is prepared for new products and product launches. As a Business Analyst on this team, you will interact with Team Leadership as well as multiple Subject Matter Experts and technical teams to draw out business requirements, create and functional and design documents, and prepare all necessary User Interface designs (wireframes).

What will you do?

Formulate and define Business Requirements & Use Cases.
Create collateral such as reference docs, user guides, etc. in support of the products and solutions.
Document functional requirements and determine complexity of work for applicable projects.
Work with Solutions Consultants and Solutions Architects to create proposal documents and requirements templates.
Provide analysis to resolve production issues Support and/or perform User Acceptance Test (UAT).
Participate in product demos and requirements process.
Participate in Agile development activities such as stand-up meetings, sprint planning, sprint retrospective, continuous improvement, and cross-functional collaboration; serve as Scrum Master.
Gather and document requirements and high-level estimates for defect fixes and enhancements.
Work closely with Technical, QA and Business Teams in explaining the requirements and provide functional guidance/answers.
Preliminary functional testing Prepare Help/Support Documentation for new features/fixes.
Use JIRA to manage Sprints – create Stories, coordinate with the Scrum Team to assign/update tasks Participate & Contribute in functional framework discussions.

What will you need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science/information systems or equivalent professional work experience.
Experience conducting preliminary analysis and estimations for new product feature requests.
Experience in writing requirement documents for application development.

Job Description:
Job Title:Sr Business Analyst
Introduction:
At GAF, we cover more than buildings. We cover each other. No matter what role, tenure, or track, under this roof you are empowered to be there for your teammates, your customers, and especially your community. Under this roof, we don’t back down from hard work– we support one another in pursuit of something bigger. We define the future while leading the present. And under this roof, we own our opportunities. Becoming the market leader only happens when everyone feels they have the opportunity, and the support, to thrive. We are GAF. And under this roof, we protect what matters most.

Summary: We are seeking a Senior Business Analyst with an expertise in enterprise web site development to support multiple dot com sites. The Senior Business Analyst will have responsibility for performing detailed analysis and documenting business requirements and system impact to ensure the successful delivery of website initiatives.
The Senior Business Analyst must have knowledge of the capabilities of website development.

Essential Duties:
70% Work with constituents across the organization to understand current processes, systems and opportunities and capture requirements for new processes, systems, user interfaces and user experiences through various methods, including to but not limited to requirements gathering sessions, interviews, surveys, workshops, etc.

Collaborate with vendor partners and internal team members to communicate needs and requirements and determine appropriate solutions.

Advise on best practices.

Document current and future state in various forms including functional requirements, user stories, wireframes, interface designs, workflows, swim-lane diagrams, presentations, etc. for appropriate audiences including C-Level, business stakeholders and technical teams.

20% Collaborating with IT Development (onshore/offshore) and QA to ensure appropriate and adequate system testing is performed.
Facilitating User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
5% Providing guidance, reviewing work and providing feedback to other team members.
5% Performing other duties as assigned.

Under This Roof, We Require
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business (with IT focus), or related majors and/or track record of work experience in areas described above.
5+ years’ experience in systems analysis and design with a proven record of successful medium to large scale project implementations, preferably in enterprise Business-to-Business durableable goods, construction, or building materials. manufacturing.
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) or similar certification is a plus.

Under This Roof, We Also Value
Strong experience and demonstrated ability to document web-based systems, and perform analysis and design using various methods, including: business requirements, functional specifications, user stories/acceptance criteria, use cases, swim lanes, and process flows, swim lane diagrams, AS-IS / TO-BE diagrams, and mock-ups/wireframes.
The ability to bridge the gap between the user experience and technology.
Experience with visually modeling requirements using tools such as Invision.
Experience in SDLC and Agile/Scrum methodology.
Experience with documenting requirements for integrations between enterprise systems.
Strong experience in business process design and workflow analysis.
The ability to relate product data to ancillary web-based systems.
Strong knowledge and execution of IT Standards, Policies and Procedures.
Knowledge of Information Security Awareness.
Knowledge of Project Management Methodology & Tools.
Experience in working with multiple data sources, and ERPs is a plus.
Experience with Sitecore is a plus.
Experience in the Manufacturing Industry is a plus.
Experience in building Marketing, Sales and Ecommerce sites is a plus.
Experience in Jira is a plus.
Google Suite and Lucid Charts knowledge is a plus

Who We Are

For over 30 years, Creative MediaWorks (CMW) has delivered custom web development, graphic design and print solutions to the exacting standards of life science companies and their agencies. We do so with a focus on quality, deadline, and accuracy. We achieve our quality standards through defined workflow processes, direct access to on-staff project talent and, quality assurance expertise, backed by an uncompromising commitment to offer the most responsive customer service in the business.

Who We’re Looking For
CMW is seeking a Business Analyst – Software Implementation Manager for our NJ office that will collaborate with our clients and our development team to implement our software solution—Speakcore. (www.speakcore.com).
Overall Responsibility
Become a subject matter expert of the Speakcore platform. Communicate between clients, stakeholders, and developers to ensure that everyone is informed and geared towards achieving the same agreed-upon goal. Collaborate with all players to establish requirements and turn them into actionable specifications for the development team, ensuring a full understanding from the team.
Specific Responsibilities:
Requirement Gathering: Manage the discovery process for each new bureau. Understand client’s business and how Speakcore can support their initiatives and goals. Gather, analyze and document business requirements from clients. Communicate and guide the client on how to use the software solution to meet their needs. Work with client to complete the requirements specification documentation in an accurate, clear, and understandable manner.
Preparing Specification Documents: Input clearly articulated tickets into the project management tool for programmers to execute. Facilitate communication and share knowledge to ensure clients’ needs are met effectively.
Project Execution: During development, provide clarity to developers, negotiate with stakeholders on conflicting requirements, etc. This may include holding meetings to deliberate on solving specific problems, identify risks and manage technology-related restrictions. Hold team status meetings to provide visibility to the project's progress, deadline, goals, objectives, and issues
Research & Requirements: Assist with guiding future development based on industry trends and customer input/feedback on the user experience and functionality of the platform
Conducting User Acceptance Tests: Perform high-level final acceptance tests to ensure agreed-upon deliverable is met. Collaborate with team and clients for User Acceptance Testing. Ensure that end-to-end cycle testing is completed for each initiative and coordinate release schedule with the DevOps team, keeping the client updated along the way.
Technical Documentation: Write documentation for our customers, which will include technical documentation, tutorials, and other implementation guides.
Client On-Boarding: Obtain proper documentation from the client once the job has been sold. Help schedule necessary kick-off meetings and discovery calls, and own the process.
Evaluate business value to help prioritize needs.
Demo Speakcore for potential new clients and existing clients.
Additional responsibilities as required.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of working experience in the field as an IT business analyst or technical project manager
Knowledge in business application systems, enterprise, distributed, multi-tier/web-services, web-based applications
Knowledge of quality assurance best practices in an Agile methodology environment
Expert in requirements documentation procedures
Expert knowledge of software development life cycle and methodologies
Customer-facing with experience uncovering customer needs
Ability to conform to shifting priorities, demands, and timelines
Experience with working closely with on-site and remote development teams
Experience working both independently and, in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
High energy, “can-do” attitude with a willingness to do whatever it takes to get the job done
Skills:
Verbal, Written, and Interpersonal Communication
Technical
Persuasion
Presentation
Problem-Solving
Time Management
Bonus Points:
Knowledge of speaker bureau programs and other types of educational and marketing events performed by Life Science companies to promote their products
Working at CMW
Intimate team of dedicated, hard-working individuals who work as a team to achieve their goals. A process-driven organization, with a laid-back atmosphere and an open office environment that facilitates collaboration. CMW is located in a quaint small town with plenty of different lunch options and convenient shopping nearby.
Speakcore Team Values
Innovative
Consultative
Collaborative
Techy
Dependable

Pennington, NJ

Who We Are:

EmpiRx Health is a disruptor in an ever-changing healthcare industry, offering a market-differentiating, value-based pharmacy benefits management solution. We are bold and fearless in our approach to healthcare, how we talk about ourselves, and our use of advanced technology and analytics.

Who We're Looking For:

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Business Intelligence Analyst. In this critical role, you will interpret and present data related to market trends, customer behavior, financial analysis, or operational efficiency in a clear and meaningful way. You understand that data drives today’s decisions and when it comes to healthcare and pharmacy claims. You relish change and thrive in an environment of dynamic resilience. SQL is your tool of choice when it comes to pulling data sets and you are able to paint a great visual picture of the insights that this data brings through your expertise in Domo, Power BI, Tableau etc.

If you are a highly motivated Senior Business Intelligence Analyst with a strong background in analyzing complex data, identifying trends, and providing insights that can help in decision-making processes, and you are passionate about making a meaningful impact in the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply.

What You'll Do:

As a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, your role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

Develop and manage strong relationships, collaborating with internal customers in a consultative manner, including proactively offer them insights and suggestions.
Create accurate, timely and actionable reports, dashboards and analytics using BI tools and communicate them to the business
Working with end users, conduct data analysis, identify data trends, patterns, and insights (e.g., customer performance risks, savings opportunities, look-ahead trends and market dynamics that affect client performance, to inform business decisions.
Work with business teams to tailor the right narratives around client stories that can be derived from the data.
Liaise with business leaders to explain the possibilities and limitations of data analysis and support end users on functionality and navigation of reports and information
Assist in researching solutions and recommending actions to achieve higher levels of efficiency for the business drivers such as clinical interventions strategies, clinical savings, financial pricing models, client performance metrics and risk metrics.
Design and implement data quality controls to ensure data accuracy.
Research new analytical trends in industry (e.g. Machine Learning, AI-assisted data analysis) and apply innovative solutions to the current workflow.

What You Need:

5+ years of analyst experience in a dynamic environment
2+ years of experience in business intelligence
2+ years of experience in presenting data to internal and external stakeholders
2+ years of experience on handling large data sets for Ad-Hoc Analysis and accurately merging multiple data sources
2+ years of experience working in a healthcare environment

Advanced SQL and Excel skills

Outstanding presentation and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas through storytelling
Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods
Experience working with healthcare claims data and/or pharmacy data

Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or data science

An understanding of data frames with Databricks and Spark SQL based technologies

To be considered within market range, a salary is at or above the minimum of the range. You may also have the opportunity to participate in discretionary equity (stock) based compensation and/or performance-based variable pay programs.

Job Title: Senior Finance Business Analyst - Supply Chain
Job Description:
Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Senior Finance Business Analyst - Supply Chain . This role can be located in either New Brunswick, NJ or Titusville, NJ and may require up to 10% travel (domestic and international).

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.

With $94.9 billion in 2022 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.

In the era of modern finance, intelligent automation is becoming a “must have”. You will join a growing team in charge of this area within Supply Chain Finance. Driving efficiencies, generating insights, and enabling finance subject matter experts to create added value through new technologies is at the core of the Finance Automation Supply Chain Team (FAST). As Part of the FAST team, you will work with the customer and technical teams to translate the business needs and complexity into innovative intelligent automation concepts. These automations will enable insights & business benefits across Supply Chain Finance and the business to make more data driven decisions and drive business benefits.

As a Senior Finance Business Analyst –Supply Chain you will be a key member of the FAST Team. You will leverage your knowledge to assess and reengineer complex finance processes, propose process improvements, conceptualize new automation, prepare development documentation, and partner with customers to deliver advanced technology solutions within project timelines and budget. You will play a key role driving E2E change management within our global organization and lead the delivery of high-quality automation & analytics products that fit our internal customer expectations.

This role requires skills to drive business transformation, quickly learn new, cutting-edge technologies and business processes, as well as the ability to effectively influence and communicate cross-functionally with all levels of management. Candidates must thrive in a diverse and global team-oriented environment and enjoy partnering with various finance groups, external partners, and IT teams to develop automation that will drive business benefits.

Responsibilities:

Supervision of a Finance Leadership Development Program (FLDP) Finance Business Analyst
Lead & drive business analysis on finance processes
Design, lead and embed new innovative finance process in base business activities
Lead automation projects from kickoff to deployment by following proper automation development process, including Analyzing & Designing reports.
Build partnerships and ensure smooth delivery of Finance Automation Supply Chain Team products
Drive E2E organizational change within the business
Act as a “translator” between the internal customers & technical team
Lead & deliver project within the timeline and budget allocated
Build sophisticated, but user-friendly dashboards on Power BI with proper documentation
Present updates on a regular basis to management on project progress and next steps
Mentor Subject Matter Experts on how to use new technologies and solutions developed
Suggest enhancements, govern & support the customers on solutions
Test new technology & stay informed of Intelligent Automation standard methodologies
Qualifications

Required:

· A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in business administration, finance, or IT

Minimum 3 years’ experience in Finance
Ability to lead & develop junior staff member
Ability to understand and communicate complexities in a simple & clear manner while engaging and interacting with all organizational/cultural levels
Enthusiastic team player aspiring to create a positive work environment.
Ability to tactically analyze problems, propose and implement resolutions
Must demonstrate the ability to plan and prioritize to achieve results within a dynamic environment
Strong interpersonal communication skills
Experience to work autonomously and handle multiple projects and tasks in parallel
Customer focused, highly motivated, with strong attention to detail
This role can be located in either New Brunswick, NJ or Titusville, NJ and may require up to 10% travel (domestic and international).

Preferred:

Ability to negotiate project scope & distinguish needs vs. wants
Project management experience and strong organizational skills
Experience influencing various levels of leadership
Willing to partner and collaborate across cross functional teams
Experience in using insights/analytics to develop comprehensive and impactful recommendations and solutions that drive key decisions

The anticipated base pay range for this position is $73,000 - $117,300.

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/ performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs such as health insurance, savings plan, pension plan, disability plan, vacation pay, sick time, holiday pay, and work, personal and family time off in accordance with the terms of the applicable plans. For additional general information on Company benefits, please go to: https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Job Title: Business Analyst, Translational Core Platforms, Research IT
Job Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us.

Description

Partner with scientists in the Research organization to develop and implement technologies and IT processes to support the acquisition, management, analysis and exchange of translational biomarker laboratory data. Develop strong relationships with analytical chemists, biologists and IT functions, help define strategic vision and develop plans to ensure that industry leading IT technology platforms are implemented. Serve as a bridge between scientists and the Information Technology organization to ensure strategic Research objectives are achieved.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with scientific and IT stakeholders to understand and analyze current business processes, identify improvement opportunities and develop solutions that optimize internal laboratory processes to generate and manage translational biomarker data including flow cytometry, immunoassay, and genomic-based assay platforms.
Document current and future state lab process flows, identifying process gaps, reusability, integration opportunity, inefficiencies, and redundancies.
Document current and future data types, identifying data reusability, inefficiencies, and redundancies.
Facilitate requirements gathering sessions with scientific, IT and project management stakeholders to identify business and system requirements for laboratory process and data generation/management solutions.
Develop and document user stories, use cases, and functional requirements that describe the business and system requirements for IT applications.
Collaborate with IT development resources to ensure that requirements are accurately interpreted and implemented and that solutions meet business needs.
Participate in application testing and validation to ensure that IT capabilities trace to user, business and design requirements.
Assist with IT application training to business users as well as provide responsive, sustainable support for deployed systems and capabilities.
Ensure compliance with organizational and industry standards, policies, and regulations.
Continuously improve processes and applications based on feedback and business requirements.

Skills/Experience

Bachelor's or master’s degree in Life Science, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field.
1-3 years of experience in a scientific informatics, biopharma, or academic research organization.
Knowledge of molecular assay platforms is highly desirable. This should include but is not limited to: genomics and genetic assays, protein-based assays, immunoassays, and mass spectrometry-based assays.
Experience with common research scientific platforms (e.g., electronic lab notebooks, LIMS, sample inventory management systems, etc.)
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Ability to work in a team environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously.
Experience with gathering requirements for new software development.
Experience with Agile methodologies and software development, especially as a product or user story owner.

If you come across a role that intrigues you but doesn’t perfectly line up with your resume, we encourage you to apply anyway. You could be one step away from work that will transform your life and career.

Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers
With a single vision as inspiring as “Transforming patients’ lives through science™ ”, every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

BMS will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, pursuant to applicable laws in your area.
