Job Summary

Business analyst is responsible for assisting the Children s Health Service Line leadership team in monitoring financial data and related processes that contributed to successful operations within the larger organization. In addition, the business analyst is responsible for translating business requirements into both high-level and detailed reports. Candidates must be able to work at a detailed level while maintaining the big picture of overall service line goals. Other responsibilities include compiling comprehensive reports, designing and supporting databases, data mining and analysis and providing support for day-to-day operations

Essential Job Functions

Analyze the productivity metrics across the RWJBH system, working to standardize the unit of service and working with revenue integrity to ensure charges are created
Prepare recurring daily/weekly/monthly reports and dashboards to address and support key business functions and initiatives
Review and maintain RVU data for analysis & distribution
Assist in the implementation and completion of benchmarking for the service line
Assist with onsite productivity meetings with department leadership and senior staff, summarizing key issues and following up on items to be researched, changed or implemented
Analyze data for opportunities by site across the system, elevating findings to service line leadership
Assist the departments with rolling forecast process, auditing workbooks, answering questions and reviewing forecast once site completes; produce reports for review
Develop business plans to support programmatic growth and development; track progress of goals and projections
Make recommendations to streamline the reporting processes
Maintain a current working knowledge of healthcare related issues and regulations.
Other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

Bachelor degree required; finance or related field preferred
Two years experience in business analytics role; hospital/healthcare setting preferred
Strong working knowledge of Excel, including complex formulas, pivot tables, charts and formulas, and efficiently working with large data sets
Intermediate understanding of database concepts
Intermediate understanding of Tableau and/or other BI software (Qlikview, Crystal, etc.)
Knowledge of capturing, analyzing and communicating measurement results
Knowledge of Microsoft Access preferred
Ability to work well in an individual and team-based environment
Understanding of budgeting and healthcare finance preferred

Additional Information:

RWJBarnabas Health is the most comprehensive health care delivery system in New Jersey, with a service area covering five million people. The system includes eleven acute care hospitals Clara Maass Medical Center in Belleville, Community Medical Center in Toms River, Jersey City Medical Center in Jersey City, Monmouth Medical Center in Long Branch, Monmouth Medical Center Southern Campus in Lakewood, Newark Beth Israel Medical Center in Newark, RWJUH- New Brunswick, RWJUH- Somerset in Somerville, RWJUH- Hamilton, RWJUH- Rahway and Cooperman Barnabas Medical Center in Livingston; three acute care children s hospitals and a leading pediatric rehabilitation hospital (Children s Specialized Hospital), a freestanding 100-bed behavioral health center, trauma centers, a satellite emergency department, ambulatory care centers, geriatric centers, the state s largest behavioral health network, comprehensive home care and hospice programs, fitness and wellness centers, retail pharmacy services, a medical group, multi-site imaging centers and an accountable care organization.

Description

When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.

SALARY: The salary range for this position is $56,859.22 to $93,632.72 for Schedule A, and $56,859.22 to $88,951.08 for Schedule B. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range. For current Judiciary employees, salary upon promotion or advancement will be an increase of 5% of base salary, not to exceed the maximum of the range, or the minimum salary of the band/level, whichever is greater. Judiciary employees hired prior to June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule A. Newly hired individuals, and Judiciary employees hired on or after June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule B.

The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.

The New Jersey Judiciary is seeking a professional business analyst to work under the general direction of the chief or other supervisory personnel in the Automated Trial Court Services Unit (ATCSU). This unit is primarily responsible for business analysis and user requirements gathering; workflow analysis; development of project plans; user interface; system testing; and user training and support. The unit works collaboratively with court case processing managers and staff, information technology managers and staff, and others to plan and implement large scale Judiciary information technology projects. It also provides ongoing customer support for applications and delivers presentations, when necessary, to various customers located throughout the state. Experience with all stages of the SDLC, PEGA and Agile methodology is preferred.

REMOTE WORK: The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 3 days of remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.

Example of Duties

Writing specifications for new applications and enhancements
Recommending process and design changes to case management systems
Defining and documenting customer business functions and processes
Communicating and collaborating with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements
Developing business requirements documents (e.g., user stories, data matrix, security matrix, UI designs, screen-flow diagrams, wireframes & user interface specification documentation)
Developing test scripts and performing a variety of system and user testing across multiple platforms
Preparing and conducting presentations or training sessions to internal and external customers (including judges, court staff, attorneys, and other governmental entities)
Creating training materials and system documentation (e.g., user guides, quick reference guides, release notes, training videos)
Providing helpdesk and on-site user support
Performing other related duties as required
The selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.

Qualifications

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity.

Substitution: Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.

A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one (1) year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and two (2) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for a the required education.

An Associate's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and three years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

A Master's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity may be substituted for the required education.

Applicants who are approaching their anticipated graduation date may apply. If selected, the applicant must complete their degree no later than their start date.

Education Note: Degrees conferred outside of the United States must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service.(See www.naces.org/members.html)

Supplemental Information

Physical Ability: For some positions, applicants must have the ability to perform work which requires climbing and prolonged standing, stretching, bending and reaching. The selected candidate must be able to frequently lift and carry supplies weighing from 30 to 50 pounds and, occasionally, materials weighing up to 75 pounds.

Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.

Special Note: Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information.

Residency Law: In accordance with N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary within one year must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. Any person may request an exemption from that requirement from the Employee Residency Review Committee in the Department of Labor & Workforce Development on the basis of either hardship or employer critical need.

HOW TO APPLY:

The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.

The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey.


The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action
Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to Justice

Position Summary

The Supply Chain Systems Analyst is responsible for the management, system planning, implementation, enhancements and ongoing support of the Supply Chain Information System (SCIS), and serves as the liaison between the Supply Chain Department and SCIS users, with the exception of new user setup and access changes. Additionally, the analyst will work with multiple data sources across business lines to develop new capabilities,will utilize emerging technology and is responsible for identifying issues, creating solutions and resolving business problems through data mining and analysis. Demonstrates high degree of techincal competencies in all aspects of job performance

Primary Position Responsibilities

Acts as SME on all SCIS matters and or issues, liaises with the Information Technology Department to manage and optimize the Supply Chain portions of any and all HHS systems, both current and future state, and provides all requested and required education to staff and HHS community customers.
Develops outcome oriented workplans and manages project activities and deliverables, and provides technical assistance and consultation to departments regarding project activities.
Provides a first point of contact for Supply Chain staff for problem resolution and process redesign
Supports, evaluates and implements advanced technology to improve overall Supply Chain management processes by using Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) and or E-Commerce initiatives

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Business Analyst

What does a great Business Analyst do?

As a Business Analyst on the Money Network team, you will play an integral role in a variety of initiatives to support strategic business objectives. You will generate meaningful insights through fact-based analysis to ultimately improve client satisfaction and financial results.

If you are analytically driven and enjoy lighting up a room with thoughtful insights, this position will bring purpose to your passion!

As a Business Analyst, you can look forward to supporting the team by:

Critically thinking through, sometimes vague, business issues and how to analyze them efficiently
Performing analyses to support key business initiatives and synthesizing key insights that can turn into actions.
Prepare and deliver communications that share insights within Money Network and beyond.
Develop and maintain daily and monthly metric dashboards and reporting packages
Develop business cases, using quantitative and non-quantitative data, for strategic initiatives to improve the client experience and Fiserv financials.

Bachelor’s Degree
Proactive self-starter with a dynamic and resilient nature, high degree of adaptability and flexibility to excel in a dynamic fast-paced environment
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks and solve problems
Must have strong data analytics and problem-solving skills
Proficient in MS Office Tools, with advanced Excel skills
Experience querying data from data warehouses and relational databases

Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are.

We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought.

Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation.

Who are we?

We're Bluecrux. Pleased to meet you! Founded in 2011, Bluecrux is a value chain consulting and technology company. Our experts and software solutions help to transform today’s supply chains into smart, efficient, and fully integrated value chains. We believe that only true collaboration leads to innovation by converging at the intersection of our knowledge and our customers’ ambition and linking expertise with technology and problems with solutions. We’re a community, a movement that’s built at this intersection, which we call “the Cutting X”: it’s where supply chains evolve and value chains are forged. Our client portfolio includes some of the world's largest companies, including Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Roche, Bridgestone, Oatly, and many more. Our desire to work closely with them is also reflected in our global presence, with offices both in the US and Europe.



What will you be doing?
You'll start immediately in a visible, autonomous role as a project member of one of our running supply chain planning projects within different industries such as life sciences, chemicals, food & beverages, and manufacturing.
You'll see yourself working on and contributing to the main project phases. Here's an idea of what to expect:
In general, you will always be analyzing, mapping and conducting existing business processes in the Supply Chain and Operations.
To refine your analysis, you will prepare and project interviews to better understand the client's needs. You will become aware of the customer organization and be part of the change in their organization and their ways of working.
You'll track KPIs and report and present them accurately to the customer project team.
You are responsible for the qualitative documentation of all your project tasks. You'll contribute to delivering the most important customer and project deliverables, such as meeting notes, playbooks, and training materials.

Is it you that we are looking for?
You have that interest in or have a first working experience with Supply Chain Processes. Ideally, you have had an introduction to Supply Chain Processes in a minor or major within degrees like business engineering, civil engineering – operational research, applied economics or within an MBA program.

You can demonstrate profound analytical and problem-solving skills.
You're a team worker and - player who can also perform well without much supervision.
You're open to feedback and always on the lookout to enhance your collaboration.
You like to be challenged daily and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
You are flexible and willing to travel as our projects can occur worldwide at our customers' offices.
What you'll love about working for us.
A great place to work with lots of growth opportunities, where we make room for initiative and allow you to enhance your personal and professional skills, but most importantly, there is room to be yourself!
You will be part of a great team of hands-on, inspiring and enthusiastic supply chain colleagues.
A competitive compensation package, including a generous PTO program, medical and optional dental insurance, a bonus program, and a 401(k) plan with fixed employer contributions.
A hybrid workplace: a combination of home office and on-site (in the Jersey City area).
We know you by your first name, and don't let titles or levels withhold us from being truly aware of your talents.
Team events & fun such as team building & sports activities.

About us:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Role

The Dow Jones Customer Service (DJCS) mission is to provide great service for our customers and great experiences for our people. Our team has the privilege of delivering impactful experiences by helping our customers access the trusted news and business information published and produced by our marquee brands including, The Wall Street Journal, Barron's, MarketWatch, Dow Jones Factiva and Dow Jones Risk & Compliance. You will find that we are a collaborative group, focused on delivering excellence during every customer interaction. You will get into the weeds of a particular organizational problem but also be able to make a high-level presentation of findings to key figures throughout the organization. You will be based in our Princeton, New Jersey office and report to the Sr. Manager, Strategic Operations.

You Will:

Establish the coordination of project activities and ensure the quality, timeliness, and integrity of ongoing projects and schedules. Ensure adherence to deadlines.
Organize, lead, and facilitate project-related meetings, including the creation of agendas and preparation of materials.
Maintain detailed records and documentation of projects and develop uniform procedures for storing and keeping appropriate documentation.
Provide feedback to improve processes as appropriate.
Track project changes and produce updated schedules and calendars/timelines as required.

You Have:

1-2 years of operational experience.
Experience in B2B products and services.
Collaboration experience in a matrix environment and by leading employees and/or vendor partner resources.
Ability to manage multiple, complex, on-going tasks, and projects.
The willingness to travel 10/20%.
Recognition that operational roles of this nature involve some element of weekend oversight, plus unscheduled incident and crisis management.
Technical acumen (Preferred).
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience.
Excellent presentation and knowledge transfer skills (Desired).

Summary

Job Description
KERING BPO & Operations Excellence Analyst
Job Family: Logistics and Supply Chain
Job Title: BPO & Operations Excellence Analyst
Location: Wayne, NJ
A global Luxury group, Kering manages the development of a series of renowned Houses in Fashion, Leather Goods and Jewelry: Gucci, Saint Laurent, Bottega Veneta, Balenciaga, Alexander McQueen, Brioni, Boucheron, Pomellato, DoDo, Qeelin, as well as Kering Eyewear and Kering Beauté. By placing creativity at the heart of its strategy, Kering enables its Houses to set new limits in terms of their creative expression while crafting tomorrow’s Luxury in a sustainable and responsible way. We capture these beliefs in our signature: “Empowering Imagination”.
HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE
Project and systems management
Standardizing and harmonizing processes across all business domains
Documenting details of AS IS business processes and traits of the trade
Educating business team members on best practices employed globally within the industry
Eliminating difficulties users face in their daily routine of operations

Monitoring the performance, effectiveness, and efficiency of specific core business processes
Identifying, documenting, and testing new scenarios
Accounting for final business process design
Achieving and documenting business benefits of current and new processes
You will make sure all new systems enhancement or implementations will be consistent with current Supply-Chain and Logistics Core Model.

Propose and coordinate corrective action plans in case of underperformance or deviation from required standards.

WHO YOU ARE
3 years’ experience in process analysis, cost controlling or similar projects in Logistics or Supply Chain within a global consultancy or a multinational company, in Fashion and Luxury industry strongly preferred

Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel / Access advanced)

Ensure communication, coordination and reporting and conduct necessary meetings, as a precondition for effective and efficient repossession of equipment

All other duties as assigned

What You Need

Bachelor’s Degree required

2+ years relevant work experience

Lease asset management or equipment finance industry experience preferred

General accounting, reconciliation, finance, or related experience preferred

Who We Are:

EmpiRx Health is a disruptor in an ever-changing healthcare industry, offering a market-differentiating, value-based pharmacy benefits management solution. We are bold and fearless in our approach to healthcare, how we talk about ourselves, and our use of advanced technology and analytics.

What We Do:

We partner with HR and Benefits managers nationwide to ensure our membership has access to the best pharmacy benefits available. We place more emphasis on member care than any other PBM by focusing on health outcomes first. Our pharmacists and clinicians are at the center of everything we do―and our population health solution delivers tailored strategies for our clients. Our pharmaceutical staff daily consults with physicians to drive the greatest clinical and financial outcomes.

Employee-Centric Culture:

At EmpiRx Health, our employees are our most valuable asset. We've earned recognition as an award-winning leader in healthcare by investing in our employees. Our leadership teams drive the employee experience with a strength-based learning and development approach. By leveraging Gallup's Clifton Strengths assessment, we empower our teams to excel and unleash their full potential. We've fostered an environment where every voice is heard and talents are nurtured. At EmpiRx Health, we celebrate groundbreaking ideas, encourage collaboration, and value open dialogue and continuous improvement.

Who We're Looking For:

EmpiRx Health is in unprecedented growth, and we're seeking a highly skilled and experienced Business Operations Analyst. In this critical role, you will coordinate activities for all aspects of client operations, including program implementation and ongoing maintenance, data issue escalation and resolution, and operational reporting and analytics. The ideal candidate will be analytically curious, detail-oriented, self-directed, and collaborative.

What You'll Do:

The Business Operations Analyst role will encompass a wide range of responsibilities:

Maintain a roadmap of all active projects with high-level timelines tracking project/portfolio performance metrics to monitor business value over time.
Generate thorough documentation, i.e., process mapping, detailed business requirements, and standardized operating protocols for all processes.
Investigate complex operations-related problems/inquiries and recommend, facilitate, and coordinate solutions to ensure processes are optimized and efficient.
Evaluate emerging IT developments, applications, and evolving business/systems requirements.
Implement diverse change management strategies to successfully launch new or updated processes.
Work closely with client management to analyze technology's current and future direction to meet business goals.
Design user-friendly training documents and programs that cater to varied learning styles, facilitating easy adoption and comprehension of processes.
Conduct ongoing training for team members.
Use data analytics to detect trends, thereby bringing to light potential areas for process enhancements to light.

What You Need:

A bachelor's degree with a minimum of 5 years experience in a healthcare setting.
Innate curiosity, analytical prowess, and a knack for problem-solving and/or strategic insight.
Must take initiative, be eager to execute ideas, and be solutions-oriented.
Comfort in and adaptability with a fast-paced, dynamic environment while maintaining focus on key goals.
Ability to operate independently in an environment with competing priorities.
Razor-sharp attention to detail and exceptional written and oral communication skills

Benefits and Perks:

Our commitment to diversity is reflected in our family benefits, which include:

Comprehensive medical, prescription, vision, dental, life, and disability insurance, with coverage for domestic partnerships.
A 401K program to secure your financial future.
Parental leave for childbirth and adoption.
Student loan reimbursement.
Additional perks include flexible PTO, hybrid and remote work arrangements, online wellness resources and counseling access, and bi-weekly "take a break" sessions.

Join EmpiRx Health, where we are transforming the healthcare landscape with innovation and unwavering commitment to our employees and members. Make a difference and grow with us!

Work Environment: Hybrid in Montvale, NJ.

EmpiRx Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At EmpiRx Health, we wholeheartedly embrace the power of diversity and the magic of inclusion. The kaleidoscope of unique perspectives, backgrounds, and talents fuels our innovation and sets us apart. We're on a mission to build a team as diverse as the world we serve, where everyone is welcome and celebrated. We're not just breaking down barriers; we're actively erasing them to create an environment where opportunity knows no bounds. In unity, we find our strength and invite individuals from all walks of life to join us in our exhilarating journey to shape a brighter, more inclusive future together.

Job Description:
Senior Business Analyst, IT Financial Systems (Remote or Morristown, NJ)

Overview:

ITFS requires an experienced Business Analyst to assist on a variety of efforts related to those applications supported by ITFS as well as the interfaces into and out of them.
The workload for this position will likely be coordinated by a team lead, though the individual will be administratively reporting to management at some level.

What you will do:



Identify all impacted stakeholders (if not already provided by a PM) and gather all requirements from them as related to the assigned project
Clearly document and communicate those requirements for consumption by other team members. This may be in the traditional BRD format or in an Agile/Scrum equivalent, based on the project.
When appropriate, run Agile meetings for the team using Kanban (preferred) or Scrum
Ensure high levels of communication and transparency, demonstrating traceability and best practice
Ensure close collaboration with the lead and Assistance Vice President of IT Financial Systems knowing what to communicate and when to escalate
Work with experts to monitor performance of our production environment, and implement any necessary changes to improve it, including small fixes, and large architectural changes
Closely involved in effectively managing all non-production environments
Closely involved in ensuring our controls are adhered to (e.g. change controls)
There may be a small amount of travel, on an as needed basis, to NJ

What you will bring to C&F:



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent work experience plus minimum 3+ year related experience
Understanding of financial concepts (accounts payable, general ledger, etc.)
Knowledge of the insurance industry
A good understanding of change management and PMO practices
A solid understanding of basic project management principles
A good understanding of working with vendor-based applications
Proficiency in MS Excel
Knowledge of SQL databases and basic query writing
Strong analytical skills
Ability to build and maintain solid working relationships
Ability to be pro-active and self-direct
Excellent communication and collaboration skills and be a team player
Exceptional documentation skills
Ability to collaborate with stakeholders (business, technical, etc.) and extract and analyze business requirements

When you come to work for New Jersey Judiciary you will join an 8500-member strong TEAM that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. You will be engaged with work that has purpose, meaning and makes a difference in lives of the public we serve. We work hard every day to build the public’s trust and confidence in our court system, which includes issues such as bail reform, marijuana decriminalization and recovery court. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.

SALARY: The salary range for this position is $64,964.77 to $110,127.55 for Schedule A, and $64,964.77 to $104,621.19 for Schedule B. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range. For current Judiciary employees, salary upon promotion or advancement will be an increase of 5% of base salary, not to exceed the maximum of the range, or the minimum salary of the band/level, whichever is greater. Judiciary employees hired prior to June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule A. Newly hired individuals, and Judiciary employees hired on or after June 3, 2014, are considered Schedule B.

The Judiciary offers a strong opportunity for growth.


The New Jersey Judiciary is seeking an experienced business analyst to work under the general direction of the chief or other supervisory personnel in the Automated Trial Court Services Unit (ATCSU). This unit is primarily responsible for business analysis and user requirements gathering; workflow analysis; development of project plans; user interface; system testing; and user training and support. The unit works collaboratively with court case processing managers and staff, information technology managers and staff, and others to plan and implement large scale Judiciary information technology projects. It also provides ongoing customer support and delivers presentations, when necessary, to various customers located throughout the state. Experience with all stages of the SDLC, PEGA and Agile methodology is preferred.

REMOTE WORK: The Judiciary currently offers a hybrid work schedule, and this position may qualify for up to 3 days of remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access.

Example of Duties

Writing specifications for new applications and enhancements
Recommending process and design changes to case management systems
Analyzing business procedures, workflows, policies, and standards to identify appropriate IT solutions for the business community
Creating and managing project requirements with related project milestones and schedules; formulating reports to track/monitor project progress
Defining and documenting customer business functions and processes
Acting as a liaison between stakeholders and software development teams
Communicating and collaborating with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements in delivering business requirements documents (e.g., UI designs, screen-flow diagrams; wireframes & user interface specification documentation)
Developing test scripts and performing a variety of system and user testing across multiple platforms
Coordinating regularly with ITO and business users
Designing and conducting presentations and training sessions to internal and external customers (including judges, court staff, attorneys, and other governmental entities)
Conducting interviews to research and analyze work methods, processes, and programs
Planning, organizing, and facilitating meetings or site visits with primary stakeholders
Providing helpdesk and on-site user support
Performing other related duties as required
The selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.

Qualifications

Graduation from an accredited college or university with a Bachelor's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and one (1) year of professional experience in: analyzing, designing, programming, troubleshooting, resolving technical problems, testing, defining business requirements, training and/or installing computer systems applications OR planning, acquiring, installing and implementing telecommunications facilities and services, wide area networks, or local area networks OR generating and maintaining system software.

Substitution: Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.

A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

An Associate's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity and two (2) years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for a the required education.

An Associate's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and three years of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying may be substituted for the required education.

A Master's Degree in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity may be substituted for the required education.

Education Note: Degrees conferred outside of the United States must be evaluated by a recognized evaluation service.(See www.naces.org/members.html)

Supplemental Information

Physical Ability: For some positions, applicants must have the ability to perform work which requires climbing and prolonged standing, stretching, bending and reaching. The selected candidate must be able to frequently lift and carry supplies weighing from 30 to 50 pounds and, occasionally, materials weighing up to 75 pounds.

Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position.

Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations.

Special Note: Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information.

Residency Law: In accordance with N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary within one year must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey. Any person may request an exemption from that requirement from the Employee Residency Review Committee in the Department of Labor & Workforce Development on the basis of either hardship or employer critical need.

HOW TO APPLY:

The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.

The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey.

Job Description Summary

Job Description

We are the makers of possible


BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.


We believe that the human element, across our global teams, is what allows us to continually evolve. Join us and discover an environment in which you’ll be supported to learn, grow and become your best self. Become a maker of possible with us.

What Commercial and Customer Operations contributes to BD

The US Region at BD aims to be the preferred partner that delivers differentiated value and addresses our customers’ needs in an evolving, dynamic healthcare market.

The mission of the Commercial & Customer Operations (CCO) Center of Excellence (CoE) is to serve as a trusted strategic partner that enables the US Region and business units to drive profitable commercial growth by delivering differentiated value, enabling capabilities, and simplified processes that exceed the needs of our stakeholders and improve customer experience. CCO aims to empower and develop our associates while strengthening our inclusive & diverse culture to win as ‘One BD’.

The CCO organization operates across the entire US Region, partnering with the business units to provide and develop enabling capabilities in the areas of commercial contracting, sales enablement, and operations, inside sales, customer care operations, business & pricing analytics, master data management, commercial enablement, operational excellence, and other functions. We aim to strengthen our foundational capabilities and deliver customer value through simplification and improvement initiatives, develop, and prepare our associates, build an inclusive culture, drive digital transformation, and expand our strategic capabilities while remaining agile to the evolving needs of our customers.

Accountabilities in this role

Reporting to the Manager, Contract Operations, this position is responsible for supporting our Single Group (GPO) Affiliation Policy through execution of key activities surrounding the management of GPO (National & Regional) and/or Local agreements (including, but not limited to, Custom, Courtesy, Self-Distributors, and Non-GPO agreements, such as National Reference Labs and OEM) of BD’s Commercial Consumable Sales Contracts for all US business segments, BD Medical [Medication Delivery Solutions (MDS) & Medication Management Solutions (MMS), BD Life Sciences [Integrated Diagnostic Solutions (IDS)], and BD Interventional [Peripheral Intervention (PI), Surgery, & Urology and Critical Care (UCC)] across all customer segments (excluding Pharmaceutical Systems, BioSciences, and IDS Capital). Analyst will be responsible to ensure members are aligned appropriately to a single GPO through accurate processing of GPO Group Transitions and/or Local contract review and preparation for new and renewal agreements. Analyst will be a key point of contact for pricing and membership related internal and external inquiries.

Engaging and collaborating regularly with our Distributor Partners, GPO’s, BD Business Unit Sales, other Commercial Operations pillars, and Commercial Customers, this position will support best in class, innovative, enterprise operational capabilities and policy, process, and governance to ensure the effective implementation of complex, critical contracting activities internally, while ensuring our BD external partners and customers are in alignment with the BD strategies. Candidate must have a growth mindset, a strong desire for continuous improvement, and an “attitude for better”. Candidate should also have strong communication, technical, and organizational skills and be accountable for achieving key metrics.

There are no direct reports, but significant matrix managing required across the organization.

Essential Responsibilities

Manage and resolve large volume of external (Distributor, GPO, Customer) and internal (BD sales, commercial integration teams, & CCO cross functional teams) adhoc inquiries (phone/e-mail/Salesforce cases) in a timely manner, utilizing automation and reporting tools to proficiently review & research to meet stakeholder needs.

Understand and support business and membership strategies to effectively communicate new customer pricing eligibility on GPO and/or local agreement requests.

Facilitate and lead external/internal calls to quickly address and/or resolve stakeholder requests.

Ability to manage GPO Group Transitions, including effective collaboration with the BD Central Membership team to ensure roster alignment and effective dating is set up properly and timely for transitioning members.

Manage the removal and addition of member accounts from agreements efficiently across multiple ERP platforms (SAP Vistex, JDE), leveraging BOTs and other automation.

Prepare Dealer Notifications and notify servicing distributors of all contract pricing and membership details stemming from a Group Transition.

Document, maintain, and centralize any membership related pricing exceptions into contracting playbooks.

Effectively communicate time-sensitive membership exceptions to other cross functional teams to ensure alignment in other downstream processes to avoid financial risks (chargebacks/claims processing, compliance monitoring, etc.)

Report out any local agreements that require modifications from GPO Transitions, utilizing Power BI and/or other reporting tools. Communicate to local contracting associates GPO Transition details so they can modify their agreements to ensure accuracy in GPO Fee reporting.

Provide support/training to distributor & customer community for Customer Care Portal related pricing and contracting search related inquiries.

Ensure portal training desktop procedures are kept current.

Provide subject matter expertise to help drive the design and implementation of solutions that improve accuracy, timeliness, and efficiency in the GPO Group Transition process.

Responsible for maintaining Contract related training material and updating desktop procedures to support new system enhancements, modifications to process, etc.

Support SOX control audits: ensuring all necessary documentation is provided timely.

Collaborate with our Distributor partners on the contract loading process, including EDI 845 onboarding. Participate in any required testing and ensure completion prior to go-live.

Collaborate with our Business partners to drive continuous improvements around our GPO and/or Local contract execution and renewal processes that will help deliver sustainable results.

Collaborate with the Contract Finance Operations team on any related GPO or Local contract execution activities that can impact chargebacks processes and provide support on any necessary collaboration calls with distributors if contract execution topics arise.

Provide subject matter expertise when collaborating with our SAP & JDE IT partners; be able to clearly articulate business requirements and run point as a testing lead to ensure technology functionality and performance appropriately supports contracting activities.

Be accountable for key metrics, KPI’s (key performance indicators), SLA’s (service level agreements), and Individual Impact Goal’s to meet the strategic goals of the organization.

Create and implement opportunities to improve the overall customer experience.

Qualifications

BA/BS or equivalent experience (required)

1-3 years’ experience in commercial contract operations and/or related areas

General understanding of end-to-end commercial contract operations processes

Proficient Excel skills with the ability to manipulate large data to draw insights, utilize Data Mining tools; SAP BI, Power BI, QlikView

SAP, Vistex, & JDE ERP knowledge (preferred)

Strong communication skills.

Effectively builds and maintains strong cross-functional business partner relationships.

Analytical problem solver with business acumen.

Demonstrates a growth mindset to identify opportunities for continuous improvement to drive value.

Key Competencies

Process Effectiveness

Stakeholder Engagement

Strategic Partnership and Customer Support

Accountability and Empowerment

Analytical and Problem-Solving Orientation

Working Across Functions

Strive for Continuous Improvement

For certain roles at BD, employment is contingent upon the Company’s receipt of sufficient proof that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. In some locations, testing for COVID-19 may be available and/or required. Consistent with BD’s Workplace Accommodations Policy, requests for accommodation will be considered pursuant to applicable law.

Why Join Us?

A career at BD means being part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that encourages you to bring your authentic self to work. It’s also a place where we help each other be great, we do what’s right, we hold each other accountable, and learn and improve every day.

To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow, and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.

To learn more about BD visit https://bd.com/careers

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Business Intelligence Analyst

What does a successful Business Intelligence Analyst do at Fiserv?

The Cyber Risk Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for performing data analysis, report development, building visualizations, and improving the information portal delivery. The role will be supporting the cybersecurity organization and technology/business partners across the firm. The person will be responsible for design and development of the web portal content to guide business activity. The ideal candidate will have the curiosity and skills to investigate the data from multiple angles, conduct research and identifying trends while partnering with colleagues to match data from multiple resources to make recommendations. The candidate will have experience in building solutions based on KPIs and metrics.

What you will do:

Design, build and deploy business intelligence solutions for the organization.
Maintain and support data analytics platforms.
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting.
Collaborate with teams across the organization to manage information portal content and drive requirements for continual improvements and enhancements.
Communicate internally to collect and validate data as well as answer questions regarding reports and data.
Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Build automation and additional efficiencies into manual reporting efforts.
Helps implement new practices, processes, and procedures.
Create and maintain relevant documentation.

What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, MIS, Computer Science or equivalent and 7+ years relevant work experience
7+ years’ experience on multiple (3+) BI related projects i.e. reporting, visualization, web portal
5+ years’ experience with enterprise Power BI
2+ years’ experience with additional BI tools (Looker/Grafana/Tableau)
Experience developing and maintaining BI solutions for the organization.
Experience developing and maintaining dashboards, preparing data visualizations, and correlating data to improve decision making ability.
Experience with SharePoint online and Office 365/Power Platform tools and services (Power BI/Power Automate/Flow/Forms)
Advanced level knowledge of SQL queries, performance optimization and data warehousing design principles.
In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing, and ELT frameworks.
Gather, analyze, and translate business needs into actionable, clearly defined user stories.
Leverages Jira to track requirements, prioritize features, curate content, sequence deliverables into sprints, and report progress.

What would be great to have:

Cybersecurity KPIs and Metrics

Overview:
BUSINESS SYSTEMS SENIOR ANALYST

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

A business systems analyst is an information technology (IT) professional who specializes in analyzing, designing and implementing information systems. Business systems analysts assess the suitability of information systems in terms of their intended outcomes and liaise with end users, software vendors and programmers in order to achieve these outcomes; skilled in understanding both qualitative and quantitative data from business operations and technical software development. They must be able to analyze and synthesize that data, including business processes, business rules and data research, and data analysis, to validate needs with business. The analyst must be able to identify, collect and translate this information into documented design solutions (specifications, use cases, user stories, UI, database and API data mapping) from which the applications and solutions will be developed. Although they may be familiar with a variety of programming languages, operating systems, and computer hardware platforms, they do not normally involve themselves in the actual hardware or software development.The senior business systems analyst is an advanced senior professional, with full understanding and in-depth knowledge of their discipline and wide ranging experience who uses various concepts and in-depth evaluation to address/resolve complex business and systems needs and issues in creative and effective ways. The senior business systems analyst uses analysis and design techniques to address business needs and problems using information technology, playing a crucial role working with business and technical stakeholders to analyze current processes and business rules around processes, identifying technical solutions for future processes that could increase corporate effectiveness and efficiencies. The senior business systems analyst may provide technical guidance to other team members.

Technology and Innovation Division
As a member of City National's Technology & Innovation group, you will drive, develop, and maintain solutions for clients and colleagues. This is an exciting time of technology advancement and innovation across the bank, particularly within our technology teams.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?


Elicits requirements via interviews, facilitated requirements workshops, document analysis, surveys, customer site visits, business process analysis, work flow and task analysis, ensuring the right questions are asked to produce essential requirements information to help align business needs with a technical solution.
Performs "As Is" and "To Be" Business Process Mapping and Business Process Validation.
Identifies process improvements and provides options and technical solutions for future process design/changes that increase corporate efficiencies while considering impact and integrity of the project.
Participates in integration design approach for third party vendors products in collaboration with vendors, solutions architects, and business unit
Breaks down business needs into Epics, Features and User Stories or deliverables to optimize business value of applications and processes.
Prioritizes the User Story Backlog or Analyst Deliverables (with Business Users or Product Owner) and forecasts/schedules their time for developing the functional design specifications/User Stories (which would include UI, workflow, business rules, security and data mapping and if for a user story also the user story and acceptance criteria).
Investigates, researches, analyzes, comprehends, and validates data and data integration needs from multiple sources such as User Screens, Reports, SQL, Oracle, APIs and files.
Creates complex integration/data mapping Functional Specification documentation for vendor and/or internal development teams related to API/UI/Reports/Databases/files; documents include direct mapping, data transformation rules, data business rules and multiple data hops.
Creates functional specifications and/or user story documentation including: Functional specifications include UI/screen shots, data-mapping, business rules, edits, error handling, system access matrices/user security, process flow diagram and use cases as needed, etc. from which programs will be developed and that fit with the Bank's system architecture standards.
Works with technical teams to translate business processes and interpret business needs to them and clarify / update specifications provided to ensure proper translation/development during the Development cycles.
Provides technical direction and support to project or Agile team members during development and testing of functional specification and user stories.
Supports QA and UAT testing, clarify specifications and user stories and performs testing as needed.
Works with Business Users, Development, QA and Support teams to troubleshoot and help identify root cause of reported problems during project and post implementation warranty period and document resolutions so that development can code solution.
Provides support and guidance to other analysts.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED

Must-Have*
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent Or
Minimum 6 years experience working in a business analysis function required And
Minimum 5+ years experience working with Information technologies required And
Minimum 3 years Microsoft Office software experience required

Skills and Knowledge
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors)
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills with the ability to navigate, facilitate, negotiate, and influence across stakeholders
Knowledge of business analysis methodology and requirements tools.
Skilled in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to business needs and problems.
Thorough understanding of "business needs analysis" process and how system requirements relate to daily business operations.
Excellent analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to recognize, analyze, and solve for a variety of business needs and problems.
Skilled at writing SQL statements and very knowledgeable of SQL, Oracle, etc. databases in order to analyze or extract data to perform analysis, data validation, and establish data transformation rules.
Must have ability to read through and understand intermediate level SQL code written by others.
Works with complex data structures/models.
Knowledgeable about APIs, familiar with API tools used to validate data and skilled at mapping to and between APIs, SQL, databases, screens, files, etc.
Experienced with the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and software development methodologies (e.g. Agile, Scrum, Iterative, Waterfall, etc.)
Knowledge of systems development and integration for new technologies.
Excellent organizational and time management skills with strong ability to work independently with the ability to multi-task; work on multiple projects..
High initiative with strong desire to learn new concepts, processes and technologies
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) and SharePoint.
Able to work in a team environment on task driven work
Able to work in a structured team environment on task and timeline driven work
Ability to document existing and recommended flows using Visio (or like product) and ability to create use cases.
Strong understanding of project management methodologies and procedures

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Business Analyst will support a sub-office within the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

This full-time position is contingent upon client approval. This position is located in New Jersey.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

A. SENIOR BUSINESS ANALYST

The Senior Business Analyst shall, at a minimum, perform the following tasks:

1) Certify eligible firms for participation in various Port Authority and federal business diversity programs. These programs include the Port Authority’s Minority Owned Business (MBE), Women-owned Business Enterprise (WBE), Small Business Enterprise (SBE) programs which includes the Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Business (SDVOB) firms as well as the Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (“DBE”) and Airport Concessions Disadvantaged Business Enterprise (“ACDBE”) Federal

programs.

2) Analyze business documents, contact business owners for additional information, perform on-site visits, provide written determination on application status to applicants and update several databases.

3) Interact with interdepartmental staff such as the Law Department, Inspector General’s Office, Procurement, Engineering, Aviation, and the Secretary’s Office.

4) Ensure the confidentiality of applicant information by maintaining a secure records management system that adheres to Port Authority procedures as well as applicable federal criteria.

5) Review applications and provide written determinations and recommendations to the Certification Manager in a timely manner.

6) Be prepared to learn and utilize the certification provisions in 49 CFR Parts 23 and 26.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree
Minimum 3 years of business or financial management experience
Knowledge and experience with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, and related project/program management software
Ability to learn and apply regulatory standards as published in 49 CFR Parts 23 and 26 in determining applicants’ certification eligibility.
Demonstrate ability to research financial information using financial statements, tax returns, and other business documents; and ability to aggregate, present and document relevant findings as it relates to meeting the regulatory standards for small disadvantage business certification.
Ability to work effectively with other Port Authority offices as well as other agencies
Good customer relation skills and the ability to work independently
Excellent writing and verbal communication skills

DESIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Experience with DBE/SBE/MBE/SVDOB certification process
Experience with B2G database syste
3-5+ years of related experience
This work is anticipated to be mostly done on site.

Job Description:
The Business Systems Analyst position is part of the Data, Technology and Engineering (DTE) team, supporting Quality Systems and Vertex Innovation and External Research (VIER). This position is responsible for supporting and enhancing Vertex’s Learning Management SAAS solution provided by Cornerstone on Demand.

As Vertex works to build and enhance our existing system, we are seeking an individual who will help us research, configure, test, and document solutions to issues identified by our business stakeholders. This individual will partner with other Subject Matter Experts, both internally and via third parties. They will help us ensure that we provide a system that meets the compliance needs demanded in a validated environment while continuing to enhance Vertex’s learning ecosystem via the Learning Advancement Program.

Qualified candidates will have:
Cornerstone (or similar LMS technical experience)
GxP validation experience
System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

*** this role will not include the creating or assigning of training content ***

Key Responsibilities:
Participate in day-to-day project and support work, including analysis, documentation, configuration, testing, integration, and reporting activities.
Conduct systems analysis and configuration changes in accordance with industry Systems Lifecycle (SLC) and Vertex Change Management guidelines for a validated environment
Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements
Translate technically complex analysis into easily comprehensible terms
Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls

Minimum Qualifications/EXPERIENCE
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, or other technical discipline
Minimum 3 years of relevant experience
Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new tools based on conceptual understanding of technology
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Flexibility to adapt to a continually changing and fast paced business environment
Effective communications and presentation skills
Demonstrate an understanding of good project management practices as well as the fundamentals of the System Lifecyle (SLC) and Information Technology operational practices
Familiar with Microsoft Office products (e.g. Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote)
Experience administering Cornerstone on Demand preferred
Experience with Learning Management Systems preferred
Pharmaceutical industry experience including GxP requirements preferred
Proficiency leveraging analytical languages and tools preferred (e.g. SQL, PowerBI)

$80-$90/hr

Overview

Kanter Auto is seeking an entrepreneurial and data-driven Operations Analyst to join our team. We are recently under new ownership, and our new CEO is focused on modernizing and optimizing our operations to support significant growth. You'll work closely with him to implement new systems, simplify processes, eliminate waste, and build a strong foundation of operational data. You will be given the opportunity to identify and launch projects independently and will have a major impact on our company's performance.

If you want to learn about all the operational aspects of running and growing a high-performance eCommerce business, this is the opportunity for you.

About Kanter Auto

Welcome to our company – an iconic name in the vintage automotive parts and accessories industry for the past sixty years. As of June 2023, we are proud to announce that we are under new ownership, embarking on an exciting new chapter of growth and innovation.

Our legacy as a retailer has been built on providing high-quality parts and unmatched expertise in the classic car market. If you are passionate about operational excellence and want to be part of a company that is dedicated to serving the vintage parts market with renewed energy and vision, come join us on this exciting journey of transformation and advancement. Together, we can shape the future of the aftermarket parts industry.

Who we're looking for:

To be a great fit for this job, you must have:

Previous experience establishing new processes and systems. Previous consulting experience strongly preferred, but not required. (Our new CEO is a previous Accenture consultant and the owner of another successful ecommerce company.)
A data-driven mindset and very strong familiarity with Excel (VLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH). You know how to structure datasets in order to derive insights and solve business problems.
The ability to dive in, analyze the current process, and quickly develop an understanding of how to improve things. You are a very fast learner.
Very strong general familiarity with technology. You do not need to be an expert in warehouse and operational systems, but you need to be very comfortable with learning new systems and doing some configuration yourself. You know what an API is. Netsuite or other ERP knowledge is a plus.
Excellent analytical and process skills. For example, you can set up a lightweight, efficient system to capture weights and dimensions, barcode, and take eCommerce photos for thousands of products that will run well without your constant involvement.

Had you been with us last month, you would have…

Built an Excel model for forecasting inventory purchasing based on data from an old ERP that requires significant analysis to correct the data.
Reviewed our vendors by category and identified critical sourcing projects that must be started.
Assessed our site technology needs (workstations, networking, security) and managed the project from quote through implementation.
Assisted with our Netsuite ERP implementation by gathering data, analyzing current processes to determine requirements, and learning the system.
Received the instruction “we need to barcode our products” and figured out a plan how to make that happen, from beginning to end, for tens of thousands of items.

If you work with us, within the next two years it's likely that you'll:

Lead an assessment project to plan a move to a more modern warehouse facility.
Develop a process to systematically review and process more than 100,000 square feet of vintage auto parts, working with partners in eCommerce and wholesale sales to make them available for sale.
Implement strict inventory control procedures by improving receiving, shipping, and implementing periodic inventory counts.
Set up a large-scale process for capturing product weights, dimensions, and product photography for tens of thousands of products.
Visit other companies to learn about best practices that can be implemented in our facility

Qualities that will make you a good fit for Kanter Auto:

Technology Fluency. You can learn a new application faster than almost anyone around you.
Independence and Efficiency. You get things done faster than your peers and are always improving your execution. You have the right information at your fingertips because you planned in advance. You can independently manage a huge backlog by identifying actions from high-level objectives and prioritizing intelligently. You follow through on all your commitments, on time.
Humility. If it's part of running and building the business, nothing is outside your job description. And that's something you value and appreciate.
Respect. We treat customers, vendors, and each other with tremendous respect and sincere appreciation. They are people first, and business partners second.
Balanced Intensity. You approach your work with intensity, but you're an easy person to be around.
Clear Communication. Clear, concise, and professional written and verbal communication skills. You get your point across effectively and know how to focus on the right things.

Benefits:

Flexible Schedule
Paid Holidays
Vacation, Sick and Personal time.
Health, Dental and Vision benefits.
401(k)

Overview

Responsibilities

Represents the department on business and technology projects.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Robertet is the world's leading source of natural, sustainable and organic ingredients and is one of the oldest fragrance and flavor companies in the world. Robertet is a world-renowned innovator in scent and taste with a global reach represented in over 50 countries, 14 manufacturing sites on 3 continents, 3 R&D innovation centers and 12 creative centers.

Robertet is the only fragrance, flavor and ingredient company fully integrated at each step of the creation process, from the source ingredient to the final fragrance and flavor. Founded in 1850 in Grasse, France, Robertet continues to be privately owned and managed by the fourth generation of family members. With a passion for and unparalleled understanding of naturals, together with boundless creativity and market insight, allows Robertet to provide their customers with world class innovation in scent and taste.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Business Systems Analyst II provides application support, business requirements analysis, pre-project planning, and project management for the community of users in a specific business department or division within the company, related to the Pre-Sales, Regulatory and Compliance systems. With experience in other application suites and strong project management background, s/he will also support applications outside of her/his designated support areas.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Serve as a primary contact for a designated community of users.
Performs functional and technical first and second level support for applications and systems, analyzing and solving incidents and problems, identifying root causes, and reporting critical issues to the management.
Coordinates delivery of the following services: gathering requirements, taking, and following up user requests, translating business requirements into functional and technical specifications, suggesting process improvements, and supervising user acceptance testing.
Manages business analysis for change requests and projects by overseeing and collaborating closely with the business stakeholders to understand business needs, processes, and data sources.
Translates the business needs into clearly defined deliverables:
Develops detailed requirements and project plans.
Develops functional specifications and use cases.
Obtains consensus and sign-off on deliverables.
Writes and coordinates UAT plans and execution.
Serves as the conduit with software development and technical teams.
Transitions changes and application to operational mode and people.
Participates in incident resolution, data extraction and other operational activities in support of specific business applications.
Chairs or moderates’ meetings with business users and It personnel for defining, prioritizing and resolving requests (day-to-day or project-related)
Advise super-users on application usage, finds, and proposes workarounds when appropriate.
Prepares proposals, including cost & benefit analysis, for larger change requests or small/medium projects.
Manages the prioritization process for business IT requests in line with Business and IT strategy.
Prepares and plans projects and manages delivery with business stakeholders, IT colleagues and external consultants/programmers.
Manages workload according to defined KPIs (Key Performance Indicators)
When needed, acts as a Project Leader for medium/larger projects.


COMPETENCIES:

Strong IT background both technical and as a generalist
Experience with ProductVision software application or similar Pre-Sales application
Experience with WERCS or similar GHS SDS application
Experience with Compliance software suites
Strong analytical skills and ability to deal efficiently with complex or multi-functional issues.
Good knowledge of business process analysis techniques and tools
Good project management skills and experience with Microsoft project or similar tool
Experience in preparing project charters and working with business to develop benefits cases.
