Overview:
Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.


At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.
Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.

The Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst is responsible for matching potential technology solutions with defined business needs for incoming IT project requests for the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. Provides quick response to business partners and facilitates getting the correct information for the Project Intake Process by working with the operational requestors, internal Information Technology (IT) division team members, and outside vendors. This includes ensuring that sufficient information regarding the high level project scope and level of effort is collected to allow requests to be reviewed by the appropriate governance team for approval, rejection, or additional scoping.

This position is hybrid with 2-4 times per month onsite. Ideal candidates should be able to pivot quickly to be onsite if the need arises.

The ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience in gathering requirements for new/existing projects and has experience in the Healthcare industry.
Responsibilities:
A day in the life of a Information Technology (IT) Solutions Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
Liaise between the IT division, business and clinical operational areas, and technology vendors.
Understand current technology portfolio and standards across the network.
Recognize the need to develop a new technology standard.
Analyze business needs to understand requested project scope.
Assess IT resource needs and level of effort to support requested project scope.
Collaborate with Business Analyst to develop high level project cost information to inform the appropriate IT governing bodies.
Analyze the design of technical systems and business models.
Match technological solutions to business needs.
Produce reports on project intake queues and escalate as needed to eliminate delays in the intake process.
Analyze data to inform business decisions.
Assist with preparing and delivering project request presentations to appropriate IT governing bodies.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, business, management information systems, or other related field; or equivalent relevant experience may be accepted in lieu of a degree.
Minimum of 3 years of proven business analyst experience with a focus on project intake, resource estimation, demand management, project scoping or requirements definition.
Experience in facilitation of meetings related to project definition, reviews, decision-making, and other project related topics.
Working experience with deployments of production business or clinical applications, including in-house applications and third-party SaaS applications.
Experience with vendor management and communication.
Strong communication and presentation skills (oral and written) to shape messages to the appropriate level of audience.
Excellent problem-solving ability and critical thinking skills.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Ability to understand complex business flows.
Ability to communicate complex technical information in an easy-to-understand way.
Strong organizational and project definition/scoping skills.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Experience in the Healthcare industry.
Experience with researching technology solutions.
Knowledge and ability to effectively utilize project portfolio management tools and Microsoft Office and/or Google Workplace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Forms).
Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies.
Licenses and Certifications Preferred:
PMI Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or equivalent certification.
If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

What are we looking for?
Ideally the analyst produces logic models which involves working across multiple internal technical platforms and following predefined procedures/standard operating procedures. Steps include gathering and vetting business requirements (speaking with stakeholders to confirm scope), creating data ingests (integrate 3rd party APIs), data storage & transformation (RegEx or Boolean logic to filter/manipulate/clean data) and testing/validation (annotating output for accuracy). While this role does have technical aspects, it is not a pure coding role; the ideal candidate will have a mixture of technical and content/R&D knowledge (backgrounds in journalism, news, research, political science, etc are extremely helpful).

The analyst will be expected to work on multiple projects concurrently, balance competing priorities, and communicate progress/blockers clearly with managers and stakeholders. The BTA will require significant training and in-role support before they are productive (2-3 months), so we would want contracts in place to ensure candidates are able to deliver a minimum commitment in return (e.g., 24-36 months). Also, this person will be treated as part of our team, and there will be open communication channels with managers/stakeholders - but we want the BTA to be capable of getting to the point of independent/autonomous working within 6-12 months.

Solid understanding of oriented programming, design patterns, data structures, and algorithms and expertise in Google Sheets
Advanced proficiency with Excel/Google Sheet (e.g., nested formulas, pivot tables, text manipulation) and other technical concepts (e.g., RegEx, Rest APIs)
Experience or demonstrated interest in handling large data sets
Strong communication and collaboration skills
Very strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail, highly organized and process oriented
Ability to work independently with clear direction but minimal support, and communicate progress/blockers
English language proficiency must be strong - especially reading/writing
Eagerness to learn, patience, and ability to adapt to changing processes
Desirable: experience operating in a content/social media/news environment. Backgrounds in journalism, social media analysis, news, research, political science, etc are extremely helpful - even if experience is light.

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Possible.

The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz , Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.

We’re currently working with a $250M consumer goods distributor that is looking to grow another 10% this year. As they continue to expand, they are looking to add a member of the team that can help warehouse operations generate and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and improve operational effectiveness.




Position Description:




Develop and maintain KPIs to measure operational effectiveness and efficiency across a network of 5 warehouses.
Collect and analyze data related to warehouse operations such as inventory levels, order volumes, pick / pack efficiency, and labor utilization. Identify patterns, trends, and areas for improvement based on data analysis.
Evaluate existing warehouse processes and workflows to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement in areas such as order processing time, order accuracy, and customer satisfaction.
Extract and analyze data from warehouse management systems (WMS) to identify trends and areas for optimization.
Utilize data modeling techniques and advanced Excel skills to create models, charts, and graphs that effectively communicate complex data sets to business stakeholders.
Provide training and support to warehouse staff on process changes, system updates, and best practices.
Ensure the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of data by implementing quality control measures and data validation techniques.



Background Required:




Highly energetic individual with at least 3 years of supply chain analytics experience in a warehouse environment.
Advanced experience leveraging data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.), SQL and Excel.
Working knowledge of WMS and ERP applications.
Proven track record of success in similar role.



Miscellaneous:

Compensation: $75,000 – $115,000 + bonus.
Full benefit package including medical, dental and 401(k).

Summary:

The Deployment Senior Analyst, Digital Identification & Traceability, will be a key role in the DI&T Department within the Johnson & Johnson Supply Chain organization, and report to the Regional Deployment Manager. This role will be responsible for supporting the execution of different programs within the Unique Device Identification (UDI) Capability in Johnson & Johnson, with a primary alignment to our MDR Program. The resource will serve as a point of contact and have day-to-day operational interaction with our Supply Chain partners, multiple business franchises and other functions as we execute our UDI Registration Readiness & Post Registration activities in support of the MDR program.


Responsibilities:

Geographic Breadth
Regional (EMEA) support for primarily UDI, supporting as required our wider DI&T base business activities in the area of Serialization & GDS, and emerging product identification and tracking capabilities
Supporting global DI&T initiatives including shared systems and overlapping synergies to drive standardization and compliance
Business Breadth – All segments (Pharma, Consumer and Med Devices), End-to-End SC functions (Plan, Source, Make, Deliver, Quality), Commercial, IT, Data, Regulatory Affairs and Finance.
Levels of influence – Peers, Managers, Directors on a Global & Regional basis. Key Responsibilities:
UDI EUDAMED Registration Readiness & Post Registration activities such as o EUDAMED Playground testing for all subsequent UDI & regression testing upon the release of other modules
Company submission solution (STUDIO) testing for inflight releases
Test Script documentation, execution and impact assessment on variations, data seeding
DI&T EMEA documentation development & Global documentation as required
Supporting Franchise Registration readiness activities including data issue resolution & if required, training delivery
Hypercare & ownership of EMEA UDI helpdesk tickets as Franchises transition to Base business
Process mapping o BUDI Generation Support to support increase in requests triggered by MDR o Assist Franchises to stay in sync with requirements when new data requirements and process changes arise
Partner with business leaders, Johnson & Johnson Technology, Commercial, MAKE and DELIVER organizations to provide the highest level of data quality and enable efficient digital strategies for our customers.
Own specific tasks as part of larger projects to ensure timely and within budget delivery while coordinating tasks across functions and geographies.
Support the DI&T Product Owner teams, (UDI and GDSN), in the development of strategy, scope and plans for new market regulations, compliance requirements & data delivery requests to both create and take advantage of data enabled opportunities.
Constantly driving our regulatory UDI compliance strategy within the Company Supply Chain to ensure key milestones are met for regional compliance to the laws and statutes relating to Serialization and UDI. ﻿

Qualifications:

A minimum of a bachelor’s degree.
A minimum of four (4) years of relevant business experience.
Supply Chain experience.
Ability to execute project tasks independently
Ability to build and drive progression of business metrics.
Ability to work in a cross-functional environment within a global supply chain.
Ability to lead and influence others in a sophisticated matrix organization.
Experience with standard MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint & Excel)
Excellent analytical skills & attention to detail
Excellent communication skills (written, oral, and presentation).
Ability to develop relationships and encourage confidence and trust from partners at all levels both internal as external.
This role may require up domestic and international travel on an exception basis.
Experience writing SOPs using good documentation practices
Experience with requirements definition & test script definition and execution an advantage
Past experience synthesizing large quantities of process and data/technical information and communicating clear recommendations to multiple organizational levels.
Some understanding of Serialization, UDI and/or GDS, with exposure to industry standards such as GS1 (Global Standards organization) being an advantage

Job Title: Specialty Payments Business Analyst - Accounts Payable
Job Description:
Since 1869 we've connected people through food they love. Our history was created by remarkable people, ideas, and innovations. It serves as inspiration and foundation for our future success. We’re proud to be stewards of amazing brands that people trust. We foster a culture of belonging where people come first, and diversity is embraced. And we live our values, always, while setting the highest standards for performance.
Here, you will make a difference every day. You will be part of a dynamic, collaborative, and competitive team. You will be supported to build a rewarding career with opportunities to grow, innovate and inspire. Make history with us.
What role will you play? How will you make history with Campbell’s? Apply today!
General Summary
The Specialty Payments Business Analyst will support and maintain the customer payments activities as well as be a back-up to the Travel & Expense Business Analyst. This position will assist with several specialty payment allowances and work on a team with 3 other employees at WHQ in Camden, NJ. The job includes setting up several SAP rebates along with establishing ACH payments for customers by working with the master data team and internal business partners. The analyst will review and approve invoices to be paid to our brokers and review manual rebate accruals on a monthly basis. Monthly reconciliations will be reviewed for the broker payments to ensure there are no differences and if so, research accordingly.
Primary Responsibilities
30% - Work with master data to set up rebates in SAP for a variety of specialty payment allowances per the business requirements, make changes timely when needed as well as calculate any missed allowances. Final settle rebates on a semi-annual basis.
10% - Assist with the specialty payment allowances process (mostly for broker commissions) and review the monthly payment logs to ensure completeness and process broker invoices timely upon receipt.
10% - Broker control report monthly reconciliations across several business units.
5% - Work on iDoc errors associated with E4 payments (trade system).
15% - Assist with various Travel & Expense payments and be a back-up when required.
10% - Handle returned check/ACH payments and mail checks to customers that require special handling via FedEx.
10% - Set up ACH payments for customers that would like to receive their payments electronically.
5% - Assist in projects as they arise.
5% - Prepare journal entries at month-end.
Complexity & Scope
Set-up and maintain all rebates for specialty payment allowances.
Review the payment exceptions for payments that failed.
Review and update payment logs.
Assist with various business requests to provide payment information.
Handle mailing of checks or customer refund deposits.
Monthly review of the broker commission process and various research when requested by broker.
Documentation and updates of desk-top procedures.
Work on special projects as they arise.
Minimum Requirements
Associates or Bachelor’s Degree required.
5+ years of accounts payable experience is required, and knowledge of SAP rebate functionality is a plus.
Must possess good customer service and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize and work independently as well as work on urgent issues when they arise throughout the workday.
Some accounting background is preferred.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to follow through to resolution on issues.
Ability to communicate effectively and establish value-added working relationships with internal and external customers.
Software: Must have a working knowledge of Microsoft products and knowledge of SAP rebate functionality is a plus.

Compensation and Benefits:
The base salary range for this full-time, salaried position is between
$0.00 - $0.00
Individual base pay depends on work location and additional factors such as experience, job-related skills, and relevant education or training. Total pay may include other forms of compensation. In addition, we offer competitive health, dental, 401k and wellness benefits beginning on the first day of employment. Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner for more information about our total rewards package.

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Payment Management Specialist

What does a successful Payment Management Specialist do at Fiserv?

A Payment Management Specialist designs and maintains the business rules that facilitate processing of bill payments.


What you will do:

As a Payment Management Specialist, you will work independently and be responsible for managing and completing variety of work assignments in support of clients and payment processing.

Implement new clients for electronic bill payments as well as perform maintenance of existing payment processing rules.
Research and analyze existing business rules and consumer payment behavior to optimize electronic payment remittance and payment accuracy.
Work externally with clients and collaborate internally with different business partners in completion of projects.

Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our company's IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Associate Director, Product/Business Analyst is a critical role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will be responsible for driving business outcomes through the effective analysis of business needs and the development of innovative digital and technology solutions. The Associate Director will report to the Director, Business of IT (BIT) and will play a key role in the execution of this program.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into clearly defined requirements and user stories.

Lead the analysis of existing business processes to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.

Analyze stakeholder groups and design user personas to focus on the business needs and the customer journeys that helps optimize for optimal results.

Identify the change impacts across the various projects and epics within the program; facilitate and support organizational change as appropriate.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and develop innovative digital and technology solutions that align with business objectives.

Conduct market research and analysis to identify industry trends and best practices that can inform the development of new products and services.

Drive the execution of projects by managing timelines, resources, and budgets and ensuring deliverables are met.

Provide leadership and guidance to a team of business analysts to ensure successful project delivery and stakeholder satisfaction.

Build strong relationships with key stakeholders and act as a trusted advisor on digital and technology strategy.

Stay up to date on emerging technologies and industry trends to inform strategic decision-making.

Participate in the development and execution of training programs to enable stakeholders to effectively utilize new digital and technology solutions.

Travel will be required (~10%).

Education Minimum Requirement:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Management, Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.

Required Experience and Skills:

Minimum of 8 years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Strong understanding of business process design and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.

Strong understanding of how develop various requirements and user stories.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Flexible and adaptable to changing demands with the ability to refocus the team to the right priorities.

Strong leadership and project management skills, with a demonstrated ability to successfully deliver projects on time and within budget.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Experience in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry.

Understanding of business architecture and business process modeling notation.

Experience with design thinking and user-focused design (e.g., wireframing, composites, interaction design, page flow diagramming, data flow diagramming)

Strong understanding of organizational change management principles and concepts.

Application development experience – especially front-end development.

Experience with usability assessments and heuristic evaluations.

Experience with agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA.

Familiarity with emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and blockchain.

Experience in leading or managing a team within a product organization.

U.S. Hybrid Work Model

Effective September 5, 2023, employees in office-based positions in the U.S. will be working a Hybrid work consisting of three total days on-site per week, generally Tuesday, Wednesday and either Monday or Thursday, although the specific days may vary by site or organization, with Friday designated as a remote-working day, unless business critical tasks require an on-site presence. This Hybrid work model does not apply to, and daily in-person attendance is required for, field-based positions; facility-based, manufacturing-based, or research-based positions where the work to be performed is located at a Company site; positions covered by a collective-bargaining agreement (unless the agreement provides for hybrid work); or any other position for which the Company has determined the job requirements cannot be reasonably met working remotely. Please note, this Hybrid work model guidance also does not apply to roles that have been designated as “remote”.

Overview
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is a leading national research university and the state of New Jersey’s preeminent, comprehensive public institution of higher education. Posting Summary
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey is seeking a Business System Analyst II in Office of Information Technology – Enterprise Application Services at Rutgers Central Administration.

Reporting to the Senior Business Manager of the OIT-Administrative Systems, this position is responsible for the functional administration of Oracle ERP Cloud system. Responsibilities include the design, testing, implementation, monitoring, evaluation, updates, and end-user support of all automated and manual financial accounting systems. The Business Systems Analyst II will assess complex financial system needs; create a blueprint to align business requirements with system capabilities; and independently develop and implement a wide range of innovative solutions. Will also create, maintain and develop configurations and system set-ups for Oracle ERP Cloud based on business needs and requirements; support Communications and Training team with University Controllers Office by providing subject matter expertise with
regard to Oracle ERP Cloud.

Among the key duties of this position are the following:
Evaluates business requirements and works with university-wide end-user committees to determine solutions as business needs evolve and financial systems change.
Configures financial system modules to optimize all aspects of the Oracle ERP Cloud, including but not limited to develop, update and implement complex sub-ledger accounting (SLA) rules for accurate accounting between Sub-Ledgers and General Ledger. Keeps all configuration documents up to date with the changes.
Produces and maintains general configurations such as banks, bank branches, payment document numbers, profile options and transaction codes for Cash Management.
Maintains internal tracking systems (ie. Jira) to notate any configuration changes, test results and approvals for production migration.
Assists/Performs month-end close.
Researches and evaluates the need for potential new and/or additional modules, applications or upgrades and provides recommendations to help improve business processes.
Evaluates and tests Oracle monthly patches, quarterly and semi-annual upgrades for overall functionality with concentration on configurations. Continuous assessment of all configurations across modules and tests all updates and upgrades in a test environment for functionality, fixed issues, problems, enhancements and/or overall system changes.
Collaborates with staff from various departments, including Procurement, Accounts Payable, Expense Reporting, Grant & Contract Accounting, Payroll and Student Financial Services to ensure data flows from one module to another as expected via system integration and accounting rolls-up properly.
Provides timely end-user support, tracks issues, and communicates resolutions to end users.
Resolves the more complex customer-service issues that require higher-level support. Provides feedback to end-user and temporary work-around solutions for multifaceted issues.

Overview:
This position supports the analysis, enhancement, and maintenance of technologies, systems, and data in the Undergraduate Financial Aid and Student Employment Office. Reporting to the Strategic IT and Data Manager, it is responsible for developing and maintaining business documentation and supporting senior aid staff and University leadership in meeting federal, institutional and state requirements related to financial aid. This position requires strong analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with functional staff to document and understand business needs and develop requirements. This includes assisting in identifying gaps in business process, highlighting items for further analysis, and eliciting requirements for new functionality. This position will also work with the aid compliance team to understand annual state and federal rule changes and their downstream impact, and assist the Strategic IT and data manager to prioritize the business process needs of the office.
Work with teams within the Office of Information Technology to translate functional business requirements using the Agile project methodology and/or through the Microsoft Teams Platform. This includes authoring user stories, creating and managing tasks in JIRA, managing the functional side of bi-weekly sprint reviews, and evaluating SFP and PUM release information to help identify impacts on Student Financial Planning (SFP).
Create necessary business documentation, including requirements for both functional and OIT staff. This position tests updates and new features in FA DEV, QA and production environments, as well as creates and maintains business process guides.
Supports the Strategic IT and Data Manager in defining reporting requirements, updating report logic, and creating new reporting to support functional needs. This position also attends University wide meetings and is responsible for maintaining awareness of best practices/approaches related to the business analysis discipline.


Qualifications:
Essential requirements:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems or equivalent work experience.
5-7 years of Business Analyst experience.
Experience in translating business requirements into functional and technical language/documents.
Proven strong contributor with excellent verbal/written communication skills
Proficient in mapping business rules to processes
Ability to elicit, interpret and analyze functional requirement documents for highly complex business processes
Preferred requirements:
Experience with Agile methodology, and the usage of JIRA for story writing and project tracking.
Experience in higher education
SQL
Knowledge of report writing

Job Description:

In this role you will be a part of a dynamic team that works closely with the business units to gain in-depth understanding of business processes and identify opportunities and strategies to improve business efficiency. To be successful as a senior business analyst, you are able to lead small to mid-size projects and assist project managers on larger more complex projects.


What you will do:
Review business processes and identify opportunities and strategies to improve business efficiency
Document business processes a simple, clear concise manner
Identify, recommend and deliver innovative solutions
Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards
Present requirements using standard templates and alternative views, such as visual analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or simulations, where appropriate
Document and organize the business need in the form of User Stories and Acceptance Criteria
Facilitate ongoing requirements prioritization; perform project manager role for medium to large sized projects
Ensure other squad members have a clear understanding of the business need and requirements
Follow Agile and/or Kanban Practices with the use of JIRA and Confluence
Perform peer reviews of work products derived from requirements specifications to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly
Prepare and execute UAT test plans
Manage changes to baseline requirements through effective and appropriate application of change control processes and tools
Identify ways to reuse requirements across projects
Participate in development of project charters, including sizing the effort and cost benefit analysis
Mentor and oversee Interns and Trainees

Bachelor's degree preferred
5+ years work experience preferred
Exceptional analytical, conceptual thinking and problem solving skills, multi-tasking abilities
Excellent Microsoft skills (Excel, Word and Visio)
Excellent verbal, writing, interviewing, presentation and communication skills
Strong organization, planning and time management skills
Ability to work independently with moderate supervision
Experience with Requirements/Change Management, Impact Analysis and Gap Analysis
Experience working with onshore/offshore teams a plus
Accident & Health or Property & Casualty Insurance experience a plus
Bilingual, in Spanish, preferred.

The Technical Business Analyst, (BA), will be responsible for owning the overall design of assigned technical projects (custom or product strategy) as well as recommending best practices for solutions based on client business needs.

This role as a Technical Business Analyst will require strategic design and mapping of business requirements and solutions to system/technical requirements. An individual filling the Technical Business Analyst role should be comfortable being introduced during a pre-sales engagement.

The Technical Business Analyst will also be responsible for writing a technical specifications (for custom development, system integration, etc.) based on interactions directly with the customer and professional services team.

These specifications will need to be precise and clear as the Technical Business Analyst will delegate some work to fellow team members such as developers, consultants, or product support / documentation. Ideally the Technical Business Analyst is engaged in best practice development initiatives, provides thoughtful leadership, and familiarity with proven cloud solutions that support vertical objectives. Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our company's IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Associate Director, Product/Business Analyst is a critical role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will be responsible for driving business outcomes through the effective analysis of business needs and the development of innovative digital and technology solutions. The Associate Director will report to the Director, Business of IT (BIT) and will play a key role in the execution of this program.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into clearly defined requirements and user stories.

Lead the analysis of existing business processes to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization.

Analyze stakeholder groups and design user personas to focus on the business needs and the customer journeys that helps optimize for optimal results.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to design and develop innovative digital and technology solutions that align with business objectives.

Conduct market research and analysis to identify industry trends and best practices that can inform the development of new products and services.

Drive the execution of projects by managing timelines, resources, and budgets and ensuring deliverables are met.

Provide leadership and guidance to a team of business analysts to ensure successful project delivery and stakeholder satisfaction.

Build strong relationships with key stakeholders and act as a trusted advisor on digital and technology strategy.

Stay up to date on emerging technologies and industry trends to inform strategic decision-making.

Participate in the development and execution of training programs to enable stakeholders to effectively utilize new digital and technology solutions.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Strong understanding of business process design and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.

Strong understanding of how develop various requirements and user stories.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Flexible and adaptable to changing demands with the ability to refocus the team to the right priorities.

Strong leadership and project management skills, with a demonstrated ability to successfully deliver projects on time and within budget.

Application development experience – especially front-end development.

The Opportunity

LDS Senior Business Analysts drive business thinking to inform future state digital transformations by:

Applying business acumen to assess client business strategies, goals, programs and operations
Evaluating and scoping current work design and proposing changes in context of recommended digital business strategies that lead to business design solutions
Modeling business concepts and identifying innovation opportunities
Translating analysis into business-centered design solution models and requirements, including organizational development and new work design
Creating functional models and descriptions that drive digital business design
Your Success

To be successful in this role, you should have:

7-10 years of experience with a strong record of creating impactful analyses, preferably in Management Consulting
A degree in a related field, strong consideration for advanced degrees and organizational design backgrounds
Research and analysis experience with industry and emerging trends and make informed recommendations for digital business design solutions
An ability to effectively define the business context and ecosystems in which digital enterprise solutions exist
Experience evaluating client information; ability to summarize and model the strategy, goals, programs and operations
Experience creating business requirements that support business strategy
The ability to lead discussions on strategy, business design and solution requirements and feel comfortable facilitating internal and client meetings and stakeholder interviews
The mindset of a creative thinker and problem solver with a strong analytical mindset
Experience effectively partnering with C-suite executives, solution stakeholders and SMEs, as well as with consultants in other LDS disciplines (e.g., user experience, technology architecture, content strategy, visual design)
The Teams

Working with our partners in business strategy, content, technology/engineering and visual design, we infuse new work models and behaviors that inform future state digital transformations. Our team is made up of multi-disciplined, like-minded, creative individuals who share a passion for elegant and thoughtful experiences for enterprise consumers.

Our design solutions are realized through a collaborative process of exploration, rationalization, and evolution. We apply industry and LDS best practices to business strategy, user experience and visual design, creating experiences that align to our clients’ strategic business goals and express the essence of their brand though highly visual and visceral interfaces.

Perform detailed analysis on assigned projects, recommend potential business solutions and assist with implementation
Identify ways to enhance performance management and operational reports related to new business implementation processes
Develop and incorporate organizational best practices into business applications
Lead problem solving and coordination efforts between various business units
Assist with formulating and updating departmental policies and procedures

Control and Operations (COG) Analyst is responsible for assisting Managers, FCC COG to achieve department goals. Analyst will work closely with FCCA Investigations and FCIU, perform Quality Checks, assist with information sharing, and transactional searches as well as help to maintain cases in Enterprise Case Management system (ECM). Analyst is responsible to complete assigned work in the timely manner, collaborate and maintain effective communication within the team.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for data entry and gathering, as well as preparation of various reports and presentations.
Responsible for conducting research and complex transactional analyses.
Responsible for conducting Suspicious Activity Reports (SAR) Quality Control (QC) and timely filing with FinCEN.
Help to ensure proper case management in ECM, assist with case closures and proper documentation retention.
Assist with information sharing between various stake holders including external entities and regulatory bodies.
Understand and properly escalate Cyber Related Risk, draft, and file Cyber SARs.
Assist with various requests to gather data for internal stake holders as well as external.
Ensure that the Controls Operations Group is in compliance with the Operational Risk Framework for U.S. FCC Controls, raising items of concern to the Head of Controls Operations and logging risk items in relevant Bank systems (e.g. M7) as deemed appropriate.
Lead the Quality & Risk team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Operation of Financial Markets; Financial Crime Prevention; The Right Environment.
Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate, and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.

Our Ideal Candidate

Bachelor’s degree in business, Finance, Economics, Economic Crime Investigation, or related field of study, from an accredited institution, or equivalent qualification.
1-2 years of experience in a large multinational financial institution, consulting firm or law firm, or similar years of operations experience in correspondent banking.
Demonstrates an understanding of the key products or services provided by the business / function, and understanding of compliance regulations, knowledge of global procedures and policies, including a core understanding in AML, Sanctions, CDD or Anti Bribery.
Proven capability to conduct open-source research and leverage Bank internal data sources to assist in building composite analytical products. Proficiency in Micro Strategy and advanced knowledge of Excel.
Has the ability to interpret complex information and determine the research and analysis required to extract facts that can be objectively supported.
CAMS certification preferred.
Clear, concise communication style (written and verbal)
Self-motivated - Strong work orientation, works independently
Collaborative - Actively collaborate within and across teams
Personal Agility - Agile and receptive to change. Positive and solutions oriented

Compliance Policies and Standards
Compliance Advisory
Compliance Review and FCC Assurance
Surveillance (including Screening and Monitoring)
Investigations
Compliance Risk Assessment
Regulatory Liaison
Manage Change
Manage Projects

Job Description:
Crum & Forster Company Overview:

Crum & Forster (C&F), with a proud history dating to 1822, provides specialty and standard commercial lines insurance products through our admitted and surplus lines insurance companies. C&F enjoys a financial strength rating of "A" (Excellent) by AM Best and is proud of our superior customer service platform. Our claims and risk engineering services are recognized as among the best in the industry.

Our most valuable asset is our people: more than 2000 employees in locations throughout the United States. The company is increasingly winning recognition as a great place to work, earning several workplace and wellness awards, including the October 2022 Great Place to Work® Award for our employee-first focus and our steadfast commitment to diversity, equity and Inclusion.

C&F is part of Fairfax Financial Holdings, a global, billion dollar organization. For more information about Crum & Forster, please visit our website: www.cfins.com.



Job Description:
Senior Business Analyst, IT Financial Systems (Remote or Morristown, NJ)

Overview:

ITFS requires an experienced Business Analyst to assist on a variety of efforts related to those applications supported by ITFS as well as the interfaces into and out of them.
The workload for this position will likely be coordinated by a team lead, though the individual will be administratively reporting to management at some level.

What you will do:



Identify all impacted stakeholders (if not already provided by a PM) and gather all requirements from them as related to the assigned project
Clearly document and communicate those requirements for consumption by other team members. This may be in the traditional BRD format or in an Agile/Scrum equivalent, based on the project.
When appropriate, run Agile meetings for the team using Kanban (preferred) or Scrum
Ensure high levels of communication and transparency, demonstrating traceability and best practice
Ensure close collaboration with the lead and Assistance Vice President of IT Financial Systems knowing what to communicate and when to escalate
Work with experts to monitor performance of our production environment, and implement any necessary changes to improve it, including small fixes, and large architectural changes
Closely involved in effectively managing all non-production environments
Closely involved in ensuring our controls are adhered to (e.g. change controls)
There may be a small amount of travel, on an as needed basis, to NJ

What you will bring to C&F:



Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent work experience plus minimum 3+ year related experience
Understanding of financial concepts (accounts payable, general ledger, etc.)
Knowledge of the insurance industry
A good understanding of change management and PMO practices
A solid understanding of basic project management principles
A good understanding of working with vendor-based applications
Proficiency in MS Excel
Knowledge of SQL databases and basic query writing
Strong analytical skills
Ability to build and maintain solid working relationships
Ability to be pro-active and self-direct
Excellent communication and collaboration skills and be a team player
Exceptional documentation skills
Ability to collaborate with stakeholders (business, technical, etc.) and extract and analyze business requirements
Ability to collaborate with team members to ensure solutions are appropriate and fit for purpose
Ability to map and possibly re-engineer business processes
Ability to analyze system functionality and data flow to troubleshoot production issues
Perform gap analysis of proposed system enhancements/changes
Ability to research and analyze business/system/process issues for improvement potential
Ability to test deliverables at a detailed and technical level prior to hand-off to QA
Ability to coach and mentor junior personnel
Ability to lead/direct others on smaller (less formalized) efforts
Ability to handle constantly changing priorities
Excited by new technologies, and a love of learning. Evidence of being self-motivated and driven
An enthusiastic/positive/collaborative/helping/sharing/team focused attitude
Quick learning ability and problem solving
Desire to work on challenging problems with smart and collaborative people

Desired Skills:



Knowledge of reinsurance, ceded in particular
A good understanding of Business Intelligence concepts
Experience working with Microsoft Office tools beyond Excel
Knowledge of Agile principles and Scrum and/or Kanban
Experience with Jira and Confluence
Experience working across multiple time zones
Experience working with employees and contractors
Ability to work closely with technical resources and be able to guide and direct them
Ability to document technical specifications and clearly communicate them to development resources

Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Senior Specialist of Product/Business Analyst is a key role within the IT Strategy Realization department. This individual will be responsible for analyzing business needs and working closely with stakeholders to develop digital and technology solutions that drive business outcomes. The Senior Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the advancement of our Company's IT Strategy.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze business requirements and translate them into user stories.

Perform detailed analysis of existing business processes to identify areas for improvement and optimization.

Assist in the design and development of digital and technology solutions that align with business objectives.

Conduct market research and analysis to identify industry trends and best practices.

Support project execution by managing timelines, resources, and deliverables.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery.

Stay informed about emerging technologies and industry trends.

Participate in the development and execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

Education Minimum Requirement:

Bachelor's Degree required.

Required Experience and Skills:

Minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis, product management, or a related field.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Experience with developing various types of requirements and user stories.

Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.

Good understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.

Preferred Experience and Skills:

Experience working in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry is a plus.

Understanding of business process modeling notation.

Experience with basic user-focused design techniques (e.g., wireframing, page flow diagramming, data flow diagramming)

Understanding of how to apply organizational change management principles.

Application development experience – especially front-end development.

Familiarity with agile methodologies and tools such as JIRA is preferred.

Experience working within a product organization.

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Technical Business Analysis - Professional II

What does a successful Technical Business Analyst do at Fiserv?

The Technical Business Analyst will facilitate requirement gathering, project consultations with end clients and turn those requirements into Service Requests to initiate project assignment by respective implementation teams. The role requires the candidate to process a specified volume of project intakes while leveraging their abilities to collaborate, coordinate and execute in a timely manner. A successful candidate can work independently, and as a member of a team, enjoying a fast-paced, problem-solving environment. The ideal candidate is analytical and capable of meeting the expectations of Fiserv’s financial institutions and management team.

The Card Services business at Fiserv provides complete debit, credit and ATM payment services to financial institutions as well as Accel®, a premier payments network. Our products, services and strategies allow our clients to maximize revenue, increase customer acquisition, improve retention, reduce expense, minimize risk and increase share of wallet.

What you will do:

Under direct supervision, support multiple client requests for product and service adds.

Works with our clients and Account Executives to gather the necessary details to execute accurate and timely Service Requests

Participates in client kickoff, requirements and data gathering sessions.

Drives implementation of SR tool requests

Attends weekly conference calls or meetings with business units, project managers, clients and other internal teams to provide status, report risks and review issues that jeopardize the installation timeline.

Comprehends, supports and follows the standard Card Services process for implementation and projects.

Communicates SR and project status to the appropriate internal and external departments.

What you will need to have:

Bachelor’s Degree with relevant work experience or 5-7 years of relevant work experience

1-2 years of experience in implementations, business systems analysis, project management or coordination.

1-2 years of experience working in a customer service oriented or time-sensitive environment driven by project timelines.

Strong analytical, organizational and time management skills.

Solid verbal and written communication skills. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple requests simultaneously.

Ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor in high pressure situations.

Experience working with the MS Office Suite of products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook

Self-starter who can work effectively, both independently and in a team environment.

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

MetLife Investment Management (MIM) is seeking to hire a CLO Operations Senior Analyst in Whippany, NJ to join an experienced team supporting our growing platform. The analysts partner closely with the investment team to effectively manage growing CLO business, separately managed accounts, and general account mandates. We are looking for a highly motivated, independent, detail-oriented individual who wants to broaden their knowledge and challenge themselves in a fast-paced, collaborative working environment.

Work closely with the Portfolio Managers to capture trade activity to and from various processing applications systems; Oversee the process as it relates to the warehouse facilities.
Assist with waterfall calculations and related compliance needs.
Process and maintain cash activity to ensure settled/traded positions.

Ensure all compliance reporting is complete and accurate.
Maintain various tools and applications used to track the various facets of the business.
Perform ad-hoc requests for portfolio managers and trading desk, providing guidance as needed.

2-4 years of experience in Loan Operations

U.S. Hybrid Work Model

Effective September 5, 2023, employees in office-based positions in the U.S. will be working a Hybrid work consisting of three total days on-site per week, generally Tuesday, Wednesday and either Monday or Thursday, although the specific days may vary by site or organization, with Friday designated as a remote-working day, unless business critical tasks require an on-site presence. This Hybrid work model does not apply to, and daily in-person attendance is required for, field-based positions; facility-based, manufacturing-based, or research-based positions where the work to be performed is located at a Company site; positions covered by a collective-bargaining agreement (unless the agreement provides for hybrid work); or any other position for which the Company has determined the job requirements cannot be reasonably met working remotely. Please note, this Hybrid work model guidance also does not apply to roles that have been designated as “remote”.

DealerFLEX has an immediate opening for a detail-oriented Operations Support Analyst to help us as we continue to grow our operation. As a newly created position, we are looking for someone who will help us establish reporting, standard operating procedures, and systems that keep our operations running efficiently. We are committed to employee development and this role comes with the opportunity for career advancement. This position is full-time with benefits and reports to our Vice President of Operations.

If you are passionate about optimizing operational processes, providing analytical support, and contributing to a dynamic work environment, apply today!

Operations Support Analyst
(Exempt Role)
Summary/Objective
The Operations Support Analyst is responsible for providing administrative support to various departments, analyzing operational processes, and implementing improvements to enhance efficiency and productivity. This position carries out responsibilities in the following functional areas: Organizational Communication, Data Analysis, Training & Development, and Claims Administration.
Key Responsibilities

Process Analysis:
Analyze existing operational processes to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement.
Develop and maintain documentation for operational procedures and workflows.
Recommend and implement process enhancements to optimize productivity.

Data Analysis:
Collect, analyze, and interpret operational data to identify trends and patterns.
Generate reports and present findings to Operations Management for decision-making purposes.
Utilize data to recommend improvements and streamline operational processes.
Company-wide Communication:
Design, create, and distribute company-wide lines of communication to employees.
Gather relevant information from various departments to include in messaging and newsletters, such as updates, achievements, and upcoming events.
Ensure the communication content aligns with the company's branding and messaging guidelines.
Coordinate with different departments to obtain timely and accurate information for inclusion in outgoing communications.
Manage the distribution list and ensure the messaging reaches all employees in a timely manner.
Monitor the effectiveness of the communication by tracking open rates and engagement metrics.
Collaborate with the marketing and HR teams to promote company events, achievements, and important announcements through a newsletter.

Cross-Functional Collaboration and Communication:
Collaborate with various departments and teams to understand their operational needs and challenges.
Act as a liaison between different teams and front-line staff to facilitate communication and coordination.
Participate in meetings and discussions to gather requirements and provide operational insights.
Work directly with Operations and Accounting to assist with Claims Management
Quality Assurance:
Conduct quality assurance checks on operational processes to ensure accuracy and compliance with organizational standards.
Develop and implement quality control measures to maintain high operational standards.
Provide feedback and recommendations for improvement to relevant stakeholders.

Training and Documentation:
Develop training materials and documentation for operational processes.
Conduct periodic training sessions to enhance the skills and knowledge of existing staff members.
Participates in the development of annual Training and Development budget
Participates in developing department goals, objectives, and systems.
Performs other related duties as required and assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology preferred, or experience in a related field.
Proven experience in operations support, technical support, or a similar role.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis and report generation.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team as well as independently.
Detail-oriented with a focus on quality and accuracy.
Familiarity with relevant software applications and tools.
Willingness to adapt to new technologies and methodologies.

Additional Information:
Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities, but does serve as a coach and mentor for other positions in the department.
Work Environment: This job is in-person, and operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.
Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk and hear. This is largely a sedentary role; however, some light office work is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and bend as necessary.
Position Type/Expected Hours of Work: This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are typically Monday through Friday, between the hours of 9:00 a.m. to 6 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand. Schedule deviation and work at home situations will be considered and approved on a case-by-base basis. *Changes in daily hours can be approved by HR manager for special circumstances
Travel: Little to no travel is expected for this position.
Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

About the Role

The Senior HR Operations Analyst role is integral to the smooth and efficient operation of our HR functions, playing a critical role in the management and analysis of HR data, HR process improvements, and the management and administration of our HRIS systems. You will be responsible for gathering, analyzing, and reporting HR data, supporting process improvements, and ensuring the accuracy and effectiveness of HR operations while maintaining focus on our HRIS systems. Your work will contribute to our organization's ability to make data-driven HR decisions and enhance the overall employee experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Oversee and administer the HRIS systems, ensuring they are properly configured and meet the needs of the organization.
Provide day to day support for HRIS and other HR Technology solutions. Typical responsibilities include standard configuration, routine system administration, researching and resolving problems, unexpected results, or process flaws.
Manage HRIS data, including data accuracy, updates, and system security.
Lead efforts to ensure HR data integrity and governance, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.
Collaborate with HR technology vendors to optimize the functionality and performance of HRIS systems.
Support and assist in the assessment, selection and implementation of systems as well as maintaining and strengthening vendor relationships.
Develop and generate standard and ad-hoc HR reports and dashboards for leadership etc.
Identify areas for process improvement in HR operations and collaborate with the team to implement enhancements.
Create and maintain documentation for HR processes, procedures, and HRIS system best practices.
Ensure HR operations adhere to relevant labor laws, regulations, and company policies.
Provide HR support to employees, including assistance with HR-related inquiries and issue resolution.
Assist in the execution of HR projects and initiatives, as needed.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience in HR operations, data analysis, and HRIS management and administration.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency with data analysis tools and software.
Excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage and maintain data integrity.
Proficiency in HR systems and technology, particularly HRIS systems.
Knowledge of HR laws, regulations, and compliance.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Project management skills a plus.
High degree of discretion and confidentiality.
The ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to identify process improvements.

Job Title: US Financial Intelligence Unit Program Operations Analyst
Job Description:
United States - New Jersey
Compliance, Risk
Group Functions

Job Reference #

282571BR

City

Weehawken

Job Type

Full Time

Your role

Do you want to keep criminals from abusing the financial system and legislative systems? Are you someone who likes to do the right thing? Do you know how to maintain independence and objectivity?

We are looking for someone who can:


Operate effectively in a fast-paced environment, supporting a number of different teams engaged in the conduct of often complex and high-profile financial investigations of possible violations of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), USA PATRIOT Act, Money Laundering Crimes and fraud
Exploit very strong IT-user skills. You must develop a deep expertise in numerous information systems including the Standardized Case Management Tool and UBS' in-house investigations platforms
Communicate effectively and with confidentiality. You will be required to interact with complete ease with branch personnel and investigators alike. You are wholly comfortable on calls where there is a requirement to secure pertinent information from others within a tight timeframe
Write in a concise and precise manner, reviewing and amending regulatory reports, and subsequently submitting via online systems
Provide support for regulatory and audit exams, Financial Crime Prevention Program testing, and management reporting.
Support senior staff / management in researching and responding to regulatory requests, demonstrate leadership potential to assist new team members develop their understanding of our processes and have the potential to be able to direct and mentor over time
Complete UBS's annual BSA/AML/OFAC training
Escalate unusual/suspicious activities

Your team

You will be working in the central investigations information hub (iHub) in Weehawken within the C&ORC Financial Crime Compliance (FinCrime) Team. Our role is to assist UBS in the fight against money laundering, fraud, corruption and terrorist financing. The iHub Analyst is the single point of contact for all investigative support functions and responsible for reviewing, managing, reporting and tracking the team's workflow and liaising with all Group FinCrime components, the branch network and law enforcement or other external parties.


Diversity helps us grow, together. That’s why we are committed to fostering and advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion. It strengthens our business and brings value to our clients.

Your expertise

4 year college degree or international equivalent
ideally 1+ years of AML experience with a wealth management, broker dealer, retail and/or private bank, and/or correspondent bank
strong Excel skills with the ability to rapidly format a spreadsheet, and perform V-lookup and pivot tables
working knowledge and ability to execute a variety of computer based and proprietary systems to include Oracle, Data warehouse, LexisNexis, Internet Explorer, MS Office applications, case management systems, and/or various compliance related and database systems
experience handling sensitive information with a high degree of discretion with a focus on the maintenance of client privacy
Certified Anti-Money Laundering Specialist (ACAMS) / Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) / Certified AML and/or Fraud Professional (CAFP) would be beneficial but is not essential


LI-UBS

About us

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.

With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us

At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Sr. Business Operations Analyst

What does a successful Sr Business Operations Analyst do at Fiserv?


The Business Operations Analyst 1 position is part of the Contact Center Solutions Production Support team. As part of this team, the BOA2is responsible for resolving operational issues and handling Client and Client Executive escalations.


What you will do:

Assess and resolve client servicing and/or escalated operational issues via ServicePoint tickets and emails.

Partner and coordinate rapid response assessment and resolution with internal partners for client escalated issues; maintain a sense of urgency in responding to CE and Client escalations; ensure issues are resolved and communicated appropriately.

Partner with CCO teams, Client Services and Client Executives to ensure clients issues are resolved and communicated appropriately.

Identify and report escalation trends and propose options for final resolution.

As required, meet directly with clients to review/resolve operational issues.

Conduct client call calibration sessions and resulting follow up requirements.

Assist/Conduct call calibration sessions with clients, maintaining a professionally collegial atmosphere; Take note of follow up items and respond in a timely manner, as required.

Maintain SME level knowledge of Card Contact Center operational policies and processes for all contact center services provided

Knowledge of new client onboarding and existing client new service implementation

Detailed knowledge of Card Contact center agent policies, processes and training

Deep understanding of contact center technology including CRM, IVR, AI, Call Recording, etc. Must have the ability to develop technology and/or operational requirements and associated business cases to support Contact Center Solutions product.

Contact Center organization and key escalation processes and associates

Evaluate opportunities to enhance client/cardholder experience by recommending enhancements to policies and processes

Manage all change requests for services or products for Contact Center and/or Servicing teams to completion, providing regular status reports; assess and track servicing change management requests

Validate implementation and change schedules to ensure timely CCO communication and SLA timeframes are met.

Identify gaps and resolve implementation issues in a timely manner; ensure continuous alignment with SDO and Client Services


What you will need to have:

Excellent client interaction skills and Contact Center knowledge

Commitment to Service Excellence and demonstrate Service Excellence every day.

A sense of urgency to resolve client issues, process issues, technical issues, etc.

Demonstrate excellent partnering skills each day with LOB and CCO teams and Clients.

Take ownership to resolve issues that impede Service Excellence

Advocate for our clients and for Card initiatives/issues

Continuously identify areas of improvement for Cardholders, efficiency, agents, etc.

Commit to helping the entire team achieve the team annual goals.

Execute your responsibilities ethically and with excellence every day.

Demonstrate project management capabilities.

Be a continuous learner/display intellectual curiosity to add to your tool set.

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate.

Janssen R&D is looking for a highly motivated Manager SAP Financial Integration (preferred location based in New Jersey) who is passionate about developing sophisticated solutions and providing technical and process expertise to support R&D requirements. You will help define integrated financial solution strategy, drive design and technical implementation, and work with architect to design innovative solutions. You will work on diverse projects from gathering customer requirements to implementing the solution. We believe that experience developing insight led strategy, crafting innovative technology solutions, experimentation, agile ways of working, intellectual curiosity, empathy, leading teams, and human centered design are essential to enable you to be successful in this role. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion.

BEACON is a Pharma R&D SAP platform handled by the R&D IT Financial Systems Team on behalf of the R&D operating companies to support and optimize the decision-making process for R&D projects. Beacon is used in 80+ countries by approximately 18,000 users and finance & tax shared services. Key capabilities of Beacon are: Accounting processes, Financial Postings from different Corporate and R&D systems, Intercompany Processes, Fixed assets/AUC including Asset Inventory Tracking, Purchase Order Commitments, Project Accounting, Time reporting, Capacity Management (1-Supply), Financial (Statutory and Tax) and Management Reporting, Financial Planning, IP Billing – Tax credits, Automated Book-close. This SAP platform is a SOX regulated system.

The R&D IT Team supports the different Finance Organizations for Janssen R&D globally, as well as the Finance Organizations within Janssen Business Services (Belgium) and Janssen Global Services (Manilla).

This position requires solid understanding of financial processes and SAP technical skills; expertise with design, and implementation of financial systems, or enterprise software; and documentation experience. Successful candidates should have a high energy level, experience working with many different support functions, and the ability to communicate clearly and effectively with both business and technical audiences.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead analysis, research, design and development of new functionalities and integration with key applications and services under SAP ecosystems.
Perform Business Problem Definition: understanding and translating business problems faced by the finance function into a value case & comprehensive set of solutions spanning process, technology, data, governance & user experience supported by defined, baseline value realization key performance indicators.
Design new solution and enhancements based on business requirements.
Provide process and design guidance to the functional and development team.
Guild the technical team to develop, configure and implement the solution as per the product development standards to meet business requirements.
Monitor the work of the technical team and ensure standards are adhered to in accordance with SDLC/Agile requirements.
Ensure technical integrity of projects, making sure that common technical elements are leveraged, and that work is not duplicated.
Work with supporting functional team on the design of test plans, test cases and on automation of existing and new processes.
Participate in the product roadmap and product strategy definition.
Help and review with the creation of training, product, and solution documentation.
Coordinate with other J&J technical teams changes and enhancements to ensure compatibility with other systems that are integrated with R&D SAP platform.
Hold self and others accountable to the committed deadlines and ensure successful results.
Engage with Corporate Finance, IT and other strategic partners to identify and validate requirements and translate to solution design.
Lead team in driving and delivering customer solutions.
Participating in resolving technology integration problems.
Partnering with product management teams to ensure roadmaps are oriented to deliver finance business & technology strategy, value creation objectives, and measurable key performance indicators.
Ensure customer satisfaction through quality work and effective communication throughout projects.
QUALIFICATIONS

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.

Experience and Skills:

Required:

8+ years work experience in SAP Financial global implementations, systems integration, or architect role.
Have a good understanding of SAP standard methodologies and SDLC/Agile.
Must have excellent expertise in understanding of SAP modules such as Finance, MM, PS, HR with good knowledge about ABAP development.
Must have good understanding of financial processes, underlined accounting and SOX requirements to support global financial requirements.
Must be an expert in analyzing, creating system specifications, and developing tests and implementing business solutions using SAP technologies.
Must have solid grasp and understanding of development using ABAP objects and HANA SQL.
Hands-on experience working with interfaces in addition to Web Services, such as APIs communicating with non-SAP applications and their reconciliation.
Must have good experience with SAP security concepts and understanding of authorization checks in ABAP objects.
Experience managing projects and working with multi-functional teams across different organizations.

Preferred:

Ability to assess and manage technical risks and issues.
Must have good interpersonal skill and demonstrable ability to meet deadlines without compromising quality.

Other:

Expertise in doing Solution demos and presentations to business partners/architects.
Proficient in English and able to report both verbally and in writing to executive level.
Minimum business travel required -10-20%.
