Title:
Insurance Business Analyst
Company:
Everest Insurance Company
Job Category:
Underwriting
Job Description:
It’s an exciting time for Everest Group, Ltd. (“Everest”)! As we continue on our journey, we see significant opportunity ahead of us to expand our reach, build diversity, and enhance our capabilities in critical markets.
Everest is a leading global reinsurance and insurance provider, operating for nearly 50 years through subsidiaries in the Bermuda, Canada, Europe, Singapore, US, and other territories. Our strengths include extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet, and an innovative culture. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focuses on creating long-term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management. But the most critical asset in this organization is our people.
At Everest, we are committed to the development of our people. We offer dynamic training & professional development to our employees. You will benefit from career development and learning opportunities that will let you set career goals and fulfill them, including:
Generous tuition/continuing education reimbursement
Mentoring opportunities
Flexible work arrangements
Talent development initiatives
Networking groups
Everest is a growth company with $14 Billion of Gross Written Premium offering Property, Casualty and specialty products among others, through its various operating subsidiaries located in key markets around the world. Everest has been a global leader in reinsurance with a broad footprint, deep client relationships, underwriting excellence, responsive service and customized solutions. Our insurance arm draws upon impressive global resources and financial strength to tailor each policy to meet the individual needs of our customers.
Our financial strength is evident in Financial Agency Ratings of: A+ A. M. Best, A+ S&P Global and A1 Moody’s Investor Service. We are a market leader for our broad diversified income streams, strong underlying underwriting performance with reduced volatility and strong cash flow. We take pride in being known in the industry as nimble, entrepreneurial and responsive.
Everest is a leading global reinsurance and insurance organization with extensive product and distribution capabilities, a strong balance sheet and an innovative culture. Throughout our history, Everest has maintained its discipline and focus on creating long term value through underwriting excellence and strong risk and capital management.
Everest Insurance, which began operations in 2015, has steadily grown and generated just under $4B in premium in 2021. That growth has been fueled by strong underwriting and operational talent. Recent growth is coming from highly diversified areas including newly launches lines of business, as well as product and geographic expansion in existing lines of business. In support of that growing business, we have created a Delivery Operations division that we are continuing to invest in as our technology and products grow in the coming few years.
Everest is looking for a Business Analyst to join us in our Warren, NJ, New York, NY or Philadelphia, PA office. This role will support multiple Rating Tools across various business segments and will report to the Product Owner. These rating tools include complex Excel spreadsheets, Coherent/Spark and Unqork technology. The various Rating Tools support rating, forms selection, quoting, booking and policy issuance.
Responsibilities include but not limited to:
Partner with Everest Technology Services to support requirements sessions with key stakeholders
Partner with Product or Platform Owners, key stakeholders, and Everest Technology Services to define release scope.
Working with business stakeholders, product/platform owners, and other business analysts to support continuous re-prioritization of backlog(s) for the supported tools.
Organize and support user acceptance test planning and execution and support QA and performance testing activities.
Manage the production process for the Tools once UAT sign off has been acquired.
Partner with business and operations to develop training strategy and content.
Create and publish communications to document enhancements that have been put into production.
Assist Everest Technology Solutions in analysis to identify root cause of problems; assist in developing solutions; and drive action towards resolution.
Create documentation and support communication for various stakeholder meetings and senior leadership updates as
required.
Qualifications, Education & Experience:
We are looking for business analysts with a range of 2 – 10 years’ experience in business analysis, business architecture, or similar role including experience in working with systems through the whole project lifecycle from requirements gathering/ scoping through to testing and go live.
Fit and level will be dependent on years of experience and background in specific areas of need.
Novice - expert knowledge in one or more of the following areas is required: clearance, rating, policy administration, document storage, forms, workflow, booking, billing, premium audit, claims, and external facing portals.
Strong preference will be given to candidates with experience in commercial property and casualty insurance.
Experience in requirements writing and/or business documentation.
Agile experience preferred.
UX experience is desired.
Degree in risk management, business, technology, engineering, related field preferred; or commensurate business experience.
Knowledge, Skills & Competencies:
Proficiency with MS Office Suite, specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Strong communication, documentation, organization, presentation and planning skills.
Ability to create strong relationships and work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders and end users
Ability to support or lead strategy and requirement discussions and document requirements; ability to analyze business needs.
Problem solver with a strong sense of individual ownership and accountability.
Strong attention to detail and willingness to learn technical specifications.
Continuous learning/improvement mindset.
Ability to work both constructively in a team environment as well as effectively independently in a dynamic environment.
Ability to communicate effectively with both business and IT partners.
For NYC Only: The base salary range for this position is $70,000 - $100,000 annually. The offered rate of compensation will be based on individual education, experience, qualifications and work location.
Our Culture
At Everest, our purpose is to provide the world with protection. We help clients and businesses thrive, fuel global economies, and create sustainable value for our colleagues, shareholders and the communities that we serve. We also pride ourselves on having a unique and inclusive culture which is driven by a unified set of values and behaviors. Click
here
to learn more about our culture.


Our Values are the guiding principles that inform our decisions, actions and behaviors. They are an expression of our culture and an integral part of how we work: Talent. Thoughtful assumption of risk. Execution. Efficiency. Humility. Leadership. Collaboration. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion.
Our Colleague Behaviors define how we operate and interact with each other no matter our location, level or function: Respect everyone. Pursue better. Lead by example. Own our outcomes. Win together.

All colleagues are held accountable to upholding and supporting our values and behaviors across the company. This includes day to day interactions with fellow colleagues, and the global communities we serve.

Additional Information


In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.

We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Sales Operations Analyst - (2300008M)


Radware's Sales Operations team's focus is to work collaboratively across the organization to develop impactful and measurable initiatives that accelerate revenue growth and enable efficiency. The team's focus is to ensure stakeholders are focusing their key efforts and energy on what's important by delivering actionable reporting and analytics.

You will partner with key leadership stakeholders to advise on sales growth strategy, constantly focused on how our data, reporting, processes, systems, people, and tools can best work together.




Tasks at Hand:

1. Data Analysis and Reporting:

Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement
Generate and maintain sales reports, dashboards, and performance metrics for management and sales teams
Provide insights and recommendations based on data analysis to optimize sales strategies
Provide necessary data and reports to support sales initiatives, such as pricing, promotions, and territory planning

2. Sales & Deal Desk Support:

Support the deal desk process – including order approvals, preparation for booking, liaising with Order Management & others to ensure smooth processing and delivery
Collaborate with the sales team to address day to day operational inquiries and issues
Support the organization of regular Cadences and Sales Kick-offs/Events

3. Sales Process Improvement:

Collaborate with the sales team to streamline and improve sales processes
Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for automation to enhance sales productivity
Implement and monitor best practices to ensure a smooth and efficient sales work flow

4. Forecasting and Pipeline Management:

Assist in sales forecasting by examining historical data and current trends
Maintain and update the sales pipeline to provide accurate forecasts
Work with the sales team to ensure alignment between forecasts and actual performance

5. CRM Management:

Administer the CRM system and ensure data integrity
Support the sales team in CRM usage, including data entry, reporting, and user training



Qualifications -

BA/BS in Business, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience in sales operations, business analysis, or a related role
Experience with CRM and BI, specifically reporting.
Keen analytical skills - ability to break down a problem into its core parts; identifying implications, timeframes and sequences.
Ability to work cooperatively with individuals across the organization and independently when appropriate.
Proficiency with Excel.



You Are:

A Problem-Solver: You thrive on identifying solutions.
Curious: You're a "forever learner" with an insatiable desire to gain new skills and knowledge.
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen attention to detail, and don't overlook "the little things".
Dependable: Have excellent time management and organizational skills.
Analytical: A "numbers person"; you are able to find patterns and key insights.
Primary Location: US-New Jersey

Project Controls/Power BI Consultant



Who We Are

At WSP, we are driven by inspiring future-ready pioneers to innovate. We’re looking to grow our teams with people who are ready to collaborate in building communities and expanding our skylines. To do this, we hire candidates of all experiences, skillsets, backgrounds and walks of life. We actively foster a work environment and culture where inclusion and diversity is part of our fundamental structure. This is delivered behaviorally, through our policies, trainings, local partnerships with professional diverse organizations, internal networks and most importantly with the support and sponsorship of our leaders who help drive our commitment to an inclusive, diverse, welcoming and equitable work environment. Anything is within our reach and yours as a WSP employee. Come join us and help shape the future!

This Opportunity
WSP is currently initiating a search for a Project Controls/Power BI Consultant for our NEW YORK - PENN PLAZA office. Be involved in projects with our Project Controls & Technology Team and be a part of a growing organization that meets our client’s objectives and solves their challenges.


Your Impact
Job Duties:
Work under the direction of the Project Manager to support the planning, coordination, and evaluation of project financial reporting.
Develop dashboards to visualize project health and key performance indicators.
Develop and implement effective cost control procedures to track project expenses, analyze cost variances, and identify areas for cost-saving opportunities.
Work closely with engineering and design teams to evaluate cost-saving options and recommend value-added changes to optimize project costs.
Implement integrated project controls methodologies to effectively align cost and schedule management efforts.
Communicate project status, cost performance, and schedule updates to stakeholders, facilitating informed decision-making.
Attend a variety of project meetings with project stakeholders to track and solve cost and schedule management issues.
Maintain financial reports for individual project subtasks, and provide roll-up reports that summarize the subtasks.
Review funding availability and procurement documentation to ensure conformance to approved project budgets.
Manage change order processes and evaluations to assess the impact of proposed changes on project costs and schedules.
Participate in development of project estimates, budgets, forecasts, estimates to complete, and cost trends.


Who You Are
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Construction Management or related field is preferred.
Advanced degrees or professional certifications and accreditations in Engineering, Construction Management and related fields are preferred.
5-7 years of combined field and office project controls experience involving large-scale projects, preferably in the New York City area.
Experience with dashboard reporting and Microsoft PowerBI is required.
Extensive knowledge of cost estimating methodologies, cost control techniques, and schedule management best practices.
Ability to interface with clients and participate in business development initiatives.
Expert ability with Microsoft Office Suite primarily Excel.
Excellent communication skills, written, oral and interpersonal skills to deal with a high-pressure environment.


This position is subject to and contingent upon client approval of candidates put forth for consideration by WSP.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

WSP provides a comprehensive suite of benefits including medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and retirement savings focused on a providing health and financial stability throughout the employee’s career.

Overview:
The Associate Director, Business Intelligence will provide strategic direction, leadership, and oversight for the management and consumption of financial data throughout the University. Reporting to the Assistant Vice President of Finance Technology within the Office of Finance & Treasury (F&T), this role will define and implement F&T’s reporting and analytics strategy and enable capabilities that will deliver financial information in a consumable manner to facilitate business decisions. This position will require close collaboration with senior leadership in F&T, the Office of Information Technology (OIT), the University Data Office (UDO), and campus customers.

The successful candidate will manage the full system lifecycle of financial reporting and analytics capabilities and will be responsible for leading the modeling, quality, and delivery mechanisms of financial data maintained by the University. The individual will manage a team of business intelligence analysts seeking opportunities to leverage data to increase operational efficiency. The Associate Director will also partner with collaborative groups of IT partners, data stewards, analysts, and the UDO to implement a strategy for accessible integrated cross-functional analytics balanced with data governance.
The Associate Director will be curious, keeping abreast of evolving data analytics platforms, design, and presentation methods. The individual must have strong project management and technical skills; a person who is self-motivated and organized, highly observant of and sensitive to the culture of the University and its many constituencies, inherently collegial and service oriented, and an excellent communicator.

The Office of Finance & Treasury actively searches for staff members of exceptional ability and promise who share in Princeton University's commitment to excellence, and who present a diversity of viewpoints and cultures. We offer varied professional opportunities spanning all aspects of financial management, analysis, and processing in support of the teaching and research mission. As part of the University community, we respect the dignity and individuality of each member while trying to foster a sense of shared experience and common purpose. We are unwavering in our commitment to both diversity and community and embrace the variety of talents, backgrounds, and perspectives of all our colleagues.
Responsibilities:
Data Analytics Strategy and Execution
Responsible for defining the University financial reporting and analytics strategy and roadmap, and identifying future initiatives that support our business analysis needs.
Serve as a leader in driving and executing the data analytics vision and evangelizing the power of data in the day-to-day business processes for functional teams across the organization.
Collaborate with OIT in evaluating BI/Analytics tool capabilities, newer functionalities and deploying version upgrades.
Design and maintain the architecture and tools to support the financial data warehouse.
Spearhead our data analytics program by leveraging IBM Cognos/Tableau visualization capabilities; design integrated dashboards combining various data families that provide a cohesive, logical story and actionable insight to business owners and senior leadership.
Partner with other administrative units across the University to integrate financial data with non-financial data, incorporating into an institutional data architecture to enable streamlined access to information and easier reconciliation.
Collaborate with the University Data Officer, data stewards, and subject matter experts in creating data dictionaries and role-based access models, and work with OIT to implement in a modern data catalog and governance platforms.
Collaborate with the UDO, data stewards, and analysts to develop University-wide reporting standards, curriculum, training guides and outreach programs for analytics adoption.
Collaborate with DBA group in optimizing report/dashboard performance and document technical best practices and methodologies.
Lead Business Intelligence Projects
Lead projects to deliver new business intelligence capabilities; develop the plan, objectives, timeline and deliverables; manage resources, schedules, scope, issues, and risks.
Review and document use cases and requirements for transactional reports, summary reports, analytics capabilities, visualizations, and ad-hoc reporting.
Plan and lead design, development, and testing for all analytics and reporting impacts with the implementation of new financial applications and integrating systems.
Understand users’ information delivery needs and functional reporting requirements, translating them into technical solutions.
Develop reporting design principles and development standards for Finance & Treasury reporting and analytics capabilities, and ensure consistent application. Contribute to the establishment of University-wide standards.
Establish repeatable process for report testing with an emphasis on data quality.
Contribute to the development and delivery of communication and training in support of new reporting and analytics solutions.
Act as the primary liaison between business leaders, functional analysts, and application developers to clarify functional design questions and implement standards for managing data.
Provide guidance in developing ETL specifications, building data integrations and ensuring financial reports produce consistent and accurate information across financial systems.
Team Leadership and Supervision
Lead a team of business intelligence analysts through the planning, design, and delivery of data, insights, and reporting solutions. Provide supervision, mentoring, and honing performance to maximize the team's impact.
Institute daily processes to monitor, investigate and reconcile data integrity and data quality between PeopleSoft ERP, other financial systems and the data warehouse.
Lead the Finance & Treasury Data Analysis Community of Practice to enhance data literacy and data storytelling skills across the division. Contribute to university-wide data analysis collaboration groups.
Seek opportunities to create and automate repeatable analyses or build streamlined data flows for business leaders.
Continuously improve data analytics and insights capabilities and spreading that knowledge and expertise throughout the organization.
Stay abreast of leading practices in data analytics emerging technologies, business, and market trends to support the implementation of innovative solutions (e.g., AI, predictive analytics, etc.).
Manage production support activities and the investigation of defects and enhancement requests; lead resolution of Information Warehouse reporting issues; recommend solutions.
Qualifications:
10+ years of progressive technical leadership experience in analytics, business intelligence, reporting, or similar data-related functions in an enterprise environment.
Strong conceptual and technical understanding of, Data Warehousing and the development of reporting and self-service analytics platforms.
10+ years of experience generating analytical insights to drive business actions, including proficiency with programming / database querying tools (Oracle, SQL, Python, etc.) and reporting/data visualization tools (IBM Cognos Analytics, Tableau, etc.) is required.
7+ years staff management experience including demonstrated ability to effectively lead and mentor individuals with diverse backgrounds.
Excellent project management experience with planning, problem solving and organization development skills, demonstrated by a record of successful major project and process management transformations.
Demonstrated ability to multitask between leadership, projects, operations, and support.
Self-starter and be able to handle multiple tasks and priorities in a matrix organization.
Exceptional interpersonal skills, communication skills, and the ability to engage effectively with a diverse constituent base including cross-functional teams and senior leadership.
Data analysis experience with financial data
Bachelor's degree or higher in Engineering, Mathematics or Computer Science, or equivalent work experience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with PeopleSoft Financials
Experience in Oracle EPM suite of products including EPBCS/PBCS
Familiarity with cloud-based data architecture and analytics platforms Infrastructure (OCI)
Experience with financial management, procurement, sponsored research and budgeting processes in a Higher Education setting

Job Title: Information Security Training and Awareness Analyst, Associate- H/F/X
Job Description:
Responsibilities

Global Business Service Unit (GBSU) US delivers day-to-day services to Global Banking & Investor Solutions (GBIS) and its clients. GBSU consists of entities composed of IT & non-IT teams working side-by-side under the same leadership. GBSU supports the goal of rolling out a services platform model, spreading the technology and data culture, shortening decision-making processes, and adopting an industrial approach to ensure secure, stable, and compliant operations, as well as continuously improving front to back processing environments. GBSU maintains production services for applications, systems, and infrastructure, facilitates entry into new markets, ensures compliance with regulatory needs, as well as business growth & development.

The Information Security Training and Awareness Analyst leads the AMER region’s cybersecurity training and awareness program. The position requires excellent communication skills (written and verbal) and a strong ability to influence others. The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate practical and in-depth knowledge of running an effective training program including adjusting content to align with emerging threats in the financial services industry. The role also calls for strong business analysis and process improvement skills and the ability to present to senior management on the state of, and proposals to improve, the training program. Working knowledge of cybersecurity and risk assessment frameworks (e.g., NIST) and regulations applicable to the financial services industry (e.g., NYDFS 500, FINRA, SEC) is preferred.
The Information Security Training and Awareness Analyst is a member of the Governance, Strategy and Awareness (GSA) team within the AMER Data and Cyber Security (DCS) department and reports to the Director of GSA. This position is transversal and requires strong collaboration across departments in the Americas and globally with the other regional and central training and awareness teams.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Training and Awareness

Lead the AMER cybersecurity training program.
Run phishing program – create and execute bi-weekly campaigns; leverage phishing metrics across the AMER region to identify staff at risk of being phished and offer targeted training.
Coordinate with the global teams to maintain alignment of training objectives and share effective local training and awareness practices.
Continuously update the security training library based on emerging threats and cyber incidents.
Coordinate and run security awareness events including recruitment of outside cybersecurity experts from law enforcement, government, and private industry.
Develop new methods of raising staff awareness on cybersecurity risks.
Collaborate with the threat intelligence team to draft and publish communications for staff as new threats emerge.
Contribute to quarterly newsletter addressing topical cyber risks and best practices.

Suspicious Email

Manage security controls for review of emails reported by staff as suspicious.
Provide guidance to junior staff who assist in running daily controls.
Review alerts from controls and follow up with the end users and technical teams as needed.
Maintain the quality and effectiveness of controls and provide recommendations for improvement and/or automation.
Leverage information gained from reviewing suspicious emails to update the security training library and phishing campaigns.
Act as a subject matter expert and advisor with regards to secure email behavior for all staff.
Profile required

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE

3-5 years of demonstrable experience in training and awareness, information security, security GRC, or other related practices.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal is required.
Proficiency with MS Office suite of productivity tools is required.
Strong analytical, problem solving, and process improvement skills are required.
Hands-on experience running a training program is highly preferred.
Experience with ProofPoint or PhishMe (or similar phishing tool) is highly beneficial.
Basic knowledge of GRC practice and one GRC tool is preferred.
Solid understanding of common security best practices and risk assessment is preferred.
Experience with MS Defender is a plus.

EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or Business Management is required.
CISSP, CCSP, CISA, CISM, GSEC, CRISC, or related security certification(s) is highly preferred.
Business insight

Job Title: PGIM Private Capital - Senior Business Systems Analyst (Newark, NJ)
Job Description:
Job Classification:

Technology - Agile, Delivery, & Product

A GLOBAL FIRM WITH A DIVERSE & INCLUSIVE CULTURE

Our Vision

At PGIM, we believe talent is key to achieving our vision. When you join PGIM, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading global asset managers!

What you will do

As part of the Information Technology & Services team within PGIM Private Capital (PPC), we support PPC with both vendor and internally designed applications, processes, and reporting. We are looking for an astute, resourceful professional like you to fulfill a business process analyst role on this team. You will showcase your success through collaboration, ownership, and innovation. Your ability to apply business process analysis knowledge to improve and increase the success of the business by working with both the business process end users and technical teams will help keep our competitive edge. This rewarding opportunity will enable you to have an impact in our organization, so if this sounds motivating, then PGIM Private Capital might be the place for your next opportunity.

What you can expect
Use knowledge of business analysis concepts and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies to support business initiatives and system enhancements
Support business initiatives and system enhancements
Work with end users to learn and understand existing processes documenting flows and reviewing all supporting information
Determine how necessary improvements can be made
Support project team with overall project improvements
Support technical teams responsible for building, modifying, and maintaining the systems that support the business
Possess a thorough understanding of the Business Analysis subject area
Create process flows and conduct gap analysis for current state vs future state
May seek guidance from management on input regarding system design proposals and in how to communicate the reasoning and decisions on process / system design to business partners
Have sufficient understanding of asset management to support business users’ needs
Keep abreast of industry initiatives and market trends that impact the business to continue to improve efficiencies
Responsible for understanding technology impact on the business processes
Understand the software delivery processes, with emphasis on change, risk, scope and communication management in lieu of the impact of the same on the overall project
What you will bring
Bachelor's degree in business with a focus on asset management or equivalent work experience
Has 5+ years of experience in business process analysis
Experience with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools such as Jira
What will set you apart
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with ability to conduct root cause analysis on system, process or production problems and ability to suggest viable solutions
Ability to improve end-user proficiency with new systems, programs, and applications across departments
Ability to prioritize tasks and projects and work effectively under pressure
Strong organizational and administrative skills; at ease with abundance of details, yet mindful of big picture at all time
Works independently and requests assistance as needed
At PGIM, you can

We’re passionate about making a meaningful impact on the world, touching the lives of millions and doing things the right way. As the global asset management business of Prudential, we’re always looking for ways to improve financial services, working with purpose in an open, friendly, and positive culture. If you’re not afraid to think differently and challenge the status quo, come and be a part of a dedicated team that’s investing in your future by shaping tomorrow today. Turn big ideas into reality!

What we offer you:
Medical, dental, vision, life insurance and PTO (Paid Time Off)
Retirement plans: 401(k) plan with generous company match (up to 4%); Company-funded pension plan
Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional health, and career development.
Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment, approved degrees, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.

Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $90,000 to $120,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

About PGIM Private Capital

At PGIM Private Capital, expertise, analysis, and experience drive everything we do. We strategically target select global markets to offer unique deal flow to investors and prospective issuers. Our team is comprised of bright, focused professionals who collaborate at all levels to manage originations and a private debt portfolio across investment grade, high yield and mezzanine investments. We invest in the potential of our employees by offering them large-scope, small-team emphasis on collaboration, and commitment to a healthy balance between a professional and personal life. We challenge you as an individual so you can make real contributions while you grow your capabilities.

About PGIM – Global Asset Management

PGIM is the global asset management business of Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a leading global investment manager with nearly US$1.27 trillion in assets under management as of June 30th, 2023. With offices in 18 countries, PGIM’s businesses offer a range of investment solutions for retail and institutional investors around the world across a broad range of asset classes, including public fixed income, private fixed income, fundamental equity, quantitative equity, real estate and alternatives. With a history dating back almost 145 years, and experience through more than 30 market cycles, PGIM takes a long-term view, not only in our investment philosophy, but also in how we develop our talent. We want to see our employees excel from their first day with the firm and throughout their tenure with PGIM. We will inspire you, support you, and help you reach your greatest personal and professional aspirations. If PGIM sounds like the place for you, join us. For more information about PGIM, visit PGIM.com.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Prudential Financial, Inc. is focused on creating a fully inclusive culture, where all employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, support it, and thrive on it. At Prudential, employees have a unique opportunity to build their career path by owning their development, their career, and their future. We encourage employees to hone their skills and explore continued opportunities within Prudential.

Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.

Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.

We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.

Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Specialist, Business of IT Product / Business Analyst (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Job Description

IT powers our company to save and improve lives. Within our Company IT, the IT Strategy Realization team’s purpose is to lead value-driven outcomes and accelerate how we transform IT. ITSR does this by delivering on six core capabilities: IT Strategy, IT Value Management, IT Product Management, Talent Enablement, IT Communications & Change Management, and IT Continuous Improvement.

The Specialist, Product/Business Analyst is an entry-level role within IT Strategy Realization. This individual will support the analysis of business needs and assist in the development of digital and technology solutions. The Specialist will report to the Associate Director of Product/Business Analyst and will contribute to the achievement of our Company's IT Strategy goals.

A partial list of responsibilities includes the following:

Assist in gathering and documenting business requirements.

Perform basic analysis of existing business processes.

Support the design and development of digital and technology solutions.

Conduct research to gather information on industry trends and best practices.

Assist in project management tasks such as timeline tracking and resource coordination.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver project milestones.

Stay updated on emerging technologies and industry developments.

Support the execution of training programs for stakeholders.

Limited travel may be required.

Education Minimum Requirement:

Job Title: Technical Lead / Lead Business Functional Analyst
Job Description:
Duration & Type: 12 months Contract with a major pharmaceutical industry client

Location: Summit, New Jersey (This can be a remote role but the candidate should be able to come to the office occasionally as per business needs.)

Description: The application is a bespoke application built primarily for Sales Order Inventory Allocation and Forecast Optimization. It is integrated with SAP via Mulesoft APIs and is deployed into an Azure environment with MS SQL Server database at the backend. It uses Machine Learning algorithms, Python, JavaScript, and Angular JS.

Responsibilities:

Work with IT system owner, platform lead and other stakeholders to create a transition plan to take on BAU support for the ap Technical Lead plication.
Facilitate work sessions and participate in meetings with existing IT support team to complete knowledge transition of the system/application and supporting technologies.
Train junior members of the team to position them to take on BAU support activities of the application and interfaces/integration points.
Create, maintain and update documentation related to architecture, BAU Operations, SOP’s.
Partner with other project team members from Infrastructure, Middleware, integrated apps/systems such as SAP to understand the architectural landscape and ecosystem for company’s supply chain, sales orders/demand management.
Use ITIL processes to resolve incidents, problem management, root cause investigation, change and release management.
Run daily health checks and monitoring activities to identify issues proactively.
Escalate issues as needed and work with other I&T teams to drive resolution of issues.
BAU Support during US business hours.
Support for urgent/high severity issues/incidents will be needed outside of business hours especially during peak shipping season for flu vaccines during July – December time frame.
Communicate with I&T and Business stakeholders as it related to BAU activities.

Required:

Familiarity with following Technologies is required:
Back-end: Python, PL/SQL, MS SQL Server, Machine Learning
Front-end: JavaScript, Angular
Azure, Mulesoft, API Integration


Desired domain experience: Forecast Optimization techniques, Data Science, Sales Order Management concepts, Supply Chain.

Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our mission to change the way the world snacks. Make It With Pride.

You will:

Proficient understanding of data modeling and data engineering principles in a business context, with experience in working across various systems, including SAP, internal, and external data sources.
Analyze business requirements to guide data modeling and apply techniques for design, quality assurance, and data structure development.

Experience in developing, testing, and maintaining data products.

Experience in using diverse range of programming languages and tools, for data extraction, transformation, storage, processing, and integration.

Develop and maintain data models, including conceptual, logical, and physical models, to represent data entities, relationships, and structures.

Implement data quality standards for accuracy, consistency, and reliability.

Design and optimize database structures, tables, and schemas to support efficient data storage and retrieval.

Develop and implement data transformation and integration processes to facilitate the movement of data between systems and ensure data consistency.

Create and maintain documentation for data models, database schemas, and integration processes.

Effectively communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences and collaborate with business teams to align with organizational goals.
Work closely with other data analysts, data scientists, and other stakeholders to implement and maintain data solutions.
Monitor and optimize data models and database performance to ensure efficient data access and processing.
Adhere to data governance policies and best practices to maintain data security, privacy, and compliance.

What you will bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:

Proven experience in data modeling, database design, and data analysis.

Proficiency in data modeling tools.

Strong SQL skills for querying and manipulating data.

Familiarity with database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL).

Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, data pipelines and architecture

Understanding of data governance and data quality principles.

Experience with CI/CD, DevOps, and Data Ops techniques.

Experience creating and maintaining Technical Documentation

Experience in data modelling and wrangling techniques and tools i.e., Star Schema, Snowflake Schema, Data vault, Alteryx, Power BI, Tableau, etc.

Data quality and profiling methods

Good communication skills to promote cross-team collaboration.

Passion for problem solving and comfort with ambiguity.

Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.

What you need to know about this position:

Education / Certifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related discipline.
1+ years Data Engineering/Modeling
3+ years Database Design
Cloud computing technologies (Azure, GCP)
Programming Languages: SQL, Python, PySpark (Apache Spark), DAX, etc.
Analytics platforms: Databricks, Google Cloud Dataproc, etc.
Certification in data modeling or related areas (e.g., Certified Data Management Professional, CDMP, or GCP certification) is a plus.

Job specific requirements:

Lead business requirement sessions to support the business to understand requirements for analytical projects and develop necessary requirement documents to support their development.
Develop UAT (User Acceptance Testing) and SIT (System Integration Testing) test cases for based off data product requirements.
Lead building, testing, and maintaining of transports/data pipelines and retrieving applicable data sets for specific use cases.
Lead building, testing, and maintaining of data models with the flexibility to change when business requirements change, while also reconciling multiple logical source models into a single, logically consistent model.
Analyze the structure, format, and reliability of new and existing data sources, considering factors such as data integrity, completeness, and accuracy.
Participate in data governance processes to ensure data is properly maintained and document for reusability by the business
Understand data and metadata to support consistency of information retrieval, combination, analysis, pattern recognition and interpretation.Mentor and guide junior members
Partner with technology organization MDS to commercialize solutions, enhance data management, and develop analytical capabilities.
Partner with PMO organization to drive project completion within scope, time, and budget

Salary Range is 78 K and 99 K depending on experience

Travel requirements:

Up to 10%

Company description

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella®, Tic Tac®, Ferrero Rocher®, Raffaello®, Kinder Bueno® and Kinder Surprise®. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 38,767 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

About the Role:

Come and be a part of the fastest growing confectionary company in the world!

As the Sales Strategy Analyst, you'll be responsible for supporting the development of the Ferrero US Sales Strategy in terms of the long-term growth plan. The Sales Strategy Analyst will also influence the communication process with our central Sales Development team in Luxembourg for managing key priorities and ensuring delivery of our financial objectives. This role is inclusive of analytical accountability and presentation development supporting the Director of Sales Strategy and Integration as it relates to monthly reviews with the US Sales VP of Strategy & Operations, as well as, the CCO. The Sales Strategy Analyst will report into the Director of Sales Strategy & Integration.

This role is hybrid and based in our US headquarters in Parsippany, NJ.



Main Responsibilities:
Support the development of our overall Sales Strategy including creation of three year midterm Strategic Plan enablers, evolution of the Channel strategies, Sales Organizational design/structure, and Broker RTM Operating model
Maintain accountability for enabling our Sales communication with Central Sales Business Development Group (SBD) for strategic initiatives, Global customer planning, and Commercial Policy activities
Collaborate with Director of Sales Strategy on all Channel strategic plans to align with overarching Sales three year Strategy and US Sales growth plan
Facilitate the implementation of our Broker Strategy for RTM Operating and activity-based performance model
Coordinate the Sales Communication strategy with all internal cross functional departments to ensure consistent flow of information, including managing organization master calendar
Operate as Analytics lead for Sales priority projects including Broker RFP / MyPS / Dedicated Retail Performance model
Enable the development of the Monthly North America business reviews for the Chief Customer Officer to support presentations with Sales Business Development, the North America Area CBO, and Group CEO
Support the annual sales planning process between trade marketing and customer teams, including template building, distribution, and final rollup of numbers including analysis on forward looking trends
Provide guidance to Channel VPs for ensuring Key Performance Indicator (KPI) execution

Who we are looking for:
Bachelor’s Degree required; 2+ years of CPG Experience preferred
Possess critical thinking skills, quantitative and analytical/problem solving skills with ability to interpret data
Multi-channel CPG experience (C-store, Mass, Grocery, Dollar, e-Comm, Foodservice & Value)
Strategic and pro-active with interpersonal skills and an ability to influence cross functional teams
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to build consensus and foster positive relationships.
Strong project management skills

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you’ll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Diversity Statement

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

Ferrero N.A. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics.

Job Title: Data Analytics & Business Intelligence Insurance Lead
Job Description:
Company Description


We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.



Job Description


The Analytical Data Operations (ADO) division is Verisk/ISO's data refinery, ensuring that ISO's analytical engines are properly fueled. As a member of ADO you will be part of a team of data analysts, BI developers, data engineers, data architects, and actuarial/analytical-engineers that are dedicated to improve our data analytics platform to support a host of products the US P&C industry relies on.

Your purpose is to serve as subject matter expert for all data and related information for the line of business experience. You will collaborate with other team leads and stakeholders to understand and explain industry trends and develop industry expertise across our product portfolio. Additionally, you will work with our international data operations team to develop new tools to expand and enhance your team’s ability to develop industry insights at scale and to drive real change in the US P&C insurance market.

You will operate within a Shared Services model, where you will be expected to manage stakeholder expectations and organize deliverables across junior staff. You will be expected to develop expertise in multiple lines of business, AGILE project management, and advanced analytics using SQL on our cloud data warehouse, being at the forefront of data analytics for the P&C industry. Your responsibilities include:

Work directly with line of business stakeholders to understand business needs, gather, manipulate, and analyze data to deliver digestible insights that drive business decisions

Analyze industry data for personal lines property coverages to identify trends, anomalies, and data quality issues, ensuring product teams are aware of impacts to our analytics driven by industry experience

Develop data reports and visualizations using business intelligence and analytics software

Lead quarterly presentations with LOB stakeholders to discuss data analysis results, summarizing and synthesizing analysis from junior team members, and documenting key take aways from discussions

Mange our data steward relationship with the insurance carriers, providing prompt and meaningful analysis of their data to ensure their compliance with regulatory requirements and the applicability of our industry benchmark analytics to their business

Drive organizational change in how we deliver results both internally and externally



Qualifications


Required Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in a STEM major or with STEM coursework learned in associated majors (Actuarial Science, Computer Science, Data Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, Economics)

A minimum of three years P&C insurance data analysis experience with a focus on Commercial Property Lines or Casualty coverages such as General Liability, Medical Professional Liability, and Personal Liability would be beneficial

Excellent communication skills (both oral and written) are required, with a desire to improve presentation and persuasion skills

A passion for using data and technology to understand the real world and drive change with a focus on the importance of data quality

Experience supervising junior team members and a strong record of building great stakeholder relationships

Excellent SQL, Excel/BI skills with a focus on data analysis

A self-starter with a commitment to innovation and pro-active problem solving

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in Python, VBA, SAS, and R is preferred.

Commitment to attainment of an insurance professional designation (ACAS, CPCU, AIDM)

Commitment to attainment of a technology or project management designations

You will be part of a culture that celebrates success, recognizes and rewards achievements and excellence, and provides personal and professional enrichment opportunities.

#LI-MC1


Additional Information


In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.

For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.

Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.

We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.

Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. About us

Since Aspen was founded in 2002, we have become a leading, diversified specialty insurance and reinsurance company. We respond thoughtfully and creatively to find the best outcomes for our clients and business partners through carefully-tailored solutions.

We believe the way we work is just as important as the work we do, and we are guided by our core values of respect, honesty, trust and professionalism.

Aspen is a great place to develop your career offering an exciting and challenging environment where achievement is rewarded.

The role

This role sits in Insurance Operations to ensure effective utilization and maintenance of key underwriting processes and systems. Partner with the AVP, Senior Underwriting Services Manager and Line of Business Leaders to develop a scalable business process re-engineering roadmap, applying a best practice approach. Lead the development and translation of operational business requirements for workflow solutions, modifications, enhancements, etc., liaising with IT/other internal and external stakeholders to help achieve business outcomes. Our Aspen Values are expected to be reflected in the delivery and performance of every role.

Key accountabilities
Contribute functional strategy development/prioritize operational deliverables to support business targets
Support in BPO/IT vendor evaluation for US Insurance portfolio and review RFI/RFP for potential vendors
In-house product ownership for Magic Submission, other applications/products in the US Insurance Portfolio (Duck Creek)
Support management with performance of IT services, both internally and through 3rd party suppliers, to support the service expectations of the business
Support governance framework to ensure best practice and compliance with internal/external regulations
Create offer construct/influence alignment to define standards, complete build tasks and activities and socialize cross-functionally, they are understood clearly
Proactively manage any issues, risks, roadblocks to deliver the offer per the committed timeline
Support design, development, implementation and coordination of IT systems and associated policies and procedures to facilitate effective business support
Understand interfaces/data flows across systems, to flag downstream impacts
Ensure security of data, network access/backup systems for legal compliance and business continuity
Identify continuous improvement opportunities to increase cost effectiveness and infrastructure flexibility
Works with key stakeholders/business managers to support with the development of sustainable IT systems and services and monitoring of progress to achieve business strategy/plans
Combine business insights with emerging and/or existing technologies while identifying and prioritizing value-creation opportunities to deliver service-value to end users and customers
Act as single point of contact for new demand coming from Ops, the Line Of Business, or Shared Services, for all US Insurance applications enhancement requests - responsible for assessment of the requests and prioritizing/scheduling with the impacted IT Delivery Teams
Run change control meetings present change requests from business to budget owners for all applications currently under management
Liaise with external third party vendors, Compliance, Finance, Legal and Aspen IT Delivery Leads
Contributes to the delivery of a cost-effective Insurance Operations service, which contributes to Aspen’s overall profitability and business performance
Create and capture requirements, tracking changes, identifying risks and issues for escalation, and monitoring and reporting on work and progress
Skills & experience
Strong knowledge of technical management, information analysis and of computer hardware/software systems
Associate degree in computer science, or equivalent experience
Good working knowledge of ITIL Service Delivery processes (preferably with formal certification)
Knowledge of the industry’s best practice processes with particular emphasis on Bermuda
Understanding of underlying needs of the business and how own role contributes to these
Business and financial awareness of the impact of service levels
Strong level of numeracy and literacy skills
Able to manage conflicting priorities to achieve deadlines
Ability to collaborate effectively within a team environment
Ability to build and maintain effective relationships with customers at all levels and explain technical solutions to non-technical audiences, inclusive of understanding/empathizing with customers while remaining committed to providing quality results with positive service
Strong influencing and negotiating skills
Ability to analyze data and use for decision-making
Proficient in relevant software, including MS Office applications
Able to work independently
Ability to apply discretion resulting in appropriate/desired resolutions
A “can do” attitude with flexibility over what tasks, especially in regard to front-line support, are undertaken to deliver service
Ability to thrive in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment
Previous experience in writing business requirements as a Product Owner working in an Agile Framework for Scrum Methodology, grooming the backlog, and continuous improvement mind-set
Previous underwriting systems experience
Specific professional qualifications at the level of degree or equivalent (e.g. computer science, management of information systems or similar)
Qualified within own personal discipline, with extensive post-qualification work experience (4-6 years as a Business Analyst in a global IT organization) to include: Evidence of understanding and supporting operational systems and process flows, Working as part of a senior team within a complex organization (preferably within financial services or Reinsurance industry)

Job Summary
The Market Access Operations Analyst will support the Market Access Organization by providing analytical and operational support to the Patient Support Services, Managed Markets, Payer Marketing, and other internal MA teams for all branded products. The ideal candidate will be a high-energy, detail-oriented, analytical individual with a strong focus on identifying insights from multiple data sources to help drive business growth.


Area of Responsibility
Develop, implement, coordinate, and manage market access reporting, including ad-hoc requests from internal and external stakeholders
Reviews weekly/monthly patient support services data (copay, prior authorization, PAP) to identify gaps and trends
Preparation of detailed monthly and quarterly review documents for presentation to senior leaders
Vendor management, including tracking and coordination for invoices


Qualifications
Bachelor's degree required; or equivalent direct experience
Demonstrated ability to use Microsoft Office Suite with strong emphasis in Excel (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc.)
General understanding of pharmaceutical business (preferable, but not mandatory)
Strong analytical skills and the ability to organize large amounts of data, identify trends
Proven ability to work cross-functionally with diverse groups and areas of expertise
Ability to work independently, setting goals and driving deliverables
Experience w/ analytics and business intelligence tools preferred
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics
Able to manage any of a number of special projects that may be collaborative or single contributor in scope. These special projects may be assigned or individually developed out of the need for process improvement, increased operational efficiency, or training needs as they may arise
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree required
1 -2 years of experience and knowledge of pharmaceutical industry preferred

Background & Purpose of the Job

Customer Business Development (CBD) is what we call our Sales organization at Unilever. CBD works closely with customers to pioneer new products, build categories, and deploy best-in-class retail and shopper capabilities.

As the Sales Analyst - Drug Channel , you will play a key role in providing analytical support, proactively analyzing, and reviewing information to identify opportunities or potential challenges across Unilever’s businesses. The focus of the position is to serve as key support to the Customer Business Manager and Business Development Manager for Health & Beauty Division across all categories/brands and key stakeholders within Unilever.

You will report directly to the Customer Business Manager and also work closely with Division Director, BDM, Team Leads and category CBM’s to achieve our goals. This role is vital to the success of the Health & Beauty business and will help ensure our strategic/financial health in the Sector. It will require someone who is self-motivated with excellent influencing skills, has an ability to work independently and is team oriented.

Who You Are & What You’ll Do

You are a born leader: You seek fresh opportunities, insisting on innovation and never settling for “good enough.” You take pride in delivering work to the highest standards.

You are a strategy guru: You love to think outside the box and imagine new possibilities for the business. You are a visionary, creating strategies to drive business growth and inspiring others along the way.

You love to win and have fun doing it: You believe in taking the lead in the marketplace versus following. You have a positive attitude about the company's future and a passion for winning.

You are a changemaker: You know there is always a way we can improve results and you are committed to helping others see those possibilities.

You are a dot connector: You are good in problem solving; possess initiative and drive to solve problems with limited direction and raise analyses beyond reporting

You’re a paradox navigator: Able to navigate ambiguity, step back, and dig deep to uncover best solutions to customer challenges. Design right approach right for both organization and customer

Provide in depth analytical support focused on business solutions in presentation ready formats

Analyze business to identify and understand business trends and provide recommended solutions

Create sales ready presentations with analysis to be presented to the account, brands, and internal teams

Use existing data platforms to create new methodology to analyze business opportunities and risks

Collaborate with team within Unilever and customer to share best practice analysis

Thorough promotional analysis on all events that will lead to insights on efficiency and productivity

Positive attitude takes ownership and initiative to fix problems

Must be skilled in verbal and written communications

Utilize business systems to extract and review business metrics including sales, shipments, and supply chain measures

Generate bi-weekly customer-facing sales and promotion performance reporting with commentary

Analyze promotion on monthly basis including Unilever promotions across customers as well as competitive set

Support price pack architecture assessment as well as new item performance

What You’ll Need to Succeed

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing or related area preferred.

Minimum one year of related experience; demonstrating knowledge of customer, data, systems, and ability to analyze info and trends to make recommendations.

Possess excellent computer skills; especially with Microsoft tools; strong analytical skills and solutions oriented.

Must have strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize, and great verbal and written communication

Must have high system aptitude; knowledge of Circana/IRI, Excel, SSAS, Customer POS systems, and Power BI is preferred

You can manage multiple projects / processes at one time; and can handle increasingly more responsibility as new platforms are launched

Strong communicate skills to work across Customer Business Managers, Business Development, Headquarters Planning group and Customer Service organization; have the skills to connect with team and create solutions to problem areas.

Positive attitude, takes ownership and initiative to fix business challenges

Must be a strategic thinker that can work effectively, and in a highly collaborative manner

Ability to think creatively in assisting in designing strong promotional plans and influence company

Has ability to think outside the box, is "scrappy", and has ability to work independently to find solutions

What We Can Offer You

Culture for Growth | Top Notch Employee Health & Well Being Benefits | Every Voice Matters | Global Reach | Life at Unilever | Careers with Purpose | World Class Career Development Programs | Check Out Our Space | Focus On Sustainability

Summary and Duties

If you are considering a new job, work environment or career opportunities you should look at Mercer County Community College. MCCC is a publicly supported college that is open to all and dedicated to student success. In order to support that mission Mercer seeks to attract, retain, and support a skilled diverse workforce which is our most valuable resource. We thrive on and are proud of our diversity and open access. Our students and employees find the College large enough for a multitude of offerings yet small enough to keep the “Community” feel for all. The College consists of two campuses, the James Kerney Campus (JKC) in the capital city of Trenton, NJ and a larger 292-acre suburban campus just six miles north of Trenton.

As part of the comprehensive and valuable benefits package the College offers credit course tuition waivers for employees, spouses and dependents. This allows for employees and their families to take advantage of earning a higher education degree without the high cost. The College offers students 69 Degree Program Options and 35 Credit Certificates from which to choose.

JOB DUTIES

Under the direction of the Director of Enterprise Information Services, the Business Analyst is responsible for the plan, design, develop, and launch of efficient information systems and operations systems in support of core organizational functions. The individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve systems issues. The Business Analyst will assess business processes to make recommendations in order to maximize the benefit of Enterprise Information systems improvements. Doing so involves working closely with users to gather and document detailed and accurate requirements, propose effective solutions, and assist staff with reporting needs. The Business Analyst will be responsible for providing systems analysis, problem-solving support, and necessary programming support to provide efficient and effective use of information systems in support of the institution’s goals and objectives while maintaining data integrity. The individual will:



Assist in the planning, designing, development, and deployment of applications in the Student Information System (Ellucian Colleague) as well as other third-party applications.
Meet with decision-makers, systems owners, and end-users to define business requirements and systems goals, and identify and resolve business systems issues.
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and work with the supervisor to develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.
Provide orientation and training to end-users for all modified and new systems.
Creating specifications for new programs to meet the needs of the institution.
Designing and developing advanced reports using MS SQL Reporting Services (SSRS) and Entrinsik Informer. MS SQL and PostgreSQL are used.
Write and maintain documentation related to changes to code, scripts, programs, and other end-user specifications.
Provide technical assistance by responding to inquiries regarding errors, problems, or questions with programs.
Provide maintenance, appropriate use, production and problem-solving support, and ad-hoc reporting support
Plan and develop day-to-day procedures to promote the successful performance of systems.
