Medical, Dental, Vision (including same and opposite-sex domestic partners)
HSA and FSA plans, Family Benefits, Pet Benefits
401(k) Plan with an Employer Match
Paid Time Off, Commuter Benefits, Educational Assistance
Robust Diversity, Equity and Inclusion program including 7 Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
We are OUTFRONT, in name and nature. Come join us!
Your Role
We're seeking an Analyst specializing in Business Process, Transactional Services, possessing a blend of technical and interpersonal skills, to spearhead enhancements in operational processes aligning with our business strategy. At the outset, the Analyst, Business Process, Transactional Services will immerse themselves in our operations, cultivating expertise and familiarizing themselves with our system landscape. The Analyst, Business Process, Transactional Services will partner with business leadership to chart a course toward realizing our strategic objectives. This will involve dissecting existing processes and systems, as well as creating models for proposed improvements. Collaborative work with technical experts will be essential in formulating and implementing streamlined and impactful process upgrades. The role will demand a high degree of organizational finesse and effective communication abilities to thrive.
Your Responsibilities
Evolve into a subject matter expert within your designated business domain, comprehending the interplay between core IT systems, vital functions, business workflows, key contributors, and cross-departmental/system integrations.
Evaluate existing processes, redesign as necessary, and execute refined strategies that amplify efficiency, generating operational streamlining to fortify our business strategy.
Conduct workshops involving stakeholders across all organizational tiers engaged in business processes.
Draft specifications and functional prerequisites for Technology unit, driving enhancements to current applications and platforms.
Engage in user acceptance testing for technological enhancements and system modifications.
Oversee, gauge, and facilitate user assimilation for both current and novel products/processes. Cultivate robust, collaborative relationships with both Business and Technology sectors.
Discern optimal practices and codify them into standardized operational protocols.
Craft and sustain standardized operating procedures, encompassing comprehensive documentation of process evolution, deployment, and long-term support strategies.
Address training necessities concerning business procedures and systems.
Architect expandable support frameworks for updates to products and/or processes.
Collaborate with the sales hierarchy to devise and amass insights on proposed processes. Partner with Technology Program Management to orchestrate project scheduling, resource allocation, role delineation, and management of risks and issues.
Your Qualifications
Accumulated 3-5 years of experience in roles such as process engineering, business consulting, or leadership within a business context.
Proficiency in process modeling/prototyping and the formulation of standardized operating procedures.
Exceptional aptitude for creative problem-solving and analytical thinking.
Capability to envision, design, and execute strategic blueprints to advance business enhancements.
Proactive mindset, adept at collaborating with multifaceted teams to navigate intricate project completion.
Inquisitive nature, driven by a fervent commitment to continuous learning and remaining attuned to industry trends and challenges.
Established track record of thriving in remote work settings, showcasing the capacity to yield outstanding outcomes sans direct supervision.
Proficiency in juggling multiple tasks, adeptly prioritizing, and consistently meeting deadlines. Keen business acumen complemented by superb communication proficiencies.

Overview:

The Digital Technology Services (DTS) Senior Business Analyst (SBA) is the link between the business objectives and core technological capabilities the team is building across the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network. An agile team requires constant adaptation and innovation to turn customer needs into outputs. Goal is to drive organized and effective requirements to build the product. Responsible for utilizing creative and practical thinking to translate requirements into direct improvements. Is then responsible for ensuring the team knows and understands what they are expected to build through a backlog and user stories and how it connects to overall objectives. Is the team's source for business logic, requirements, analysis, testing features once ready etc.

This position is remote - up to 25% onsite.


Responsibilities:
A day in the life of a Digital Technology Services (DTS) Senior Business Analyst (SBA) at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:


Collaborate with a Product Owner to shape the end-to-end product strategy and determine business value.
Elicit requirements to accomplish team goals.
Support the product owners in collaborating with other teams and leadership to ensure team strategy aligns with overall product vision.
Serve as the day to day contact for the team on clarification of requirements and drive user stories.
Exercise strong decision making mandate across the team as a proxy to the Product or Senior Product Owner.
Stay in sync with the product owners on priorities and day to day decision making.
Utilize market and industry knowledge to translate user needs into user stories and acceptance criteria for their team. Maintain a backlog 3 to 4 sprints ahead of the team.
Define, implement and track performance metrics once a solution enters production.
Prep and support the team on product demos.
Manage customer relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up-to-date on project results.
Recommend and provide insight into the best techniques in delivery.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Bachelor's degree in a related field.
Minimum of 3-5 years of strong experience in a business analyst role.
Knowledge of analytical tools (e.g., Tableau, Python).
Agile ceremony facilitation familiarity.
Key performance indicator (KPI) creation and management.
Knowledge of healthcare provider ecosystem.
Translation of business requirements to technical.
Experience with data analytics.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to think critically, intellectually curious, prioritize, and a desire to learn.
Relationship building and ability to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of the Agile work process.
Ability to see the big-picture and has detail-oriented thinking.
Proficient computer skills including but not limited to Microsoft Office and Google Suite platforms.


Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Background that is comprised of both healthcare provider knowledge as well as expert understanding of high-quality analytics product delivery.

About the NBA

The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a global sports and media organization with the mission to inspire and connect people everywhere through the power of basketball. Built around five professional sports leagues: the NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, NBA 2K League and Basketball Africa League, the NBA has established a major international presence with games and programming available in 215 countries and territories in more than 50 languages, and merchandise for sale in more than 200 countries and territories on all seven continents. NBA rosters at the start of the 2021-22 season featured a record 121 international players from 40 countries. NBA Digital’s assets include NBA TV, NBA.com, the NBA App and NBA League Pass. The NBA has created one of the largest social media communities in the world, with 2.1 billion likes and followers globally across all league, team, and player platforms. Through NBA Cares, the league addresses important social issues by working with internationally recognized youth-serving organizations that support education, youth and family development, and health-related causes.

Regulatory Reporting Business Analyst

Position Description
CGI is seeking to hire a Business Analyst with 4 to 5 years' experience in Regulatory Reporting and Capital Markets. The individual is primarily responsible for day-to-day operational execution to broader planning within this area of expertise. Functions within the team can include remediating issues identified; control and risk management and reporting process improvement; providing support for regulatory change initiatives; and researching and responding to regulatory inquiries and exams. Additionally, the individual will use subject matter expertise while representing the department or function at a broader level. Additional responsibilities may include performing user testing for new or existing process improvements, detailing new procedures related to new reports on-boarded while acting as a go-to-person/escalation point for questions from analysts and other areas. This role may focus on multiple forms of regulatory reporting, such as Electronic Blue Sheets, OATS, LOPR, Short Interest, TRACE, MSRB, CAT and more. The role works closely with several areas of the Firm to support the above functions, including various business groups within the Firm, Compliance, Legal, Finance, and Technology.

Role requires to be On-Site with Client a minimum of 2 days per week.

Your future duties and responsibilities
Review and analyze new business, rule changes or system changes that impact reporting processes and perform associated testing / checkouts.
Coordinate the remediation of reporting anomalies (raise Jira, document requirements, and perform checkout etc.)
Develop UAT strategy, document test cases and execute testing of applicable regulatory, business or control changes.
Acts as an effective layer of escalation for junior or less experienced staff on complex issues.
Drive process improvement or re-engineering by identifying and implementing automation opportunities.
Lead the development and implementation of controls to ensure the timeliness, accuracy, and completeness of reporting.
Document, revise and maintain procedures as the need arises; ensure team is trained on all procedures.
Produce presentations for a range of stakeholders highlighting achievements, regulatory reporting metrics, regulatory risks and change management initiatives.
Serve as a liaison for Regulatory Services on assigned projects; ensure Regulatory Services is advised of program developments and potential impacts to existing processes and reporting logic.
Lead the development of performance management metrics for the group across daily, weekly, or monthly regulatory reports including: Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned!

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Strong understanding of financial products (Equities, Listed Derivatives, Fixed Income, and/or OTC Derivatives) and US regulatory reporting requirements.
Understanding of sophisticated option's trading to include options allocations.
Strong understanding of the trade life cycle (Orders, Executions, Allocations) required.
Understanding of Middle Office Trade Processing.
Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned!
Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio.
Proficiency with Broadridge and Fidessa is helpful.

Position Overview:
The Technical Product Analyst role bridges product development, client support, and Agile practices while working on the Product team. Responsibilities include delivering high impact data analysis to cross functional stakeholders, Agile participation, translating user needs into technical specifications, conducting product demos, and providing first-line client support. You'll generate data-driven insights, and collaborate closely with Sales, Marketing, and Engineering.
Strong organizational skills, clear communication, and innovation are essential. One of the core competencies of a Technical Product Analyst will be expertise in data analysis, with a focus on deriving insights from large data sets.
Key responsibilities:
Participate in relevant Agile ceremonies: Daily Stand-Ups, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Planning, Sprint Review, Sprint Retrospective.
Serve as the first point of contact for client inquiries, providing timely and accurate responses to questions and issues related to our products.
Generate reports using SQL and Tableau to support Sales and Account Managers in their efforts, including data availability and network insights.
Collaborate with the marketing team by providing data and analysis to create compelling content and promotional materials.
Assist with the elaboration of the user stories and requirements translating user needs into technical requirements for our development team.
Conduct product demonstrations to showcase the features and capabilities of our product.
Consult with the business and product owners to prioritize and shape the product backlog, using Agile practices for prioritization around business value
Conduct research to identify and evaluate potential data sources for product enhancements, such as Medicare fee schedules, utilization data, UDS data, and provider services data.
Collaborate with Solution Owners and/or Product Managers when defining product release content and timeline, applying product development principles, innovative thinking and a focus around the customer or user experience.
Perform analysis and identify gaps in functionality for system integrations.
Collaborate with the Scrum team to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs.
The ability to multi-task and work on multiple assignments will be required.
This individual must also demonstrate clear and concise communication both verbally and in writing. Including sales, client facing teams and clients
Actively contribute innovative ideas and support ad hoc projects, including time-sensitive requests
Accurately scopes out projects, sets objectives, and goals, develops schedules, measures performance against goals, and evaluates results
Maintains awareness of and ensure adherence to ZELIS standards regarding privacy.
Technical Skills:
Strong SQL knowledge and expertise required
Proficiency with Microsoft Office products - Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, Teams
Experience with the Atlassian suite of products (Jira, Confluence, etc.) and/or Product Board is a plus
Professional Experience:
3+ years of experience with Business Analysis and/or Data Analysis
3+ years of experienced healthcare industry business/product analyst with expertise in managed care, claims pricing/adjudication, EDI, government programs
Strong SQL knowledge and expertise required
Knowledge of SDLC methodologies including experience working in an Agile environment
Experience in product development life cycle

As a leading payments company in healthcare, we guide, price, explain, and pay for care on behalf of insurers and their members. We’re Zelis in our pursuit to align the interests of payers, providers, and consumers to deliver a better financial experience and more affordable, transparent care for all. We partner with more than 700 payers, including the top-5 national health plans, BCBS insurers, regional health plans, TPAs and self-insured employers, over 4 million providers, and 100 million members, enabling the healthcare industry to pay for care, with care. Zelis brings adaptive technology, a deeply ingrained service culture, and a comprehensive navigation through adjudication and payment platform to manage the complete payment process.
Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging
At Zelis, we champion diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging in all aspects of our operations. We embrace the power of diversity and create an environment where people can bring their authentic and best selves to work. We know that a sense of belonging is key not only to your success at Zelis, but also to your ability to bring your best each day.

Sr. Business Systems Analyst needed in Edison, NJ and various undetermined locations throughout the US to design, develop, test, & implement business management systems. Job Title: Vice President, Technology Lead Business Analyst-Hybrid-IMM-conversion
Job Description:
As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do. We keep the bank safe and provide the technical tools our workers need to be successful. We design our digital architecture and ensure our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. Our operations teams manage risk, resources, and program management. We focus on enterprise resiliency and business continuity. We develop, coordinate, and execute strategic operational plans. Essentially, Enterprise Operations & Technology re-engineers client and partner processes to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and controlled services.

Global Functions Technology is a diverse organization comprised of more than 15,000 talented professionals with some of the brightest minds – all working together to realize Citi’s Vision of growth and economic progress. As a group, we partner with the Finance, Risk, Compliance, and Human Resources teams to drive the delivery of innovative technology solutions using common data, analytics, and platforms. Our technology operates in real-time environments, capturing and managing market, transaction, and accounting data, as well as the data from millions of customers daily. Our solutions cover all products and geographies in which Citi does business. We are the backbone for reporting across the bank, satisfying our regulatory commitments, enabling our businesses to be nimbler and helping to safeguard customer assets through highly effective controls.

Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve globally from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.

Genesis Team Lead is responsible for overseeing the design and support of data integration between Finance and Risk platforms. This includes models developed in support of a global data warehouse and reporting databases as well as transactional databases for use by Finance, Enterprise Risk and Compliance across all lines of business. Analyst will be responsible for all deliverables associated with the models, including source to target mappings and data consumption. Analyst will also support development, testing, and production of the data warehouse as part of the Data Consumption team.

Develop transformation logic to support the data consumption requirements
Assess the quality of data during development and test phases of the projects, and own the resolution of the data quality issues by working with development teams
Work with technology/business teams to provide standards based solution
Develop or enhance standards for logical and physical model development.
Develop mappings of sources to target databases, including documentation of transformation rules.
Communicate regularly with architects and modelers working in parallel tracks to maintain consistency of models and other deliverables.
Oversee the development of scripts to correct bad data or to implement data model changes as required.

Knowledge / Skills Required

6+ years of data analysis experience
6+ years experience building large Data Warehouses (30+ TB) and back-office systems.
5+ years RDBMS experience: Netezza, Teradata, and Oracle preferred.
3+ years experience in implementing Financial GL and sub-ledger systems.
Past experience with banking products such as deposits, loans, securities, derivatives, etc.
Past experience preferred with Basel RWA/EAD calculations
Domain knowledge in Accounting, Finance, Risk Management and/or Regulatory Reporting in the Banking industry.
Ability to write complex SQL needed to investigate data issues, repair damaged data, and migrate data to new structures.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including use of Excel for presentation of data and mappings.
Demonstrate Complete System Development Life Cycle experience for large scale complex projects with various industries.
Ability to work independently under strict deadlines.
Passion to deliver results in a complex enterprise application / environment
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent work experience

The Product Manager / Business Analyst will lead ideation, research, design, development and launch of user-centric VR/AR solutions. This role will drive the requirements gathering, specification and documentation processes, as well as be the steward of the product roadmap management process. The role will support the work related to writing personas, user stories, storyboards, user requirements, functional requirements and test cases. The role will also help with task analysis, task elicitation, observations, documentation review and use cases documentation.

We are looking for a talented and self-driven individual to add to our team. You will work intimately with an interdisciplinary team of professionals and play a key role in carrying out product development from conception to execution.

Strategy Responsibilities

Contribute to product strategy and vision, roadmaps, prioritization, and drive product development from conceptualization, design, development, to launch.
Think strategically for long-term impact while understanding and taking into account business and technical constraints.
Conduct ongoing competitive analysis of other apps and products to continually identify ways to improve our user experience.
Carry out research to identify needs that new or improved products can fulfill
Works with stakeholders to determine and document user requirements.

Project Management Responsibilities

Develop schedules of the development program and monitor progress against goals.
Set up reviews at each stage to ensure the program is meeting its objectives
Triage questions or issues that are reported by customers or internal team members.
Develop comprehensive end-to-end test cases.
Performs functional reviews and/or acceptance testing.

Communication Responsibilities

Create direct channels of communication to software and application developers that get the job done without managerial involvement.
Ensure that individual members keep the rest of the team informed on progress

Qualifications

We are looking for someone who possess these traits:

A storyteller that can present a compelling narrative.
Can communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Comfort in ambiguity, but you strive to create clarity for others.
Be a people person; adept at reading people and empathizing with our users.
Appetite for working at a startup.
Desire from taking a product from concept to launch.
Be nimble and flexible; happy to work with a range of timelines and pivot when things don’t go as planned.
Superior analytical and quantitative skills; experience using data and metrics to test theories, confirm assumptions, and measure success
Practical experience leading a VR/AR project or product is mandatory

Education and Experience

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in related field.
5+ years of associated work experience.
Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio.
Working knowledge of Unified Modeling Language (UML).
Experience with Agile methodologies.
Strong experience in user testing.
Practical experience with VR or AR is mandatory

US work authorization is required. No sponsorship will be provided.

We are growing! We have an opportunity for you to join the C.A. Ferolie team in the Montvale, New Jersey office. We are looking for an enthusiastic Business Intelligence Systems Operations Manager to work collaboratively on top-tier CPG brands with top grocery customers to deliver exceptional results.

Who We Are

At C.A. Ferolie, we pride ourselves on maintaining strong traditions of excellence, providing our valued clients with tailored sales and marketing solutions since 1947. Our teams are enthusiastic, experienced, and knowledgeable people who consistently exceed expectations. We are family-owned and operated, giving us unparalleled flexibility to invest locally in talent and development that delivers industry-leading results.

Overview of the Role

As Business Intelligence Systems Operations Manager, you will design, coordinate, and implement reporting systems for CA Ferolie clients and customers. This will be accomplished using assorted tools, disparate data sources, and database organizational tools. This role directly links Business Intelligence and IT to deliver best-in-class reporting with enhanced automation and expansion capabilities.

What You Will Do

Manage Business Intelligence Systems Infrastructure, Software, and Sharepoint Network to provide best-in-class tools and reporting aligned with the growth of our business and industry.
Using Power BI and other software tools, develop, maintain, and constantly enhance analytical tools, reporting, and resources.
Develop reporting methodology to measure whitespace and quantify opportunity gaps across all clients and customers.
Function as an IT liaison with Nielsen to ensure the Extract project is accurate and error-free, with seamless data transition for all measured customers and clients.
Plan, organize, and prioritize tasks to meet all deadlines; report regularly on the status of projects; meet or exceed on-time and quality expectations; work closely with managers regarding all project aspects.
Evaluate the effectiveness of programs and communication strategy best practices internally and externally.
Working jointly with sales and business managers, become the Business Intelligence systems expert for CA Ferolie.
Establish professional and frequent lines of communication with clients, supervisors, associates, and customers and elevate issues and opportunities in a timely manner.
Participates in training and development programs to improve communication, organization, analytical, presentation, and negotiation skills.
Is a "team player"; is honest and forthright with all parties; works well with peers; trains and develops subordinates; adheres in all respects to the Code of Business Conduct.

Competencies You Should Bring to the Table

Leadership - Exhibits confidence in self and others; Inspires and motivates others to perform well; effectively influences actions and opinions of others; Gives appropriate recognition to others.
Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs workflows and procedures.
Design - Generates creative solutions; Translates concepts and information into images; Uses feedback to modify designs; Applies design principles.
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem-solving situations; Demonstrates emotional intelligence to achieve reasonable outcomes.
Professionalism – Conducts oneself with responsibility, integrity, accountability, and excellence: Demonstrates grace under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Follows through on commitments.
Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.
Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.
Project Management – Plans, organizes, and completes projects on time and budget; Proactively manages project team activities; Effectively communicates changes and progress in a timely manner.
Innovation - Displays original thinking and creativity; Meets challenges with resourcefulness; Generates suggestions for improving work; Develops innovative approaches and ideas; Presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention.
Teamwork - Accepts and provides feedback, looks for the good in every situation, seeks the valuable lesson in every setback, looks for the solution to every problem; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale by supporting individual and group commitments to achieve goals and objectives.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent; five years CPG industry experience.
Must know basic arithmetic operations such as addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication to accurately calculate budgets, net sales, margins, promotional percentages, discounts, and commissions. Ability to calculate figures and apply concepts to sales velocity ratios, days of supply, pallet configurations, and sales forecasting.
Must possess critical thinking skills like analysis, evaluation, and synthesis, as well as abstract thinking, creative thinking, information processing, and problem-solving. Ability to prioritize workload and set goals.
Have a strong working knowledge of the fundamentals of Microsoft Office Suite of Programs, including but not limited to Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Knowledge of syndicated systems and their applications in the trade marketing/ BI function (IRI, Nielsen, SPINS, etc.) is required. Additional capabilities in Power BI and other software tools are necessary.
Must have a valid driver's license and a clean DMV report.

Perks:

Paid Holidays
Medical/Dental/Vision/VTL
Flexible Spending Account
Company-paid Life/AD&D Insurance
401k match
Generous PTO

Job Title: Business Analyst - Regulatory Reporting, Capital Markets
Job Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

US Regulatory Services is responsible for ensuring timely, accurate, and complete reporting to various exchanges, self-regulatory organizations and the SEC. The individual in this role is primarily responsible for day-to-day operational execution to broader planning within this area of expertise. Functions within the team can include remediating issues identified; control and risk management and reporting process improvement; providing support for regulatory change initiatives; and researching and responding to regulatory inquiries and exams. Additionally, the individual will utilize subject matter expertise while representing the department or function at a broader level. Additional responsibilities may include performing user testing for new or existing process enhancements, documenting new procedures related to new reports on-boarded while acting as a go-to-person/escalation point for questions from analysts and other areas. This role may focus on multiple forms of regulatory reporting, such as Electronic Blue Sheets, OATS, LOPR, Short Interest, TRACE, MSRB, CAT and more. The role works closely with several areas of the Firm to support the above functions, including various business groups within the Firm, Compliance, Legal, Finance, and Technology.

What will you do?

Review and analyze new business, rule changes or system changes that impact reporting processes and perform associated testing / checkouts
Coordinate the remediation of reporting anomalies (raise JIRAs, document requirements, and perform checkout etc.)
Develop UAT strategy, document test cases and execute testing of applicable regulatory, business or control changes
Acts as an effective layer of escalation for junior or less experienced staff on complex issues
Drive process improvement or re-engineering by identifying and implementing automation opportunities
Lead the development and implementation of controls to ensure the timeliness, accuracy and completeness of reporting
Document, revise and maintain procedures as required; ensure team is trained on all procedures
Produce presentations for a range of stakeholders highlighting achievements, regulatory reporting metrics, regulatory risks and change management initiatives
Serve as a liaison for Regulatory Services on assigned projects; ensure Regulatory Services is informed of program developments and potential impacts to existing processes and reporting logic
Lead the development of performance management metrics for the group across daily, weekly, or monthly regulatory reports including: Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Required, preferably in Engineering or Business or a related subject
Big 4 Consulting / Advisory experience ; At least 4 years preferred

Job Title: Digital Technology Services (DTS) Lead Data Analyst
Job Description:
Overview:
Our team members are the heart of what makes us better.


At Hackensack Meridian Health we help our patients live better, healthier lives — and we help one another to succeed. With a culture rooted in connection and collaboration, our employees are team members. Here, competitive benefits are just the beginning. It’s also about how we support one another and how we show up for our community.


Together, we keep getting better - advancing our mission to transform healthcare and serve as a leader of positive change.

The Digital Technology Services (DTS) Lead Data Analyst is responsible for translating and programming vast amounts of data into understandable, relevant and actionable information. Interfacing with business units (finance, HR, etc.) across the Hackensack Meridian Health (HMH) network, will use expertise to provide business insights, design and deliver reports, and drive self-service reporting capabilities across the organization. Critical to be actively engaged in developing and promoting effective data governance through documentation and adherence of standards to assure that the information produced and provided by the Analytics team is accurate and trusted as the source of truth.

We strongly prefer candidates with Looker and/or Claims experience.


Responsibilities:
A day in the life of a Digital Technology Services (DTS) Lead Data Analyst at Hackensack Meridian Health includes:
Responsible for identifying, understanding, acquiring, merging, and transforming data from centralized data warehouse.
Partner with business unit teams to understand operational needs, recommend solutions, assure compliance.
Translate data needs of the business and work with data engineers or architects to build processes and tools that help automate effective data delivery and reduce resource utilization and redundancy.
Engage in the overall data governance of the organization and take an active role in the development, documentation and on-going maintenance of a data governance operation.
Develop effective auditing and validation processes between the source systems and the centralized data warehouse to assure accurate and timely availability of data.
Develop, test, and deliver reports and extracts from the centralized data warehouse using appropriate Business Intelligence (BI) tools.
Constantly look for better ways of solving technical problems and designing solutions while not being afraid of challenging the status quo.
Mentor and coach the broader Analytics Delivery team.
Hands on and engage in coding to help team to develop solutions and solve all surfacing problems at hand.
Other duties and/or projects as assigned.
Adheres to HMH Organizational competencies and standards of behavior.
Qualifications:
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field.
Minimum of 4-7 years of experience working in a Business Analyst or Data Analyst role.
Demonstrated skills in Coding (SQL) and Business Intelligence products (i.e. Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, QLik, etc.).
Proficient computer skills that include but are not limited to Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite (i.e. Excel/Sheets).
Healthcare system knowledge.
Experience with unstructured datasets.
Attention to detail and ability to think critically.
Ability to work with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts.
Knowledge of the agile work process.
A desire to learn and intellectually curious.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Education, Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Preferred:
Master's / PhD in computer science or related.
Minimum of 7+ years of experience working in data analyst role.
If you feel that the above description speaks directly to your strengths and capabilities, then please apply today!

SUMMARY

World Insurance Associates is a unique insurance organization offering top products and services from major providers, combined with attentive service from local agents.

Founded in 2011, World is one of the fastest-growing insurance brokers in the U.S. with over 2,200 employees in over 260 offices across North America. We specialize in personal and commercial insurance lines, surety and bonding, employee benefits, financial and retirement services, and human capital management solutions.

Our rapid growth and market leading presence has created opportunities throughout the state and we offer top talent the choice to work from one of our multiple offices throughout the region.


POSITION OVERVIEW

Strong ability to influence and negotiate with trading partner to achieve optimal outcomes for clients and prospective clients. Work under the direction of senior staff to coordinate placement activities on new and renewal business in support of business retention and production goals. Be knowledgeable of applicable coverages, carrier guidelines, alternative funding arrangements, underwriting, and legislative changes. Build and grow relationships with clients, carrier representatives, and fellow World associates.


WORK EXPERIENCE/JOB QUALIFICATIONS

3 to 5 years industry experience in commercial insurance brokerage, placement, carrier underwriting, and carrier relationship management role; or in combination
Complete and thorough understanding of a national insurance broker’s sales, service, and placement process


RESPONSIBILITIES

Comprehensive understanding of World’s scope of expertise, structure, distribution strategy, and value proposition

Broad and diverse knowledge of the global insurance industry marketplace including:

Small Commercial and Middle Market account segments
Standard property and casualty products
Excess and Surplus Lines marketplace and how to access
Commercial Insurance program designs
Coordinate placement strategy with World Client Advisers and Account Executives to achieve optimal outcomes for clients and prospective clients
Lead a competitive coverage placement process and demonstrate strong negotiation skills to achieve appropriate cost, coverage, and capacity targets for clients and prospective clients
Maintain productive and responsive relationships with underwriters at World’s key Trading Partners
Participate as requested by senior staff in program design and placement strategy meetings with client advisors and account executives
Promote utilization of strategic Trading Partners critical to maintaining secure and dependable relationships for World to generate optimal outcomes for clients and prospective clients
Collaborate with National Placement resources as necessary to ensure client’s and prospective client’s coverage needs are comprehensively addressed
Support senior staff in larger, more complex placements as requested
Recommend commercial insurance program designs to the Client Advisor and/or Account Executive after review with senior staff
Assist with the preparation of submissions and applications required by the underwriting community
Direct submissions to the appropriate trading partners and negotiate best in class coverage terms, conditions, capacity, and cost
Prepare coverage comparisons based upon quotations and proposals received from underwriters
Serve as secondary internal source of information concerning market trends, pricing practices, and other underwriting policies
Maintain focus on World-authorized workflow and standard operating procedures to support consistency across the World enterprise


ESSENTIAL SKILLS/COMPETENCIES

Project/process management discipline and follow-through
Compelling deductive reasoning skills
Substantial inter-personal skills and associate engagement expertise
Effective listening and communication skills
Collaborative nature
Action-oriented, ambitious, initiative-taker
Analytical and creative thinker
Commitment to continuous learning and development
Basic understanding of standard property and casualty insurance programs
Purposeful, results-driven, competitive, tenacious desire to win
Knowledgeable of the insurance marketplace and keeps current with marketplace changes
Strong ability to influence and negotiate with trading partner peers, and achieve optimal outcomes for clients and prospective clients


COMPUTER SOFTWARE SKILLS

Proficient in all Microsoft office products
Mid-level expertise with excel


PROFESSIONAL LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS

Preferred insurance designation such as ARM or CPCU
Licensed Property & Casualty insurance producer in resident state


EDUCATION

4-year college degree from an accredited institution or equivalent professional designation


EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

At World Insurance Associates (WIA), we celebrate and support our differences. We know employing a team rich in diverse thoughts, experiences, and opinions allows our employees, our products, and our community to flourish. WIA is honored to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, or Veteran status. In addition, WIA makes reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant or employee with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Job Description Description The Scrum Masters job is to deliver maximum value to the customer. Scrum Masters facilitate daily stand-ups and supporting the team in following the Scrum delivery process. Scrum Master also handle traditional project management duties including scope definition, staffing, communication of status to clients and partners. Primary responsibilities: Work with the team and product owner in converting requirements into the working software. Track progress and help the team achieve their commitments. Progress is monitored daily when problems are identified work with team to develop corrective actions. Manage and report the status of scope, schedule and resourcing. Extract and document requirements. Facilitate, creating user stories and acceptance criteria. Ensure team members understand processes and support the team in following them. Ensure product quality expectations are defined and known across the team. Collaborate with the team in scheduling work, including defect remediation and refactoring, guarding against the accumulation of technical debt. Work with technical team and product owner balancing the interests of both when issues arise. Remove impediments allowing the team to focus on project tasks. Guide project team meetings including sprint pre/planning meetings, daily scrum and sprint review meetings. Facilitate retrospective discussions and support continuous improvement efforts. Requirements Required experience: At least 10 to 15 years of experience of handling Java Backend development projects within the Banking and Financial Services as Scrum Master Any prior knowledge in Java, Spring boot, Micro Services, Kafka is a plus Experience in Agile Management and/or serving as Scrum Master. Management of more than one significant project at a time. Prior experience as a Business Analyst and/or Project Manager is a plus Practical use of quality management tools and techniques. Certified ScrumMaster® (CSM) is mandatory Exceptional people skills. Comfortable working with a diverse group of people and serve as arbitrator when conflicts arise. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst - Quality Assurance (Connected Vehicle)
Job Description:
Love. It’s what makes Subaru, Subaru®. And as a leading auto brand in the US, we strive to be More Than a Car Company®. Subaru believes in being a positive force in the communities in which we live and work, not just with donations but with actions that set an example for others to follow. That’s what we call our Subaru Love Promise®.

Summary:

The Sr. Business Analyst – Quality Assurance Analyst, Connected Vehicle, Information Technology is a dual role responsible for supporting Connect Vehicle IT department in Business Analysis and Quality Assurance activities. The position is part of a larger team focusing on gathering requirements, business care development, quality assurance testing, and IT user acceptance testing coordination in support of all Connected Vehicle IT projects. This role will have strong skills in work-plan development and progress tracking, who will prepare and present updates regularly to relevant management channels, ensuring that our goal of transparency and communication is achieved. The role will produce documentation and communicate functional features, characteristics, and requirements throughout the organization, ensuring that system specifications operate in alignment with business requirements. This position is part of a team that provides services supporting technologies in the US, Canada, and Japan with plans to expand into more international markets in the coming years. This position supports Subaru’s objective to bring exceptional digital experiences to our customers.

Primary Responsibilities:

Working under general supervision, executes in an assigned BA/QA area of responsibility both independently and as a part of a larger project team
Collaborates with project stakeholders (IT & Connected Business) to develop effective business use cases to support Connected Vehicle projects
Work with team members and business partners to define project scope, objectives, and timelines that align with organization, program and project goals
Develops QA test cases, test plans, and regression test suites tied to defined requirements
Ensures proper coverage and alignment of QA test plans with business requirements
Collaborates with others as part of a larger IT team in coordinated team efforts
Contributes to the organization with process improvement ideas and recommendations
Promotes continuous improvement of BA/QA processes and supports the broader IT team in efforts to improve service quality in general
Ensure that all aspects of projects are organized and in conformance with timeline and deliverables
Develop and maintain project plans, tracking overall progress and achievement of milestones
Report project risks, mitigations, and outcomes to appropriate management channels; escalating issues according to project work plan
Deepen partnerships within our organization as well as with outside resources, including third-party vendors
Analyze project progress and, when necessary, adapt scope or timeline to achieve optimal results
Organize, attend, and participate in stakeholder meetings
Document and follow-up on actions and decisions from meetings
Develops comprehensive understanding of business processes and build strong working rapport with business users.
Prepare meeting presentation materials
Coordinate project and change estimations
Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all invitees
Ensures projects adhere to the project management frameworks and all documentation is maintained
Ensure that standard change management procedures are followed
Participate in Business Requirements validation, compilation and documentation
Participate in vehicle technology validation testing

8 to 10 years of relevant professional experience OR proven Senior BA and/or QA experience and growth
4-year bachelor’s degree in information systems, Computer Science, or a closely related field of study or equivalent work experience
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Strong proficiency in comprehensive quality assurance testing
Proactive self-starter who performs initiatives that provide solutions for business requirements.
Work experience with increasing responsibility and demonstrable leadership success.
Excellent communicator with strong business analysis and reporting skills.

Excellent communication, presentation and collaboration skills
Demonstrates ability to take ownership and initiative
Highly organized and able to manage priorities and multiple work streams
Positive, can do attitude, open to change

Bausch + Lomb (NYSE/TSX: BLCO) is a leading global eye health company dedicated to protecting and enhancing the gift of sight for millions of people around the worldfrom the moment of birth through every phase of life. Our mission is simple, yet powerful: helping you see better, to live better.

Our comprehensive portfolio of over 400 products is fully integrated and built to serve our customers across the full spectrum of their eye health needs throughout their lives. Our iconic brand is built on the deep trust and loyalty of our customers established over our nearly 170-year history. We have a significant global research, development, manufacturing and commercial footprint of approximately 12,500 employees and a presence in approximately 100 countries, extending our reach to billions of potential customers across the globe. We have long been associated with many of the most significant advances in eye health, and we believe we are well positioned to continue leading the advancement of eye health in the future.

Summary

The Trade Operations Support Analyst will work directly with the Manager of Trade Operations to best support wholesale and retail access to Bausch + Lomb’s Brand Rx portfolio and ensure their efficient and compliant distribution.

This role will support the customer order management process for all trade accounts, as well as support pricing related activities and perform trade related reporting and data analytics.

Responsibilities

Order Management:
Supporting Trade Operations manager with overseeing and approving customer orders, provide guidance of open orders, and working closely with Trade Customer Service and the warehouse to ensure orders are processed and shipped in a timely, efficient manner.

Pricing and Reporting:
Supporting Trade Operations Manager with managing pricing activities for B+L branded Rx products.

Assist with setting up, maintaining, and updating WAC price in the B+L system; communicating pricing changes both internally and externally to wholesale buyers.

Maintaining all documents related to annual price action, new product launches, NDC Changes, acquisitions, divestitures, and product discontinuations.

Maintain product availability reporting to all customers and intercompany partners.

Other Areas of Responsibility:
Utilizing 852 and 867 data in Integrichain to perform trade related reporting and analysis.

Partnering with Supply Chain to manage product dating and maintaining appropriate inventory level at 3PLs.

Leveraging available data to develop reports to identify trends and opportunities to improve distribution efficiencies, address risks, and monitoring/tracking product performance.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree and/or a minimum of 4 years customer service experience in pharmaceuticals

Relevant experience within Channel, Trade & Distribution; biotech/pharma experience preferred

Experience with working within a distribution network, Wholesaler and Retail as well as Product Launches, Divestitures and Acquisitions

Knowledge of managed care market preferred

Strong team player that has customer service approach and is solution oriented

Attention to detail and ability to work individually, within a multi-disciplinary team, as well as with external partners and vendors

Strong data analytics capabilities with entrepreneurial spirit and ability to implement creative solutions to complex problems

Advanced Microsoft Office skills with an emphasis on Excel and PowerPoint. Must understand V-Lookup process in Excel

Must demonstrate ability to identify, analyze and solve problems

Must demonstrate a sense of urgency to customer responses, a consistent attention to detail, and good interpersonal skills

Must be self-motivated and approach tasks with a positive, proactive attitude

Ability to work independently and plan extensively to meet goals

Ability to maintain accuracy, consistency, and quality in fast-paced environment

Must have eagerness and capacity to learn

Job Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Go-to-Consumer - PVH Corp.
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

The Americas TPG organization contributes to support the regional needs and provides representation and support to the global systems. Our mission is to lead, listen and partner to create extraordinary value for our brands and the Americas Region. We optimize business processes with system enhancements, modifications and implementations to deliver consistent, core capabilities to support value add for the Go To Consumer business area.

The Senior Business Analyst, TPG Americas helps enable and drive business strategies through process and system improvement. By focusing on functional analysis, this role will help ensure transformational initiatives are delivered with process excellence and business value. He or she will contribute to process optimization, drive analysis of current and future state, drive and document the business requirements and participate in implementation activities such as testing and support.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES:

Understand “as is” and future-state business processes, help analyze gaps, and provide recommended solutions which advance business capabilities.
Document Functional specifications capturing business needs and interpreting them to the development team for the ultimate solution.
Contribute as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) with strong knowledge in assigned business areas; both current state and opportunities to improve.
Effectively collaborate and coordinate between Global TPG, technical teams, business and other functions to ensure consistent levels of detail in the functional requirements.
Collaborate with vendor partners who are engaged as subject matter experts and provide a best in class approach to driving the adoption of our platforms.
Lead and coordinate system testing efforts for implementation of enhancements, fixes and new systems.
Support post go live activities by working with system users and development teams to track and resolve open issues.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

Experience:

5 - 7 years of business experience in a functional role supporting transformational initiatives.
Experienced supporting or implementing planning systems, preferably JDA / BY Enterprise Planning, Assortment, Allocation, Demand, Fulfillment and / or supply planning Strong business acumen in supply chain process and systems.
Experience working with business processes and documenting functional needs.
Experience implementing and supporting packaged software a plus
Apparel or consumer products company experience preferred; ideally fast-moving, multi-channel business.


Education:

BS in Information Systems or BA Business Management or related studies or equivalent experience

Technical Skills

Oracle database SQL capable a Plus
JDA / Blue Yonder front-end configuration experience a Plus (creating FE Pages, Workspaces, user processes, security management)

Skills:

Strong verbal and written communication. Ability to clearly articulate complex issues/topics
Ability to prioritize work load, multi task and react quickly to meet business expectations
Ability to thrive in high pressure situations while continuing to be delivery focused.
Self-starter with strong analytical skills
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work under pressure, meet production support SLA’s and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Must possess a strong client service background and demonstrated ability to partner with IT Staff to resolve complex problems.
Must be able to work with all levels of the organization.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office products – Excel, Power point, Word
Practical experience designing and documenting business processes and sub-processes.

By joining Chubb as a Senior Data Analyst, you will analyze and certify data, troubleshoot data issues, promote data quality, work directly with the business and developers to document requirements and technical specifications and lead the delivery of key projects in support of North America Statutory Reporting from the enterprise data warehouse. Our data warehouse platform is a strategic application within the business, feeding into multiple systems and applications both up and downstream with data that directly supports business decisions being made each and every day. With us, you’ll leverage your knowledge of SQL and database tables to analyze data, identify gaps or discrepancies, and partner with applications teams, IT teams across the business, our stakeholders, and our Data Architect to drive solutions that directly impacts how data is used throughout the business. You will lead reporting initiatives, delivering solutions from inception to reporting submission while working within budget and timelines. Through it all, we’ll also look to you to share your ideas and manage data related projects end to end that influence how we incorporate, validate, and distribute data enterprise-wide.

In this role, you will:

Lead all phases of the development, testing, and implementation life cycle, defining, documenting, and reviewing all requirements, creating test scenarios, developing test plans, analyzing results and testing/validating data
Work with business partners, project management, architecture, development, and leadership to deliver reporting solutions on-time, within budget and with data accuracy.
Document requirements, technical specifications, and implementation documentation on all reporting solutions.
Reconcile multiple data sources and identify the root cause of discrepancies in expected output; distinguish between multiple root causes and/or multiple trends in a given data set and articulate results to various stakeholders, management, and technical resources
Analyze and test relational databases and investigate any data load failures or data retrieval issues
Monitor data warehousing systems based on assigned tasks to ensure reliability and accuracy of information loaded into the databases
Generate reports, dashboards, and ad hoc extracts for business and/or leadership
Ensure data integrity by implementing quality assurance practices, gathering, and entering missing data, and resolving any anomalies


7+ years of experience in a Data Analysis, Business Analysis, Data Quality Assurance (or similar) role as part of a data warehouse team and supporting data-driven projects
Experience working with DBMS platforms, including a demonstrated understanding of table structures, hierarchies, joins, etc.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, with the ability to write and troubleshoot medium to advanced SQL queries
Knowledge of data warehousing methodologies and tools including their connection to systems both up and down stream
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related discipline preferred
Prior experience within the insurance industry or related to regulatory reporting is preferred
Previous experience with Azure Synapse, Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS), and/or reporting tools, such as Qlik, Spotfire is a plus


Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance, and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Job Title: Trading Operations Support & Quality Assurance Analyst
Job Description:
Princeton, New Jersey

We are currently looking for a highly motivated and hands-on Trade Support and Quality Assurance Analyst to join the MIAX Trading Operations Team. This person must demonstrate the ability to proactively participate in the end-to-end system testing process within a fast paced trading environment. Candidates are required to develop a deep understanding of Business System Requirement documents and translate these concepts into automated production test scenarios.

The Trading Operations team is responsible for all front line customer support. It is critical that the applicant has a meticulous attention to detail. Trading Operations is also responsible for all client interface and business functionality testing of the Trading systems.

Main responsibilities include:

Interacting directly with member Firm’s trading desks to provide all operational support.
Coordinate with external technical staff for firm configurations of trading sessions and networking connectivity.
Maintaining and completing all daily Exchange Operations.
Participating in the MIAX Quality Assurance program.
Developing, authoring and troubleshooting comprehensive test scenarios which are validated against the testing system.
Proactively participating in the review of business requirements for the purpose of developing test case scenarios that ensure complete test coverage of application functionality.
Developing, maintaining and executing test plans that validate new features and releases.
Ensuring all software issues are reported and handled efficiently per the MIAX software defect remediation process.
Participating in all aspects of a full-life cycle development methodology.
Developing and performing application certification with external clients to ensure smooth transition of new features being enabled in the production environment.
Communicating status efficiently and ensuring the team is on track for all manual testing.
Providing timely resolution of technical and user specific issues and requests.
Engaging in continuous process evaluation and improvement.
Assisting Department Manager with Industry-based calls.
Maintaining knowledge of Industry trends and their impact on trade support.
Troubleshooting technical and functional issues based on exchange Rules and system design.

Organizational Structure
The Trading Operations Support & Quality Assurance Analyst will report directly to the Senior Vice President of Trading Operations and Listings.

Qualifications

Must have the capacity to thoroughly understand the Software Quality Assurance testing process and best practices.
Strong team based and customer facing verbal and written communication skills are a must.
Must possess the aptitude for automated testing of a platform in an integrated testing environment, as well as testing user-interface and transaction-processing systems.
Effective analytical and problem solving skills.
Required to be a self-motivated, patient, dynamic, organized and responsible team player.
Function at a high level and prioritize critical tasks in a dynamically changing environment.
Possess a strong sense of ownership and responsibility.

Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Finance or IT/Computer Science.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel.
Knowledge/prior use of JIRA tracking software is a plus.
Options and/or equities Industry background is a plus.
Experience testing trade execution systems at an exchange or for an ECN/ATS is a plus.

If you are interested in applying for a position, please send your resume, cover letter and salary requirements to hr@miaxglobal.com.

About Bluevine

Bluevine is on a mission to enable a better financial future for small business owners through innovative banking solutions designed just for them. By combining best-in-class technology with advanced security and a deep understanding of the small business community, we deliver end-to-end banking and lending products that empower always-on entrepreneurs to grow their businesses with confidence.

As a dynamic company with massive potential, we're backed by leading investors such as Lightspeed Venture Partners, Menlo Ventures, 83North, Citi Ventures, and nearly 9 years of proven success. Since launching in 2013, we have grown exponentially, amassing over 400,000 customers across all 50 states and a global team of more than 500 people. All of this begins with our team who are driven by collaboration, problem-solving, and learning and growing together. With a commitment to innovation and community impact, our mission is to help every small business—and every team member—thrive. Join us! #LI-Hybrid

Onboarding and Risk analysts work alongside a motivated team and are exposed to all aspects of FinTech operations in a high-growth startup environment.

This is not a fully remote role. At Bluevine, we pride ourselves on our collaborative culture, which we believe is best maintained through in-person interactions and a vibrant office environment. All of our offices have reopened in accordance with local guidelines, and follow a hybrid model.

Job Title

Job Description

Day-to-day focus is on resolution of complex problems or transactions, where expertise is required to interpret against policies, guidelines or processes. Roles at this level would usually have full ownership for one or more processes, reports, procedures or products, and may also be considered analytical or procedural "experts" representing a unit or team on cross-function process or project deliverables.

CAPITAL MARKETS LLC/BROKER DEALER FUNDING RESPONSIBILITIES:

Daily funding of firm bank accounts*
Responsible for timely deposits to/from 15C3-3 accounts.*
Responsible for intraday liquidity monitoring and reporting.
Responsible for timely deposits to various Clearing Organizations*
Planning and coordinating with other groups to meet funding needs*
Syndicate Operations – to determine need for day loans in order to intra-day finance new issues underwritten by RBC.
Treasury Clearance – as a conduit to the Repo Desk to raise or reduce cash as needed.
Foreign Settlements – To forecast key cash needs for all US Dollar securities settling overseas.
Stock Loan Desk – To determine their use of funds to enable accurate forecasting
Repo Desk – As the group responsible for raising or laying off funds, we need to work with the Repo Desk throughout the day.
Affiliated legal entities for their daily settlement versus the Broker Dealer

Equities, Fixed Income & Derivative (both Listed & OTC)
Stock Loan/Stock Borrow
Repo/Reverse Repo
Overnight and Term Loans

Projecting future settlements and other funding needs*
Provide the forecasts to appropriate MM Desks throughout Toronto and London to ensure proper coordination.
Daily reconciliation of funding suspense accounts*
Wire processing and approvals through various internal system and banking portals*

ACCOUNTING RESPONSIBILITIES:

Post daily accruals & cash flow activity to multiple GL’s*. Includes accruals on Bank Loans, Stock Loan/Borrow, Repo/Reverse Repo, & Custodian Cash Balances
Process the Cost of Carry function across multiple trading units.*
Monthly reconciliation & Attestation for all Cash, Loan, & Accrual GL accounts*
Assist Product Control with P&L/Carry related issues whenever possible.
Assist Financial Control with monthly reconciliation issues
Prepare month-end reporting for Home Office/Financial Control

Managerial Excellence

May have management responsibilities for a small team, or maybe a single incumbent with "manager" responsibilities for a function.

Job Title: Senior Manager, Business Analyst, Outsourcing Management
Job Description:
Working with Us
Challenging. Meaningful. Life-changing. Those aren’t words that are usually associated with a job. But working at Bristol Myers Squibb is anything but usual. Here, uniquely interesting work happens every day, in every department. From optimizing a production line to the latest breakthroughs in cell therapy, this is work that transforms the lives of patients, and the careers of those who do it. You’ll get the chance to grow and thrive through opportunities uncommon in scale and scope, alongside high-achieving teams rich in diversity. Take your career farther than you thought possible.

Bristol Myers Squibb recognizes the importance of balance and flexibility in our work environment. We offer a wide variety of competitive benefits, services and programs that provide our employees with the resources to pursue their goals, both at work and in their personal lives. Read more: careers.bms.com/working-with-us.

Position Summary

The Senior Manager, Business Analyst, Outsourcing Management in Global Clinical Development IT will be an expert solution specialist focused on Outsourcing Management capabilities for managing clinical trial operations. He/ she is responsible for overseeing the implementation of solutions that address business challenges and meet the needs of all internal and external stakeholders. The Business Analyst would work closely with the Product Manager and would collaborate with various stakeholders, including business users, software developers, project managers, and IT teams, to ensure successful delivery of technical projects and software releases.

This position will also support change management, training, super user network, user acceptance and ensure their continued growth and development while also developing and maintaining relationships with vendors, industry experts, and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with technical strategy and business goals.

Key Responsibilities

Hands-on expert of the trail outsourcing management capabilities at BMS.
Overall accountability for ensuring understanding of business needs, processes and priorities.
Translate business needs into technical specifications, stories, actionable plans and prioritize.
Ensure solution adoption by management of super user network, training content and change communications.
Execution of agile project management and iterative value delivery is preferred.
Develop stakeholder & end user maps, customer journey maps and change impact heat maps.
Analyze business processes and identify areas for improvement through technology solutions.
Evaluate business process, existing systems, and processes to identify potential inefficiencies and areas for optimization and innovation.
Collaborate with Product team and architects to ensure solutions align with business requirements.
Ensure that technology solutions are compliant with regulatory requirements and industry standards.
Facilitate UAT sessions, voice of customer, issue resolution, help desk, cross functional business process and technology dependencies.
Provide hands on reporting, data issue resolution and support end users
Conduct training sessions to educate users on new systems, applications, or features.
Troubleshoot issues, develop reports and data extracts to meet urgent needs.
Stay up to date with the latest technology trends and industry best practices.


Qualifications & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
Minimum experience of 5 years in the pharmaceutical, biotech or related area.
Experience with clinical trials business process or clincal trial outsourcing models is a plus.
Experience with Salesforce application is a plus.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of software development methodologies and programming languages.
Familiarity with business process mapping, workflows and data analysis tools.
Excellent communication, collaboration and interpersonal skills to interact with diverse stakeholders.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Product management experience is a plus.

#LI-Hybrid

Uniquely Interesting Work, Life-changing Careers
With a single vision as inspiring as “Transforming patients’ lives through science™ ”, every BMS employee plays an integral role in work that goes far beyond ordinary. Each of us is empowered to apply our individual talents and unique perspectives in an inclusive culture, promoting diversity in clinical trials, while our shared values of passion, innovation, urgency, accountability, inclusion and integrity bring out the highest potential of each of our colleagues.

The Business Systems Analyst position is part of the Data, Technology and Engineering (DTE) team, supporting Quality Systems and Vertex Innovation and External Research (VIER). This position is responsible for supporting and enhancing Vertex’s Learning Management SAAS solution provided by Cornerstone on Demand.

As Vertex works to build and enhance our existing system, we are seeking an individual who will help us research, configure, test, and document solutions to issues identified by our business stakeholders. This individual will partner with other Subject Matter Experts, both internally and via third parties. They will help us ensure that we provide a system that meets the compliance needs demanded in a validated environment while continuing to enhance Vertex’s learning ecosystem via the Learning Advancement Program.

Cornerstone (or similar LMS technical experience)
GxP validation experience
System Administration, integration, and configuration experience

Participate in day-to-day project and support work, including analysis, documentation, configuration, testing, integration, and reporting activities.
Conduct systems analysis and configuration changes in accordance with industry Systems Lifecycle (SLC) and Vertex Change Management guidelines for a validated environment
Implement product enhancements; understand and document business processes and requirements
Manage customer support cases via case management tool
Participate in reviewing, planning, testing and implementing regularly scheduled system upgrades
Develop collaborative relationships with IT peers, Talent Management, Quality Systems, external partners, and various operational teams to help design, develop, and deliver learning solutions that satisfy business requirements

Ensure data integrity including quality, accuracy, security, and usability of employee data and related interfaces by adhering to established processes and controls
