Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Technical Business Analyst

What does a Business Analyst Do?

The Business Analyst operates as part of a Fiserv software engineering team to manage and support team inputs and outputs regarding design, development, testing, delivery, and support of software and technology products. The Analyst will manage and support internal team projects from start to finish. They will support all aspects of the development process from design to product delivery.

As a Business Analyst, you can look forward to:

Manage Team Inputs and Outputs Ticket Creation & Management:

Receive ticket hand-off from external stakeholders and Product Managers.

Gather & review technical requirements for new or enhanced features and products based on business requirements.

Define and refine requirements for quality ticket creation.Ensure ticket meets quality standards on all points.

Manage tickets from Stakeholder boards to the team board.

Drive efficient and well-organized stakeholder/engineering feedback loops.

Diligently track the assignment, and development of prioritized feature and product requests.

Participate in support escalations; identify the issue and ensure its effectively communicated to the team leads.

Assist with attempts to identify and reproduce potential defects.

Assist with review and shepherding team output.

Assist in hand off to Product Manager for to-market initiatives.

Provide Team Support:

Organize and engage discussion around feasibility, estimation and the adaptation of our scaling methodology.

Support the team's SDLC evolution.

Effectively communicate and document Status, issues, dependencies, or blockers of important road-map items.

Provide timing/estimations throughout the development lifecycle.

Create content that supports product & features prior to, or around release, aligning with external/internal publishing.

Document key meeting notes as needed.

Group and identify project considerations/resources.

Make and maintain project tracking pages.

Work with team to ensure successful outcomes.

Required Skills & Proficiencies:

Experience in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)

Writing and managing of business and technical requirements

Client Relationship Management

Project Management experience

Strong communication skills

A high level of organization is required

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, JIRA, & Confluence

BS at accredited university

3 years of related work experience

Experience with Java, SQL, and Linux is a plus

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - Regulatory Reporting, Capital Markets
Job Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Business Analyst - Regulatory Reporting, Capital Markets

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

US Regulatory Services is responsible for ensuring timely, accurate, and complete reporting to various exchanges, self-regulatory organizations and the SEC. The individual in this role is primarily responsible for day-to-day operational execution to broader planning within this area of expertise. Functions within the team can include remediating issues identified; control and risk management and reporting process improvement; providing support for regulatory change initiatives; and researching and responding to regulatory inquiries and exams. Additionally, the individual will utilize subject matter expertise while representing the department or function at a broader level. Additional responsibilities may include performing user testing for new or existing process enhancements, documenting new procedures related to new reports on-boarded while acting as a go-to-person/escalation point for questions from analysts and other areas. This role may focus on multiple forms of regulatory reporting, such as Electronic Blue Sheets, OATS, LOPR, Short Interest, TRACE, MSRB, CAT and more. The role works closely with several areas of the Firm to support the above functions, including various business groups within the Firm, Compliance, Legal, Finance, and Technology.

What will you do?

Review and analyze new business, rule changes or system changes that impact reporting processes and perform associated testing / checkouts
Coordinate the remediation of reporting anomalies (raise JIRAs, document requirements, and perform checkout etc.)
Develop UAT strategy, document test cases and execute testing of applicable regulatory, business or control changes
Acts as an effective layer of escalation for junior or less experienced staff on complex issues
Drive process improvement or re-engineering by identifying and implementing automation opportunities
Lead the development and implementation of controls to ensure the timeliness, accuracy and completeness of reporting
Document, revise and maintain procedures as required; ensure team is trained on all procedures
Produce presentations for a range of stakeholders highlighting achievements, regulatory reporting metrics, regulatory risks and change management initiatives
Serve as a liaison for Regulatory Services on assigned projects; ensure Regulatory Services is informed of program developments and potential impacts to existing processes and reporting logic
Lead the development of performance management metrics for the group across daily, weekly, or monthly regulatory reports including: Electronic Blue Sheets, Qualified Financial Contracts (QFC), Listed and OTC Large Option Position Reporting (LOPR), Consolidated Audit Trail (CAT), TRACE, MSRB and others as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent Required, preferably in Engineering or Business or a related subject
Big 4 Consulting / Advisory experience ; At least 4 years preferred
Strong understanding of financial products (Equities, Listed Derivatives, Fixed Income, and/or OTC Derivatives) and US regulatory reporting requirements
Understanding of complex options trading to include options allocations
Strong understanding of the trade life cycle (Orders, Executions, Allocations) required
Understanding of Middle Office Trade Processing
Strong proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio
Proficiency with Broadridge and Fidessa is preferred
Understanding of trade/transaction data warehousing and reference data sourcing
Technical mindset with basic understanding of SQL and VBA a plus
Requires excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to build strong working relationships with people at all organizational levels
Ability to work well under pressure, adapt to unexpected events, prioritize and multi-task, while maintaining high standards in a deadline driven environment
High attention to detail
Ability to solve problems quickly and efficiently
Demonstrated dependability and sense of urgency about getting results
Must have excellent judgment, professionalism and integrity
Team player with a positive attitude

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $80,000 - $135,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs. This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

Drives RBC’s high performance culture
Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Title: Director Business Intelligence & Analytics - PVH Corp.
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

PVH is one of the world’s largest global apparel companies. With a history going back over 135 years, PVH has excelled at growing brands and businesses with rich American heritages, becoming one of the world’s largest global apparel companies. We own and market iconic brands like CALVIN KLEIN and Tommy Hilfiger, in addition, market a variety of goods under our own and licensed brands. We are over 35,000 associates operating in over 40 countries.

PVH has embarked upon building an “Enterprise Data Platform” (PDP), a world class ecosystem secure enterprise data repository to manage all types of data for consumption across PVH to ultimately unlock business value through hindsight’s, insights & foresights. In your new role within the ED&A (Enterprise Data & Analytics) team, you will have the opportunity to address greenfield opportunities to apply reporting, analytics, data science and machine learning towards e2e analytic capabilities.

The position of Director of Business Intelligence & Analytics reports directly to the Vice President of Enterprise Data & Analytics and manages a team of 7 or more direct reports. The main objective of this role is to spearhead strategic planning for analytics initiatives, mentor the team to deliver top-notch solutions within deadlines, and contribute significantly to the development of cutting-edge prototypes that effectively tackle business challenges and generate enthusiasm within our user community.

As Director of Business Intelligence & Analytics, you will have the opportunity to harness the power of all PVH data to drive meaningful and impactful changes within the organization. Analyzing data can lead to insights that have the potential to transform business strategies and drive innovation. You will be at the forefront of problem-solving and innovation, encouraging your team to think critically and creatively about data sets leading to the development of novel solutions that address complex business challenges.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES OF THE JOB:

Who You Are

You possess a strong passion for data and adeptly utilize your skills in data programming, quantitative analysis, and data visualization techniques to tackle complex challenges.

Your role as a coach, mentor, team player, and collaborator is instrumental in fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making. You excel in guiding the business to formulate pertinent inquiries.

Your ability to balance expertise with the right approach allows you to effectively influence key stakeholders, ensuring that decisions are made based on sound judgment and expertise.

With a keen eye for the bigger picture, you adeptly recognize the interconnected nature of product increments and stay abreast of industry best practices.

Your exceptional communication skills enable you to convey intricate ideas in easily comprehensible ways, thus effectively influencing stakeholders.

A self-motivated individual, you bring creative energy and a fervor for resolving intricate problems to the table.

Thriving in dynamic, fast-paced environments is where you excel, and you derive satisfaction from the challenges such an environment presents.

What You’ll Do

Foster the development of a highly proficient team of BI/Analytics experts who efficiently devise intricate solutions (including Reporting, Dashboard/Visualizations & Mobile Applications), thereby promoting uniformity, analytical advancement, and a culture of data-driven decision-making throughout the organization.

Nourish robust and transparent partnerships (Networking, Security, Business Process, Infrastructure, Architecture, etc.) to encourage synchronization and cooperation with ongoing, future, and innovative undertakings.

Proactively oversee end-user experience by establishing comprehensive data points, triggers, KPIs, and notifications, ensuring that job run time, usage, and overall performance adhere to established Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Disseminate and communicate analytics addressing performance, usage, and business adoption of data domains, reports, and formatted dashboards, and devise a strategy to sustain and enhance them.

Cultivate a proactive mindset within the team, fostering anticipation of business needs and the resolution of challenges while identifying opportunities and efficiencies.

Offer regular feedback, coaching, and mentorship to team members, ensuring that each individual has well-documented goals and objectives and a personalized development/career roadmap. Identify prospects for expanding roles through training and participation in unique, challenging initiatives to broaden exposure and enhance skill sets.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE:

Experience:

Over 8 years of hands-on experience with MicroStrategy, delivering self-service analytics, insights, KPIs, and metrics within a BI or related role (such as Reporting, Analytics, Statistics, etc.).

Extensive background spanning 5+ years in crafting intricate SQL queries to facilitate in-depth analysis and generate valuable insights.

Proficient in managing multi-tier environments, including adept handling of MicroStrategy, version control, and migration strategies.

Possesses strong client-facing written and verbal communication skills, ensuring effective interaction and collaboration with clients.

Well-versed in agile software delivery methodologies, particularly in utilizing methodologies like Scrum.

Demonstrates a proactive approach, driven by a passion for analytics and a bias for action, contributing to a highly motivated and results-oriented work ethic.

Proficiency in data preparation, data modeling, and data visualization, exhibiting a comprehensive understanding of these crucial components within the analytics process

Education:

10+ years' experience with Business Intelligence / Analytical architecture, frameworks, tools and development lifecycles with increasing levels of supervisory and leadership responsibilities

Strong analytical, mathematical and logical thinking

Experience identifying use cases opportunities for Data Science & Advanced Analytics, building POC’s to prove out value and justify investment

Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills; demonstrated ability to develop strong relationships with and effectively communicate complex ideas to technical and non-technical audiences

Demonstrated ability to engage and manage through influence across a large international organization

Excellent project management (Agile) and time management skills

Skills:

BI & Visualization (Semantic Layer): MicroStrategy (Required)

Cloud Environment: Microsoft Azure preferred, AWS/GCP accepted

Data Management: Azure Data Factory, DataBricks, Mulesoft, Delta Lake,

Programming/Scripting: Python (Preferred)

PVH Corp. or its subsidiary ("PVH") is an equal opportunity employer and considers all applicants for employment on the basis of their individual capabilities and qualifications, consistent with applicable law and without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military status or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law. In addition to complying with all applicable laws, PVH also has a strong corporate commitment to inclusion, diversity and to ensuring that all current and future PVH associates are compensated solely on job-related factors such as skill, ability, educational background, work quality, experience and potential. To achieve these goals, across the United States and its territories, PVH prohibits any PVH employee, agent or representative from requesting or otherwise considering any job applicant’s current or prior wages, salary or other compensation information in connection with the hiring process. Accordingly, applicants are asked not to disclose this salary history information to PVH

Own is the leading data platform trusted by thousands of organizations to protect and activate SaaS data to transform their businesses. Own empowers customers to ensure the availability, security and compliance of mission-critical data, while unlocking new ways to gain deeper insights faster. By partnering with some of the world's largest SaaS ecosystems such as Salesforce, ServiceNow and Microsoft Dynamics 365, Own enables customers around the world to truly own the data that powers their business.

It's their platform. It's your data. Own it.

The Job

The Enterprise Applications Project Manager is responsible for managing all aspects of a cross-functional project throughout the initiative lifecycle, from ideation through implementation and roll out to the market. This individual, core to the Enterprise Applications team, will work across all functions in the organization and with vendors, building confidence in the discipline, keeping the team aligned on the future state, setting transparent expectations, and ensuring continuous improvement along the way. They will have a constant focus on proactive communication to a variety of stakeholders. The project manager will be part of a collaborative, strategic, supportive environment that encourages every team member to iterate, learn, and share best practices.

Your Day-to-Day Role
Lead multiple projects by facilitating cross-functional team(s) to deliver against the business goal. This may include operating as scrum master and traditional PM at different points in time.
Work closely with functional leaders and technical teams to develop strong relationships across the organization.
Identify resource requirements based on business and solution requirements, working with resource managers to obtain project commitment.
Educate teams and leaders on a variety of methodologies and approaches based on the project needs.
Lead, coach, motivate, serve cross functional team in delivering desired initiative results.
Manage project scope, time, budget, and resources while maintaining progress visibility.
Produce, maintain, and socialize relevant program deliverables such as charter, work plan, regular status reporting, executive materials, etc.
Ensure timelines are well understood and expectations are continuously reiterated.
Communicate relentlessly and transparently with various levels and functions throughout the organization
Ensure all appropriate aspects of the project are documented and relevant metrics tracked and reported. Work closely with Program Managers to roll up project metrics to the program or portfolio level.
Ensure the right level of urgency and focus on quality of deliverables and speed to market.
Identify and remove impediments and resolve issues to facilitate project delivery.
Manage all risks, dependencies, and budgets associated with the initiative.
Provide clarity in ambiguous situations, facilitating collaborative decision-making.
Lead project level change management and stakeholder engagement/ alignment activities.
Focus on Change Management and Stakeholder engagement/ alignment.
Contribute to functional advancement by devising and rolling out new methodologies, tools, best practices, or addressing organizational gaps.
Your Work Experience
3+ years experience in role utilizing various project management methodologies (waterfall, scrum, kanban, SAFe, hybrid) with successful delivery results required.
Experience with a variety of project management tools (JIRA, Asana, workfront, etc.)
Experience leading cross-functional business system or process change initiatives
Demonstrated history of delivering high quality results on schedule and within budget.
Ability to multitask, strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and a desire to learn
Demonstrates analytical, strategic mindset to execute and deliver solutions
Ability to produce and develop insights based on quantitative and qualitative data
Consistently takes a proactive approach to solving problems
Leader with high emotional intelligence who builds relationships, credibility, and collaboration across diverse groups
Has the ability to lead, coach, and influence without authority
Strong communication and negotiation skills
Possess a set of attitudes and beliefs that support an agile work environment
Develops self and others to cultivate high performing teams
Ability to speak with a diverse range of people of all backgrounds and expertise
Design Thinking, or Change Management experience desired
PMP certification a plus
Agile SCRUM Master Certification a plus
Experience delivering regulatory, data security, or government certification projects a plus
Experience in a business analyst role a plus
Important Details

This is a full-time position. The ideal candidate will work out of our Englewood Cliffs, NJ office a minimum of 3 days per week to maximize collaboration and interaction with the business. Travel may be required.

Own is dedicated to creating an environment where employees thrive, which is why base pay is only one part of the total compensation package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work. This role may also be eligible for unlimited PTO, generous medical benefits, a 401(k) savings plan with a 4% employer match, discretionary bonuses/incentives, and stock options. We also offer catered lunches in the office five days a week, a full fitness center, and free shuttle bus service to and from New York City.

Creating an environment where employees thrive also means making sure every employee feels accepted. As we scale to help all types of companies protect precious data, our team must reflect the diversity we serve. Own is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we believe that every employee in the company brings a unique perspective that they can and should contribute in order to make an impact every day. We strive to be one team and one culture that builds trust through transparency. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, protected veteran status or disability status.

Learn more at owndata.com.

Job Title: Sales Planning Analyst

Location: Teaneck, NJ

Role: Permanent




Sales Planning Analyst




What This Position Is About

Sales Planning analyst will be responsible for developing analytics to support the planning of specific sales initiatives and to evaluate field sales execution results. You will work closely with sales & marketing teams providing high quality analysis and insights to help identify business opportunities to achieve company's business objectives. The incumbent will mainly utilize data sources such as TME, MSAi, Power BI. Key objective will be focused on timely and accurate data analysis, and other support for operational planning and the sales leadership team.




Areas of Responsibility

Analyze and interpret field sales retail call data and category specific volume data to evaluate performance by sales cycle initiative and sales position and identify key insights and opportunities to enhance field sales effectiveness.
Develop and maintain a robust set of automated business reports that provide timely and insightful information that meets the needs of each level of the sales organization in planning their work, identifying key opportunities and evaluating performance.
Work with key stakeholders to understand strategic retail initiatives and translate them into retail outlet targeting methodologies that ensure optimal rsoucre allocation and ROI.
Provide timely follow-up on monthly reporting to the sales team to ensure proper actions are being taken for continued business improvement and strategic utilization of company’s resources.
Provide support in the analysis and planning of field sales territories and retail account sementation processes to assist in route-to-market optimization.
Manage various tasks and projects as they arise and upon manager’s request.



Who Are We Looking For - Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree
2-5 years of data analysis experience primarily within CPG or FMCG marketing and sales functions. Experience with retail volumetric data, account profile data and field sales force reported data is a plus.
Fluency in English with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Solid analytics background with strong proficiency in analysis with vision, large data set manipulation and consolidating multiple sources of data into coherent research results.
Basic working statistical knowledge is a must.
Excellent computer skills & expert proficiency within Microsoft Excel and Powerpoint.
Excellent communication & organization skills

Healthcare
Dental + Vision
Voluntary benefits
Paid Time Off

Job Title: Trading Operations Support & Quality Assurance Analyst
Job Description:
MIAX has built a multi-disciplinary team of professionals with deep expertise in the trading industry, working to bring enhanced market structure, technological innovation and superior customer service to the exchange space. We offer a challenging and rewarding work environment with an entrepreneurial spirit and culture that emphasizes collaboration and teamwork while maintaining commitment to professional ethics.

MIAX continues to look for talented professionals to fill select roles throughout the company.

If you are interested in applying for a position, please send your resume, cover letter and salary requirements to hr@miaxglobal.com.




Princeton, New Jersey

We are currently looking for a highly motivated and hands-on Trade Support and Quality Assurance Analyst to join the MIAX Trading Operations Team. This person must demonstrate the ability to proactively participate in the end-to-end system testing process within a fast paced trading environment. Candidates are required to develop a deep understanding of Business System Requirement documents and translate these concepts into automated production test scenarios.

The Trading Operations team is responsible for all front line customer support. It is critical that the applicant has a meticulous attention to detail. Trading Operations is also responsible for all client interface and business functionality testing of the Trading systems.

Main responsibilities include:

Interacting directly with member Firm’s trading desks to provide all operational support.
Coordinate with external technical staff for firm configurations of trading sessions and networking connectivity.
Maintaining and completing all daily Exchange Operations.
Participating in the MIAX Quality Assurance program.
Developing, authoring and troubleshooting comprehensive test scenarios which are validated against the testing system.
Proactively participating in the review of business requirements for the purpose of developing test case scenarios that ensure complete test coverage of application functionality.
Developing, maintaining and executing test plans that validate new features and releases.
Ensuring all software issues are reported and handled efficiently per the MIAX software defect remediation process.
Participating in all aspects of a full-life cycle development methodology.
Developing and performing application certification with external clients to ensure smooth transition of new features being enabled in the production environment.
Communicating status efficiently and ensuring the team is on track for all manual testing.
Providing timely resolution of technical and user specific issues and requests.
Engaging in continuous process evaluation and improvement.
Assisting Department Manager with Industry-based calls.
Maintaining knowledge of Industry trends and their impact on trade support.
Troubleshooting technical and functional issues based on exchange Rules and system design.

Organizational Structure
The Trading Operations Support & Quality Assurance Analyst will report directly to the Senior Vice President of Trading Operations and Listings.

Qualifications

Must have the capacity to thoroughly understand the Software Quality Assurance testing process and best practices.
Strong team based and customer facing verbal and written communication skills are a must.
Must possess the aptitude for automated testing of a platform in an integrated testing environment, as well as testing user-interface and transaction-processing systems.

Panasonic - Analyst

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Manage Contract Process

Multi-department responsibilities with heaviest engagement Sales, Marketing, Product Management, Finance, and Legal.

The Senior Manager, Vendor Management, plays a critical role in driving and maintaining productive relationships with all aspects of Brother’s IT supply vendors.




The Senior Manager strives to acquire best value goods and services required to run Brother IT. The role is responsible for establishing new relationships, benchmarking value of vendor performance, administering vendor agreements, partnering on renewals, validating compliance, administering terminations, strategic planning and other related tasks.




The Senior Manager works with multiple Brother departments and subsidiaries to ensure that the organization supply chain operates efficiently, cost-effectively, and in alignment with the company’s objectives. In addition, the Senior Manager understands vendor supply in several countries adds to the complexity of Vendor Management. Lastly the manager utilizes multiple systems, tools, processes, procedures, with the Brother Americas region to drive efficiency.

Duties and Responsibilities

Vendor Selection

Gather and document vendor supply requirements from IT and its business partners

Identify a short list of vendors meeting the requirements

Facilitate vendor selection decision making

Acquire vendor details and collaborate with Procurement and Legal

Setup vendor in Procurement & Accounts Payable applications

Add to Vendor Portfolio

Vendor Performance Management

Establish and maintain vendor performance KPIs

Establish and maintain a cadence of vendor review meetings

Mitigate risk of poor performing vendors

Continuously improve vendor performance

Maintain professional relationships

Vendor Administration

Track agreement expiration dates ensuring adequate lead time to negotiate renewals/replacements is available

Collaborate with vendors and Brother departments ensuring agreement renewals/replacements meet requirements

Collaborate with vendors and Brother departments ensuring compliance is satisfied

Administer formal termination notifications when necessary

Education

Bachelor's Degree IT, Accounting, Legal, Administration Preferred
Experience
Minimum 8 years
Vendor Management with large enterprise

Proven track record of successfully managing complex vendor management initiatives in large organizations

Strong experience in benchmarking vendor performance, mitigating risk, continuously improving productivity.

Strong experience with vendor administration including onboarding, vendor invoicing, offboarding.

Strong experience in tracking vendor agreements, scheduling renewal/replacement negotiations, complying with terminations.

Recognized facilitator of vendor relationships.

Languages

Spanish Preferred
French-Canadian Preferred

Software/Technical Skills

Microsoft Office Applications Advanced Required
Ascent ELM Preferred
SAP S4 Hana Preferred
Zycus Supplier Management Preferred

Other Skills/Knowledge/Abilities

Vendor Relationship Management Preferred
Senior Leadership Communications Preferred
Facilitation & Negotiation Preferred
Vendor Invoice Accounting (Accounts Payable) Required
Business Analysis Preferred

This role will be a hybrid role. Subject to business needs, employees may work remotely up to two days per week. Assigned office days will be determined by managers.

Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 16,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. Under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo is primarily focused on providing novel therapies in oncology, as well as other research areas centered around rare diseases and immune disorders.

Summary
The Manager, GPM&L supports development and execution of programs, projects, and strategic initiatives for Daiichi Sankyo global R&D function. Will support and manage project and change management for complex, cross-functional initiatives for global teams and workstreams, ensuring comprehensive understanding of business and stakeholder needs, planning and optimal execution and adoption within the business. Assignments include strategy enablement such as capabilities and processes, leveraging multiple skill sets in project management, process improvement, change management and analytics. This position will also lead and support divisional and departmental level objectives for Asset & Portfolio Management.
Ensure interactions and timely collaboration across R&D, key stakeholders and supporting functions. Proactively identify and facilitate risks, mitigations, resolution and escalation of issues, tracking and communicating status to stakeholders and group leadership. Strong communications skills required with the ability to engage with senior leaders through various communication mechanisms and presentations. The successful candidate has a solid understanding of the drug development process and is skilled in the use of project management tools. Experience working on global, cross-functional teams as well as an understanding of facilitating high-functioning teams.

Responsibilities
Project Management
Collaborate with PM lead and global, cross-functional project teams to define project scope, deliverables, responsibilities and timelines
Create draft deliverables working in conjunction with business SMEs to drive completion in a timely manner
Develop and manage project plans, actions, risks, meeting agendas and minutes
Develop Executive presentations
Understand organizational strategy and ensure the implementation of strategic initiatives are aligned to overarching strategic objectives
Process Improvement
Ability to define and document processes, critically analyze and define areas for improvement
Facilitate workshops to define current state, future state and process gaps
Develop new processes, ways of working and support the implementation within the business
Analytics
Collect and define requirements and develop models in Excel or Business Intelligence tools for project needs
Develop management reports and dashboards
Change Management
Identify requirements for change management and communications for the implementation of business initiatives
Create content to support change management, communications and training needs (e.g., stakeholder analysis, training requirements, stakeholder communications)
Qualifications: Successful candidates will be able to meet the qualifications below with or without a reasonable accommodation.

Education Qualifications (from an accredited college or university)
Bachelor's Degree Bachelor’s degree in science, engineering or business required
Master's Degree Advanced degree in science or business preferred.
Experience Qualifications
5+ years relevant project management, process improvement, business analysis or consulting experience
Prior work experience as a top tier management consultant, project manager or similar role in pharmaceutical drug development desirable. Project Management or Process improvement qualification, certification or diploma is highly desired.
Knowledge of pharmaceutical industry/ drug development preferred
Scientific background desirable

Application Consulting Group (ACG) is a business analytics consulting firm focused on helping customers create methodical and predictable ways to improve business results and performance, across the organization.

Due to the continuing growth of our IBM Planning Analytics (TM1) systems implementation practice, we are currently hiring full time Senior Consultants (Hybrid and Remote) in the US. In this role, you will be responsible for the design and development of new budgeting and planning applications, upgrading systems to new versions and/or cloud platforms, and implementing functional enhancements to existing applications.

The Ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of solid hands on TM1 application development experience writing TI scripts, creating rules and developing reports in PAX or perspectives. Analytical problem solving skills, strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to work in a team environment are a must. In addition, strong financial business analysis skills are required for the development of financial reports within a multi-dimensional budgeting and planning database system environment.

The following are a plus: modeling in other multi-dimensional database technologies (i.e. Essbase), experience in other finance systems, and experience in the IBM Planning Analytics cloud environment.

A Bachelor’s degree in related discipline required. Masters degree preferred.

Description: The SAP Commercial Business Analyst is responsible for support and oversight of the SAP commercial/sales & distribution function, reporting to the SAP Commercial Lead. With a focus on understanding the business process and translating that into technical requirements, the business analyst will be required to drive both issue resolution and project delivery, including optimization initiatives. This role is will also perform a local SAP architect function, partnering with the Commercial & Sales functions to provide consultancy for system and process improvements whilst ensuring that global template standards are maintained.

Responsibilities:

Work closely with SAP technical teams to define & implement solutions
Document Functional & Technical Specification documents for technical teams to resolve issues
Define & implement testing strategies with business users & owners
Prepare changes for change approval board
Coordinate SAP AMS contract resource workload; make sure contract resources are working on correctly prioritized issues & changes
Partner & influence site Commercial / Sales / logistics Leadership in developing strategic application roadmaps
Solution architecture leadership for regional change requests
Consult and share ideas for optimization of processes and technology & influence IT & SAP leadership
Work with SAP & Applications steering team to prioritize changes & through the Demand management process
Document new requirements & eye for detail and empowered to challenge
Understand all site SAP issues and impacts relating to Commercial, Sales, & Logistics business functions
Coordinate SAP support resources & point of escalation for critical issues on site; Escalate, where needed, to leadership teams, both business and technology
Document issues through the Service Desk process; Resolve the issue and document changes
Work with other SAP Global Function teams to make sure alignment with other business cross-functional requirements and priorities are captured.
Work with the PMO to implement enhancement projects. Manage projects through to implementation.
Work with business and SAP leadership to develop 3 year plans for SAP upgrades & module enhancements – Commercial / Sales / logistics modules
Work with the business, PMO, and leadership team to plan and implement SAP upgrades
Train users – provide small group training on existing and new functionality
Prioritise remote vendor workload and manage complex relationships.

Required:

Education: Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years’ experience of Commercial/Sales/logistics modules and processes in SAP.
Technical understanding of ABAP, user exits, BAPIs, and BADIs. Ability to debug code.
Understand EDI integration support & IDoc and partner profile support
SAP Configuration and support experience
Core specialty – Sales & Distribution (SD), LSMW Development and implementation
Preferred experience – Logistics Execution (LE), Material Management (MM), S&OP processes


Proficient in SAP SD Order to Cash and Intercompany Sales
Proficient in Output Determination, Billing, LSMW


Experience with SAP for a Global pharma business

Ability to work independently and with others to gather and document business requirements, perform business analysis and develop solutions.
Develop best practices, operational procedures and design documentation as an SAP Commercial SME.
In depth knowledge of core Pharma Commercial processes & practices within a regulated business
Effective Pharma Commercial knowledge transfer to a Global business to facilitate optimization initiatives
Ability to articulate and influence the strategy and optimization opportunities to all levels
Strong skills in the areas of communication, delivery on results, self-development, adaptability, flexibility, and global perspective.
Strong time management and organizational skills. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and Problem-solving mindset.
Aility to escalate and bring in resources to resolve the issues in a timely efficient manner.
Able to work remotely whilst keeping in close communication with the remaining SAP Commercial team
Self-starter and able to communicate effectively; willingness to learn new module and get involved in areas outside primary role

Company Name: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey (PANYNJ)
Job Description:
Description





For Exceptional Candidate willing to consider Remote. East Coast Candidates Only

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The GIS Administrator will work within the Enterprise Architecture group of the agency’s Technology Department (TEC), responsible for the architecture, design, implementation and ongoing support of the installed Esri ArcGIS Products, Services and Web Applications. The ideal candidate will have an indepth knowledge in the Esri GIS Platform and the Microsoft Power Platform including Power BI, Power Automate and Power Apps. The successful candidate will work within the Enterprise Architecture group, as well as with other contractors, and staff resources, of different TEC Units, and Departments throughout the Agency in application development, administration, provisioning, troubleshooting, monitoring, and remediation while delivering work products using Agile and DevOps methodologies.

Participation in planning phases of the GIS platform for projects, technical analysis, design, testing and implementation.
Ownership of the Enterprise GIS budget, invoicing, associated contracts and roadmap.
Maintenance of an agency wide GIS to provide geographic information (maps, spatial functions, spatial databases, etc.) for operational and planning support for all Agency facilities and departments.
Provision, installation, configuration and deployment for production and development environments of Esri’s ArcGIS platform and SQL Server, with needed add-ins and modules, and deployment of updates and patches as necessary.
Utilization of GIS and associated software to produce, display, analyze and distribute geographic information.
Assisting staff with provisioning environments and workspaces that include Power BI, Power Automate and Power Apps.
Management of communication and scheduling of maintenance activities.
Maintenance of an operational run book inclusive of software versions, hardware specifications and architectural/logical diagrams.
Incorporating Agile and DevOps methodologies into existing and new workstreams.
Providing technical demonstrations and proof of concepts to non-technical staff.
Facilitating meetings with staff to understand user and business requirements for application development.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Candidate must present the following qualifications to be considered eligible for this position:

Possess a bachelor’s degree and or equivalent experience with at least three years’ professional experience in the Esri ArcGIS environment.
Thorough understanding of GIS software, data, methodologies, and challenges.
Candidate will have the skills to install, configure and administer ArcGIS products in development and production enterprise environments.

DESIRED:

Ideal candidates will present the following profile:

Experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and working with ESRI GIS software
Experience with ArcGIS for Desktop, ArcGIS Server, ArcGIS Enterprise (Portal, Server, Web Adaptor), ArcGIS APIs, ArcGIS Pro
Experience integrating IBM Maximo Spatial with the ArcGIS Enterprise platform.
Familiarity with publishing map services and feature services in ArcGIS Enterprise environment
Familiarity with configuring ESRI Feature Layers, Map Image Layers, Web Maps, and the Web AppBuilder to generate Viewing Apps, Story Map Apps, Data Maintenance Apps, Operational Dashboard apps, etc. in ArcGIS Online or ArcGIS Enterprise
Familiarity with configuring and maintaining ESRI enterprise geodatabases and general database management experience with Microsoft SQL Server.
Familiarity with mobile data collection tools including Esri Survey123 and ArcGIS Field Maps
Proficiency creating ESRI feature classes and domains and executing geoprocessing tools to develop and modify geodatabase entities.
Proficiency with the Python programming language, FME Desktop and FME Server.
Proficiency with Power BI, Power Apps and Power Automate.
Familiarity with Azure Cloud preferred. Experience with AWS/Google cloud also accepted.
Knowledge of SDLC, application development life cycle, testing, performance tuning and debugging, and best practices for governance and security.
Strong customer service skills with emphasis on effective technical writing and verbal communications skills to perform business analysis, needs assessment, technical design, and implementation.
Ability to work independently and collaborate in teams, prioritize tasks and synthesize feedback into creative solutions.
Basic knowledge of supporting technologies should include: Windows Server, Linux, Azure Cloud, SQL Server, basic network architecture and security, Domains and Active Directory, and Microsoft Office
Esri Certification including ArcGIS Desktop Associate, ArcGIS Desktop Professional and/or ArcGIS Enterprise Administration Professional

Together for a cleaner, healthier world.
Johnson Matthey, a FTSE 250 company, is a global leader in sustainable technologies specialising in catalysis, precious metal products, chemicals and process technology. With operations in over 30 countries, we employ more than 14,000 people. Johnson Matthey uses science to make the world cleaner and healthier. Over the past two centuries we have built our reputation and place as a global leader through quality, integrity, and innovation. Today, more than 93% of the group's sales come from products and services which provide sustainability benefits through the positive impact they have on the environment, resource efficiency and human health, but that’s not enough. We have ambitious plans for growth and need talented individuals to help shape and lead us into our next century.
Platinum Group Metal Services (PGMS) is a leading refiner and recycler of precious group metals. The growing demand for low carbon and responsibly sourced products is creating growth opportunities in critical metals recycling and secondary refining, and as the world’s largest precious metals recycler, PGMS is a key player in the circular economy.
To be the lead for commercial analytics for the US PGMS businesses, by analysing, interpreting, and reporting business data. Thereby enabling effective decision-making and delivery of the PGMS Commercial strategy.
Your responsibilities:
Collects, compiles, verifies, and presents business data so that management has timely information for operational decision making.
Maintains, tracks, and presents a broad range of defined business metrics for the US businesses to enable measurement of and improvement in business performance, including gap analysis to plan.
Manage consolidation and review, working with the sales team, the monthly sales forecast across our US Refining, Chemical Products, and Noble Metals businesses. Including updates on likely outcome within the month vs expectations.
Supports data creation, analysis and KPI tracking for the PGMS IBP process.
Reports on US customer performance through volume and revenue analyses.
Through the collation and analysis of data, supports the evaluation of new and existing business.
Supports development of basic pricing models to support our pricing and product profitability strategy.
Identifies opportunities to improve the profitability of PGMS product lines through data analysis.
Coordinates the annual sales budget process for the US sites, producing a 3-year budget in volume, revenue, and margin.
Develops and maintains strong working relationships with operations, finance, supply chain and commercial teams to enable the data analysis as required by the business.
Supports internal and external commercial teams with ad-hoc data requests/analysis of sales, pricing, and costs.
Ensures information is appropriately communicated within the business.
Participates in business analysis projects.
Suggests improvements to existing methods/systems/processes, including, but not limited to, expanding current reporting methods through the use of automation and visualisation software.
To take on any other duties which are within the employee’s skills and abilities whenever reasonably instructed.
Requirements for the role:
Degree level qualification (or equivalent) in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Chemistry, or related field
Experience in a commercial environment desirable
Experience in a related industry desirable
Excellent analytical skills and the ability to collate and analyse large data sets
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Knowledge of databases and BI tools (e.g. PowerBI) desirable
Strong interpersonal skills
Strong attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability and desire to learn complex processes
How you will be rewarded:
We offer a competitive compensation and JM Elements benefits package including bonus, excellent pension contributions and 20 days annual leave (varies for shift- based roles). Our JM Elements Benefits programme helps our employees understand and manage the JM benefits, as well as helping you focus on your overall wellbeing – for you and your family.

Description

You will be the technical and operational interface and “go-to guru” between IT and Operations as it relates to the initial deployment, training, configuration and support of our WMS application. In this newly created role, you will have the opportunity to implement a new warehouse application system - ensuring that all warehouse systems are operating smoothly, and that our customers are getting an exceptional service experience. The WMS Operations Analyst will be responsible for the data flows, issue resolution and configuration throughout the implementation process. Define, document, and consult on functional and technical requirements to support daily operations. Serving as the first point of contact for the user community, supporting issue validation and scoping, acting as the liaison between users and the IT team.

Key Responsibilities


Provide implementation support / coordination of WMS to include initial warehouse and customer configuration, user training within the facility for Go live preparation and application testing with IT, customer and local users.
Provide post implementation support (1st level) for local site operational issues and (re) configuration requirements for continuous improvement projects.
Support new release testing against customer requirements.
Identify and recommend change controls to support operational enhancements and fixes.
Develop and maintain process documentation, including standard operating procedures, work instructions, and training materials.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement new programs and process improvements.
Analyze data and present findings to management for decision-making.
Provide training and support to warehouse personnel to ensure successful implementation of new processes.
Execute data extracts and analysis to build business cases to support system changes.

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science Information Systems, Logistics or related field.
3-5 years of experience in a 3PL environment.
Strong knowledge of WMS systems, experience with WMS implementation and optimization.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Willingness to work flexible hours and travel as needed.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Experience in project management or lead role in technical implementations preferred.
Strong knowledge of SQL Server, Oracle, and other Database Technologies
Experience in documenting process flows and operational procedures.

In fact, we know that batching and shipping alone won’t solve your problem. We provide a personalized and comprehensive approach that ensures you get your products into the hands of your customers – faster, easier, and more cost effectively than ever before – all while staying cold.

Job Title: Real Estate Finance – Business Analyst, Analyst
Job Description:
The Real Estate (“RE”) Finance group is responsible for the preparation of performance and attribution reporting of BREP results for internal and external purposes. The group mainly provides support to business management and deal professionals while addressing a variety of investor relations, management reporting, and global investor relations strategies. The Analyst would be responsible for supporting technology initiatives, performing analyses, and financial reporting for Real Estate (“RE”). Please refer to details below.
Re-Engineering Advancements: Partner with BXTI in strategic business initiatives and automation projects to enhance and streamline reporting processes on a global scale (includes London and Singapore). Role involves UAT activities (test, document and support), data migration (plan, execute, and validate), and data governance. Areas of focus include:
Valuation Reporting: Assist finance, asset management and portfolio management teams domiciled across the globe to prepare quarterly valuation materials presented to senior management and the committee
Internal and External Reporting: Work collaboratively with investor relations and portfolio management to support the automation of quarterly and ad-hoc investor reporting
Forecasting: Systematize the forecasting of future realizations across +350 investments.
Special Projects: Participate in and support projects as the business continues to evolve and grow
Qualifications:
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Math, Accounting or Economics with strong academic record
1+ years of experience in a business analyst, consulting, or Private Equity / Real Estate role
Ability to partner across teams, summarize issues, develop recommendations, and make decisions
Anaplan / Real Estate finance / valuation / waterfall calculation / project management experience a plus
Strong Microsoft Office skills (MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Word); The candidate is expected to have experience building and working with large data validation files (Pivots, V-Lookups)
Strong analytical, problem solving, critical thinking and detail-oriented, multitask and deliver under competing deadlines; the candidate is a self-starter with a strong work ethic that thrives on complexity and solution finding
Committed to continuous process improvement

The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion.

VICE PRESIDENT- FIP BUSINESS ANALYST (JOB NUMBER: FIN003514)




Business Overview:

The Finance Americas COO department ensures that appropriate solutions are put in place for the Finance (accounting) and Tax organization to meet their business objectives. The team acts as the bridge for the Finance and Tax organization to various departments within the BNP Paribas group, mainly the Business, PMO and Technology organizations in New York, New Jersey, California, Montreal, Mumbai, London, and Paris.




The role resides within FCOO’s Finance Implementation Projects (FIP) Business Line team that works on a wide range of projects simultaneously arising from business, regulatory changes, and strategic initiatives. The team is also responsible for the reengineering efforts of existing applications to improve functionality and efficiencies. The team also provides first line user support through training, research and responding to general queries.




Candidate Success Factors:

Candidates are measured on the following four performance drivers, which will dictate how individual impact is considered on the Americas platform:

Results and Impact
Able to influence peers and team.
Demonstrates good judgement when making decisions of high complexity and impact.
Exercise appropriate autonomy in the execution and delivery of work.
Responsible for driving outcomes, which have meaningful effect on team or department.
Leadership and Collaboration:
Creates trust with colleagues.
Acts in leadership capacity for projects, processes, or programs.
Client, Customer and Stakeholder Focus:
Able to build relationships with a mix of colleagues and clients.
Interacts regularly with management and department leaders.
Demonstrates the ability to influence stakeholders at the team level.
Compliance Culture and Conduct:
Takes full responsibility for personal actions and demonstrates courage in facing problems and conflicts.
Perceived as a person of high moral character; upholds corporate values and displays high ethical standards.



Responsibilities:

The Business Analyst has broad-based responsibilities for the functional design, business line specification and deployment of Finance Systems and Process changes initiatives at both an Americas Legal Entity and IHC level. The candidate will work as a team member of projects. General responsibilities include:

Generate, analyse, and document user requirements and business processes for IT development (BRD).
Undertake data assessment, data gap analysis and remediation.
Implement operational accounting schemas throughout product lifecycle.
Plan and manage user acceptance and migration testing up to successful delivery of end-product or remediation solution.
Ensure proper and adequate aftercare and follow-up to remediate any unforeseen issues.
Manage issues and escalate effectively.
Ensure on-time quality delivery of projects and tasks assigned.
Participate in project planning and cost estimates.
Liaise and coordinate cross-functionally to review requirements with stakeholders to enable design and development in liaison with IT, coordinate testing, support go-live, and provide long term support for operational readiness, governance, controls, and aftercare.
Devise strategic and well-thought-out solutions to business initiatives.
Facilitate working group meetings with effective presentation materials and documentation; prepare agendas, document-meeting outcomes and communicate to stakeholders and management.
Support enhancement efforts of the overall control environment, including upstream processes and controls.



Specific responsibilities for the Finance Implementation Project Business Line Analyst role:

Sound knowledge of lifecycle of financial Global Market and Global Banking products and banking processes, ability to navigate complex data systems and architecture.
Work closely with Finance Strategy group for current and upcoming new transactions or activities
Acts as the contact person within the project teams and for the business line in relation to data and functional aspects and document and validate BRD updates accordingly.
Engage finance internal teams for relevant schemas and downstream reporting of finance processes.
Ensure accounts, products, legal entities, and source systems are properly reflected in implementation.
Track timelines and budget, report weekly updates, lead, and participate in OpCo/SteerCo meetings
Ensure appropriate coverage to anticipate and enable resolution for any unforeseen or blocking issues with appropriate escalation.
Identify opportunities to enhance and automate processes and agilely reprioritize and support other finance projects as they emerge.
Ensures proper change management controls, rules, and responsibilities as required.
Shares knowledge about the area of expertise and provides functional support.
Excellent PowerPoint and Excel skills to allow for analysis, summary, and presentation to working group and management as needed.




Minimum Required Qualifications:

Qualified CFA / Finance University Degree.
8 to 10 years of work experience in the field of accounting and / or accounting systems (i.e. upstream to general ledger and downstream) and implementation in the financial services industry.
Strong technical accounting background in the financial services industry (Ex: Corporate and Investment Bank, Prime and Hedge Fund Services, Investment Management, etc.)
Experience must include business analysis and application testing.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Business analysis and project management skills including Microsoft Office, SQL preferred.
Ability to understand complex financial products and system architectures, including accounting business processes, financial, and management reporting (IAS and US GAAP), month-end closing process, regulatory reporting, entity consolidations and multi-currency accounting.
Experience working with accounting and reporting of complex financial products (Ex: Derivatives, Forex, Equities, Fixed Income, Treasury, Loan Syndication, Supply Chain, Trade Finance, etc.) with deep understanding of product lifecycles and associated accounting events.
Detail-oriented approach with problem solving mind-set and ability to work independently.
Ability to effectively challenge and apply professional skepticism with the goal of providing strategic solutions.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to explain complex issues clearly and concisely to audiences of varying technical or accounting levels.
Ability to work effectively in geographically dispersed cross-functional teams.



Preferred Qualifications:

CFA or experience in financial products strongly preferred.
Knowledge of accounting standards - IFRS and/or US GAAP are of interest.
Strong accounting knowledge
Experience working with IT in product implementations of financial systems
Experience in Business Analysis (Accounting and Reporting) and Application Testing (accounting interpreter, sub ledger, general ledger, and reporting tools) in financial services industry.
Fluency in one of more of these languages preferred: French, Spanish and/or Portuguese.
Knowledge of emerging solutions and analytic tools preferred, e.g., robotics, Alteryx, BI, AI etc.



FINRA Registrations Required: Series 7 preferred




CFTC Swap Dealer Associated Person (if yes, NFA Swaps Proficiency Program is required): Not Applicable




SEC Security-Based Swap Dealer Associated Person: Not Applicable

About BNP Paribas:

BNP Paribas is a leading bank in Europe with an international reach across the US, EMEA and APAC. It has a presence in 65 countries, with nearly 190,000 employees. In the United States, BNP Paribas has built a strong and diversified presence to support its client base. We continue to grow and strengthen our commitment to the US market through our Corporate & Institutional Banking activities. We are one of a few non-US banks to offer a full value chain for our clients, from trading to financing, and clearing and custody in the US with the international footprint and capacity to deliver both globally and locally. Leveraging the strength of our European roots, our network can support clients in virtually every region of the world, enabling more connectivity and efficiency wherever our clients conduct business. We take pride in our expertise and our ability to adapt while constantly looking ahead to create a more sustainable world.




The bank employs nearly 6,000 people and has a presence in the country since the late 1800s in major cities including New York, Jersey City, Chesterbrook, PA, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Denver and Washington, DC.




As an international company with a global footprint, the unique cultures and viewpoints of our team members are an integral part of the fabric of BNP Paribas. We are a company with a purpose - to be a responsible and sustainable global leader. We aim to create an environment where our employees feel empowered to drive change, make an impact and be true to themselves. We employ talented individuals from a wide variety of backgrounds, locally and globally, and are inspired by our employees who help us in cultivating a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace through initiatives such as our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI) Leadership Forum and Employee Resource Group (ERG) communities. We strive to be a workplace where all team members can grow and thrive and offer robust training, development and mentoring opportunities to make that vision a reality. Our leaders are deeply committed to DEI and highly accessible to our employees, consistently soliciting feedback on how we can continue to support our employees to reach their highest potential.

Job Description

Reporting into the Serialization Global Process Lead, this role is responsible for ensuring process adherence of Serialization global processes in the Americas region. The candidate will work closely together with serialization team and regional leads and other business stakeholders, with market-based teams, and with other teams in BT and the broader supply chain organization. The candidate will be responsible to meet compliance with America countries serialization regulations and ensure computer systems validation in accordance with business requirements. The main serialization BT products used are Athena SAP ATTP (Advanced Track & Trace for Pharmaceuticals), and SAP ICH (Information Collaboration Hub) which is a cloud-based platform for exchanging serialization information with partners and supply chain stakeholders.

Your responsibilities will include:

Representing the America markets as a process SME for new, and changing, compliance requirement Serialization projects.
Representing the America markets as a process SME for new, and changing, compliance requirement Unique Device Identification (UDI) projects.
Process Stewardship for pharmaceutical serialization process adherence in America markets
Responsible for the Distribute and Report stages of the SER Global Operating Model for the Americas, ensuring serialization processes are efficient, stable, reliable, compliant and well supported by BT systems (primarily SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals/ATTP & SAP Information Collaboration Hub/ICH)
Support SER master data team in the preparation and definition of Master Data in Athena S4 and ATTP
Provide overall support for serialization for Americas users to ensure optimal use of applications by business and identify business process improvement opportunities
Prepare and maintain Standard Operations Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions and Process Flow Diagrams
Perform scoping, process mapping, fit-gap workshops for projects/enhancements, solution validation and cutover data management related to serialization in Americas.
Support execution of serialization running projects, including change management, testing, training, user access, lesson learned
Deliver training to user community of processes and procedures
Liaise with different stakeholders like in-market business teams, packaging site leads, Logistics team and business partners like Contract Manufucturing Organization (CMO), Customer and Third Party Logistics (3PL) to ensure business continuity in Americas market.

Education:

Technical degree (engineering and/or computer science)
Bachelor’s degree in Pharmaceutical
MBA or equivalent

Required Experience:

5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or IT Analyst in pharmaceutical serialization domain
3+ years’ experience in Enterprise Serialization System SAP ATTP- Data cockpit, country regulatory reporting solution, master data setup, AIF error monitoring, Serial number management, Business Transactions etc
Experience working in regulated, healthcare environment in pharmaceuticals
Strong knowledge of Pharmaceutical Serialization, GS1 Standards and related technologies (EPCIS)
Knowledge of Pharmaceutical Track and Trace regulatory reporting requirements
Knowledge in GS1 standards (GTIN, SGTIN, GLN, SGLN, SSCC, GCP)
Business process knowledge on pharmaceutical products packaging, aggregation, barcode printing and verification
Good experience of working with SAP ATTP integration with SAP ERP, packaging line management solution and SAP ICH
Strong verbal and written communication
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional, global team
Flexibility in handling assignments and tasks

Preferred Experience:

Understanding of GxP environments
Knowledge of Warehouse Management Systems like SAP WM, EWM
Inbound and Outbound logistics in SAP ECC
Integration of SAP ATTP with Tracelink, SAP ICH
Experience on Tracelink
Knowledge of master data setups in SAP ERP (ECC or S/4 HANA)
Proficient in MS Office products word, excel, visio etc

Support local warehouse activities associated with serialization and eWM cockpit activities in Americas

Support on-boarding of CMOs in the Americas region
Collaborate and work with the SER Team to define Serialization metrics and KPIs
Monitor process performance and execute periodic KPI analysis to verify process stability within America region
Support execution of data reporting to HA in America region
Perform monitoring of errors during reporting to HA and lead troubleshooting to resolution

WS Audiology (WSA), the hearing company, has an immediate full time opening for a Data Science/Business Analytics Specialist in our Iselin, NJ office, but we are also open to remote candidates. We are seeking a dynamic, hard-working professional with a desire to work in a fast-paced environment.

Come see why our employees describe their WSA colleagues as being “like family.” We’re a mid-sized company with a big heart and a small-company feel. We’re big enough to provide lots of opportunities for professional growth and small enough that you can really make a difference. If that sounds like the kind of place where you’d like to settle in and bring real value to the customers you serve, we’d like to meet you!!

WSA is headquartered in Iselin, NJ, one of the world’s top manufacturers of hearing aids. Our companies serve hearing care professionals globally and have built up market-leading positions in many countries. In fact, we are proud to develop and manufacture one out of every four hearing aids being used worldwide.

The Data Science/Business Analytics Manager will report to the VP, Strategy and be at the core of maximizing the value of our data, by building critical reports for all parts of the company, creating complex analyses with deep insights, building new data models to cover all entities, and building machine learning driven predictive reporting.




Key Responsibilities
Build new standard reports combining a wide array of data sources available
Adapt existing reporting to changing needs of the business
Develop automation for recurring analytics in Excel with VBA and Automation Anywhere driven automations
Create complex analyses for the most complex topics that exceed the capabilities existing in the responsible departments
As the need develops, build machine learning models for predictive analytics
Scope will be across all WS Audiology wholesale brands
WSA uses PowerBI as key visualization tool as well as Einstein on salesforce.com




Qualifications
Superior analytical skills including the ability to create complex data models
Experience in PowerBI and/or Einstein/Tableau or similar tools to create visualizations in the company
Knowledge in building machine learning models
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and interpersonal skills.
Highly organized and attentive to detail
Must be able to meet or exceed on launch deadlines
Self-starting with exceptional follow-through and multi-tasking capabilities
Ability to quickly adapt in a fast-paced and challenging industry
Highly motivated with a strong desire to succeed.




Education
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
3-5 years of experience in a data analytics role
Excellent skills in Excel including VBA programming, SQL, PowerBI, and ideally also Infor and Salesforce.com

At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services.

Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world.

With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes.

We are seeking an energetic and skilled Guidewire Business Systems Analyst in our Berkeley Heights, NJ office. Candidate will be responsible to identify business needs, analyze the change, provide development support, and test Insurance software changes, enhancements, and solutions. Work with end user community to develop and document business requirements for PC, BC and CC. Develop specifications and coordinate efforts of developers. Support testing through creation of test plans, coordination of testing resources and execution of tests conditions. Throughout the process, work with operate team to ensure the requirements are delivered, while supporting and communicating with the business through the implementation process.

Responsibilities

Work directly with business users (Operations, Underwriting, Billing, and Claims) to understand business processes, gather & document requirements to implement system changes that meet business needs.
Performs comprehensive discovery and analysis activities to develop new or modified system requirements.
Develop Use Cases, Functional Requirements, Screen Specs, Mockups, Process flows, and User Manuals
Lead the review of specifications, user sign off procedures and the development of documentation for development and enhancement work.
Interface with departments to ensure proper features are incorporated in all system changes. Provide user support, documentation, and training for ongoing maintenance support.
Develop test plans and test schedules to ensure accuracy of systems as requested by end users; coordinate testing efforts in the Quality Assurance environment until user acceptance is obtained. Perform or assist as necessary in the quality assurance testing of developed projects.
Assist in the coordination testing, training and implementation of system changes.
Monitor daily migrations to Quality Assurance function.
Conduct post-production implementation reviews.
Providing support to analyze production issues from business perspective.
Participate as a member of the command center in supporting internal and external users in the use of Policy Center, Claim center and Billing Center.

Skills

Guidewire certified ACE business analyst
Experience with Guidewire Insurance Suite software; for all three (policy center, billing center, and claims center)
Technical proficiency, with the ability to understand data flows and the flow between complex, integrated systems.
Outstanding organizational, troubleshooting, and communication skills, both written and verbal, in both technical and non-technical forums
Able to work in a fast-paced environment with flexibility to meet continuously changing priorities.
Able to multitask, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure.
Highly motivated self-starter; able to work independently.
Experience collaborating with Development and QA teams in a process-oriented organization.
Experience with Jira or similar project management tool
Strong time management and planning skills, be able to work with teams across the globe.

Since 1989, SHI International Corp. has helped organizations change the world through technology. We’ve grown every year since, and today we’re proud to be a $14 billion global provider of IT solutions and services.
