Job Title: Product Management Lead Analyst – Centene Operations Management - Express Scripts - Hybrid
Job Description:
The job profile for this position is Product Management Lead Analyst, which is a Band 3 Senior Contributor Career Track Role.

We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!

Our people make all the difference in our success.

The Regulated Markets Centene Operations Management team is responsible for ensuring the execution of key operations accountabilities associated with all regulated lines of business including Medicare, Medicaid, and Marketplace (Exchange / Health Care Reform). The team supports Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) delegated responsibilities associated with regulatory audit support, issue management, adjustment processing, Prescription Drug Event (PDE)/encounters reporting and regulatory communications.

The Lead Analyst will ensure the effective delivery of all non-regulatory communications activities (audits, issue management, adjustments ad PDE/encounters). The role will also support initiatives to ensure member/client satisfaction, alignment with client contractual support and client retention. When necessary the analyst will also provide functional SME support to client facing discussions.

Key Responsibilities:

Provides advanced professional input to complex assignments/projects.
Works autonomously, only requiring “expert” level technical support from others.
Follows audit support processes to notify to Express Scripts of client audit needs, facilitate Client/Express Scripts preparation and support for audit scope and document completion of all audit deliverables and findings
Facilitates the intake, triage, root cause analysis, mitigation, impact analysis and closure of all client issues associated with regulatory compliance
Process completion of all adjustment requests aligned with client specific request processes
Ensure accurate delivery, response management and correction of client PDE (Medicare) and Encounter (Medicaid) reporting
Promotes the tracking and documentation of all team activities in associated systems
Supports the client Project Management Office (PMO) and Account Teams with function specific communications needs via account team/client inquiry requests, Field Alert development, deliverable reports and presentations
Compiles and evaluates data on the functional performance. Utilizes in-depth professional knowledge and acumen to develop models and procedures and monitor trends.
Exercises judgment in the evaluation, selection, and adaptation of both standard and complex techniques and procedures.
May assist, coordinate or lead portions of mid-size projects. Supports and provides direction to more junior professionals.
Exhibits proven ability to work cross-functionally in development and execution of operational plans aligned to enterprise goals and in support of the needs of our clients.
Exercises considerable creativity, foresight, and judgment in conceiving, planning, and delivering initiatives.

Ideal Candidates will offer:

Bachelor’s Degree with a preferred focus of Health Care Administration or Business
At least one year experience in a health plan or PBM setting. Medicare, Medicaid and Marketplace experience a plus.
Able to balance high priority, long-term projects with short-term, immediate deadlines
Creative thinker and exceptional problem solving skills
Ability to follow processes and document information consistently and timely to meet obligations
Able to translate technical data concepts to business partners for understanding and alignment
Proven ability to function in a heavily matrixed environment.
Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office products (particularly Excel, Word, Power Point, etc.).
Experience leading projects and working with cross functional teams, especially Business and Marketing communications teams

Other Essential Skills:

Excellent process mapping and analysis skills
Open communicator; excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively in dynamic, rapidly changing, team-based environment across multiple functions and in support of diverse regulatory obligations.
Critical thinker and creative problem solver, who exercises good judgment in resolving difficult situations, prioritizes and can balance needs with enterprise objectives
Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline-driven environment, and juggle multiple, sometimes competing, priorities and requirements
Ability to motivate, influence and connect others
Ability to influence direction and action; build and leverage internal relationships
Goal oriented and personally accountable; resourceful and self-directed
Adaptable and flexible; open minded, innovative and creative – seeks ‘out of box’ solutions

This is a hybrid role and will require the ability to work in person.




If you will be working at home occasionally or permanently, the internet connection must be obtained through a cable broadband or fiber optic internet service provider with speeds of at least 10Mbps download/5Mbps upload.

Overview:
The Sr. Project Manager for Yusen Logistics Americas has a broad overview and scope of concurrent projects, work with project managers and other stakeholders to set project goals and objectives. They are responsible for day to day managing of large-scale, cross-functional programs that create efficiencies and improvements to the business. They identify and procure necessary resources, estimating project budgets, set project scope and schedules and finalize project plans.

Senior Project Managers provide leadership, guidance and support to project team, motivating them to hit project milestones and provide coaching and mentorship to Project managers.

Based on company guidelines and general Project Management methodology, independently plan and coordinate the successful execution of multiple, complex IT projects. Manage against the standard triple constraints of scope, schedule and cost while managing risk and ensuring quality.
Responsibilities:
Project Initiation & Planning
Develop project charter / project scope and obtaining buy-in from project stakeholders
Learn and apply Agile Methodology for Project Management
Learn and use Dev Ops as the primary tool for Project demand and management
Supporting the product owner in managing communications with stakeholders, managing customer’s expectations for deliverables, and implementing an effective project governance system.
Managing several concurrent projects.
Decide deadlines and budget of the project accordingly
Maintain status report of the project and also keep a record of the previous reports
Compile historical data available with the team and present it for reference of senior leadership and the team members on the project
Present status reports of the project to the leadership of the organization
Help in the development and implementation of agile projects
Assist in team development by removing road-blocks to their work, mentoring them and making a good utilization of organizational resources to improve capacity for project work
Promote empowerment of the team by ensuring that each team member is fully engaged in the project with meaningful contribution
Help the team achieve a high level of performance and quality, holding teams accountable for their work, removing obstacles, and mentoring less experienced team members.
Encourage a sustainable pace with high levels of quality for the team.
Defining the project’s schedule and scope while balancing this with timely and regular value deliveries, and organizing and leading working and project status meetings.
Document risks and escalate in a timely manner to minimize impact to business.
Creating long- and short-term plans, including setting targets for milestones and adhering to deadlines
Delegating tasks on the project to employees best positioned to complete them
Making effective decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project
Serving as a point of contact for teams when multiple units are assigned to the same project to ensure team actions remain in synergy
Communicating with executives or the board to keep the project aligned with their goals
Performing quality control on the project throughout development to maintain the standards expected
Adjusting schedules and targets on the project as needs or financing for the project change
Understanding project interdependencies account for those dependencies in planning
Update and provide input to the overall master project roadmaps
Identify or require skill-set and competencies to ensure that the project needs will be met and securing of such project resources based on project plan schedule
Mentor and coach Assisatant Project Managers and Project Managers to apply Project Management best practices and Agile Methodology
Act as an escalation point and work with project sponsors and decision makers to remove roadblocks
Act as a single point of contact between multiple Yusen global IT teams
Central POC for information flow to Yusen global regional business leadership
Lead regional IT teams through multiple projects while minimizing customer's need to duplicate efforts in different global regions
Share IT and Ops data, process and procedures across regions leading to global standardization



Project Execution and Control
Manage and report project schedule including critical path status, impacts and dependencies
Scope change management
Proactively address risks & issues, evaluating impact on critical path (if any), and developing / implementing counter measures to prevent reoccurrence
Ensuring that the resources assigned to the service or a to a specific project are fully utilized according to the pre-defined allocation
Assess technical risks and keeps team apprised of strategy to provide mitigations

Project Closure
Facilitating project “Lessons Learned” sessions

Project Communication
Facilitate project status meetings with internal team and project stakeholders on a daily basis that includes preparation of a formal meeting agenda, review of project schedule / tasks, discussion of project issues / risks, and documentation of formal meeting minutes / action items
Develop project status reports and other required artifacts (e.g., progress curves) and report to group Lead
Escalate major risks and issues to management and / or to the business stakeholders in a timely manner

Management and Practice Building
Foster open communication within the teams being managed and motivate these teams through individual and team recognition on a consistent basis
Quickly mitigate team conflict and communication issues
Proactively suggesting areas for improvement in internal processes and provide possible solutions
Keep project teams aware of relevant program / project related information including program schedule, organizational information, etc.
Keep project teams aware of relevant program / project related information including program schedule, organizational information, etc.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master’s degree plus equivalent plus 10-15 years pure Project Management experience in a medium to large company or ten years in a business analyst role developing project requirements in a medium to large company and five years pure project management experience.
Knowledge of traditional and Agile Project Management
methodologies

Yusen Logistics (Americas) Inc. values each individual employee and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce by providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, uniform service member status, age, disability, sexual and gender orientation, genetic information, or any other protected status in accordance with all applicable federal, state and local laws.

Company Description


About Veolia North America

A subsidiary of Veolia Group, Veolia North America (VNA) offers a full spectrum of water, waste and energy management services, including water and wastewater treatment, commercial and hazardous waste collection and disposal, energy consulting and resource recovery. VNA helps commercial, industrial, healthcare, higher education and municipality customers throughout North America. Headquartered in Boston, Mass., Veolia North America has approximately 10,000 employees working at more than 350 locations across the continent. Please visit our website www.veolianorthamerica.com.



Job Description


BENEFITS

Veolia's comprehensive benefits package includes paid time off policies, as well as health, dental and vision insurance. In addition, employees are also entitled to participate in an employer sponsored 401(k) plan, to save for retirement. Pay and benefits for employees represented by a union are outlined in their collective bargaining agreement.

Position Purpose:

Reporting to the CFO of Veolia Utility Holdings Inc. this role will provide leadership, strategy, and day-to-day management for the finance function, including overall responsibility for financial planning and analysis, financial modeling, management reporting, forecasting and budgeting. This position will be responsible for the consolidated reporting and financial analysis of four business units and ensure that operational decisions result in optimal financial outcomes, address Veolia NA’s core values and consider the proper rate perspective. Revenue $715 MIL EBITDA $350 MIL Net Utility Plant $3.4 BIL.

Primary Duties/Responsibilities:

Leads VUHI Financial Planning & Analysis function, developing the long and short-term financial objectives, plan and metrics ensuring consistency and alignment with overall strategic goals and objectives.
Oversees monthly and quarterly reporting of financial and operational information, including trends, key performance metrics, variances to budget and prior period and forecasts. This reporting will also drive actions and optimize the decision-making process at each business unit.
Leads the annual budget and medium-term plan process, as well as interim forecast updates for VUHI, including developing & maintaining a financial model that supports 20-year projections for P&L, BS and cash flows.
Strategic and financial assessment for Consideration and Commitment Committees of M&A and other investment opportunities. Ensures effective integration of acquisitions.
Plans long-term debt issuances, dividends and partners with treasury to optimize the financing strategy and support the company’s credit rating.
Works in close collaboration with CFO, VP of rates, VUHI Corporate Controller/Chief Accounting Officer, BU Finance Directors, VP of capital planning and operations to orchestrate the regulatory and rate case strategy and execution to optimize financial benefits.
Assist in the development and delivery of rate case filings where required, both from an operational and financial standpoint.
Leads the development of presentations and business review materials that highlight performance, bring clarity to key issues, and support strategic recommendations.
Acts as a thought-partner to the CFO, Finance Leadership Team, and Executive Leadership, providing valuable strategic and financial analysis and insights for VUHI.
Works collaboratively with finance leadership as well as with the business unit General Managers, Finance Directors and operating personnel to help drive operational improvement initiatives, maximize financial results and optimize regulatory treatment through improved operational performance monitoring.


Qualifications


Education/Experience/Background:

Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related disciplines required.
MBA or Senior Management Courses in Business Administration highly desirable.
A minimum of 10 years of financial & business analysis work experience, preferably in utilities, with a track record of progressive responsibility.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Strong experience developed in financial modeling & analysis, and financial planning & reporting.
Outstanding financial and analytical abilities. Effectively analyzes complex problems and creates innovative solutions.
Excellent planning and organizational skills demonstrated in project management and execution, with a strong ability to manage, simultaneously, multiple project deadlines and priorities.
Highly self-motivated individual who will provide leadership and guidance to staff.
Strong financial acumen and high attention to detail.
Ability to understand, analyze and influence financial outcomes due to operational decisions or performance metrics and drive improvement.
Rational & methodological thinking approaches for ‘challenging’ analysis and reviewing target/business unit performance.
Strong written/verbal communication skills and understanding of executive conciseness.
Effective interpersonal skills to relate well to all levels of management. Ability to communicate, collaborate, influence and build long-term effective working relationships with varying levels of leadership across the organization.
Strong work ethic.
Unquestionable ethics and integrity.
Understanding of the U.S. regulatory framework is a plus.

Physical Requirements:

Travel within Utility operations as needed.

Additional Information


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer! All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Job Title: Senior Vice President, Product Management NetX360+
Company Name: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
Job Description:
Bring your ideas. Make history.
BNY Mellon offers an exciting array of future-forward careers at the intersection of business, finance, and technology. We are one of the world's top asset management and banking firms that manages trillions of dollars in assets, custody and/or administration. Known as the “bank of banks” - 97% of the world’s top banks work with us as we lead and serve our customers into the new era of digital.
With over 239 years of rich history and industry firsts, BNY Mellon has been built upon our proven ability to evolve, lead, and drive new ideas at every turn. Today, we’re approximately 50,000 employees across 35 countries with a culture that empowers you to grow, take risks, experiment and be yourself. This is what #LifeAtBNYMellon is all about.

We’re seeking a future team member in the role of Senior Vice President, Product Management to join our Product Management and Platfoms area. This role is located in Jersey City, NJ.

This is a hybrid position.

In this role, you’ll make an impact in the following ways:

The Digital Product team at BNY Mellon | Pershing is responsible for delivering innovative digital experiences to our clients. Our product vision and strategy are driven by voice of the client, business goals and objectives, and competitive intelligence. This dynamic team is responsible for defining the vision, strategy, and roadmaps for our products to design and build solutions that transform user experiences for financial services professionals and their clients.

As a product manager within the NetX360+ product team, the ideal candidate has hands-on experience leading the Agile product development of financial technology solutions. The candidate is responsible for building desirable, viable, and sustainable solutions that meet business and client needs, and for supporting development across the entire product life cycle. You should be an effective cross-functional player between Business Analysis, Project Management, Engineering, User Experience and the rest of the product team.

To be successful in this role, we’re seeking the following:

Are you passionate about:

Championing a suite of products that allow advisors and registered reps to better service their clients?
Soliciting and providing input for innovation and planning?
Ideating, experimenting, and analyzing new approaches for delivering information and support to users across a complex platform so as to measurably improve the client experience?
Applying your expertise in organizing information about a variety of technology and business products/solutions so as to help internal and external clients improve the way they do business?
Rolling up your sleeves to solve problems, manage the day-to-day support of a client-facing product, and build award-winning, competitive products and services?
Collaborating with teams firmwide, coordinating with business partners, and reviewing client feedback to develop innovative solutions?
Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. Advanced/graduate degree preferred.
10-12 years of total work experience preferred.
Experience in Product Management, operations, client management preferred. MBA or CFA preferred. Product Leadership Certification preferred. Applicable local/regional licenses or certifications as required by the business.

Focus on your health, foster your personal resilience, and reach your financial goals as a valued member of our team, along with generous paid leaves that can support you and your family through moments that matter.

Job Title

Director, Fraud Strategy - Money Network

What does a successful Director, Fraud Strategy do at Fiserv?
The Money Network Fraud Risk team is responsible for the ongoing enhancement and monitoring of the fraud risk ecosystem, focused on minimizing fraud risk and maximizing customer experience. You are a data-driven, truth seeking, strategic operator who combines business context, capabilities, and analytics to ensure the Money Network fraud risk ecosystem is optimized and efficient.

As the Director, Fraud Strategy, you will improve and optimize the fraud risk capabilities of the Money Network product to reduce fraud exposure, enable accelerated product growth, reduce cost, and improve customer experience.



What you will do:
Manage the strategy of Money Networks approach to fraud - work on and deliver the products, pricing and strategy needed to maintain a robust fraud risk management ecosystem for this product.

Recognize and analyze fraud vectors across Money Networks platform – complete end-to-end analysis that allows us to better identify and prevent fraud attacks and improve to improve the experience of customers
Lead and structure complex analysis of current state process and issues/gaps, defines future state process and roadmap to achieve the future state
Implement ongoing tracking and monitoring of the performance of decision systems and models and produce clear, understandable visualizations, dashboards, and reports with support from the risk analytics team.
Keep current on card scheme rules, authorization decisioning, and regulation
Provide Product Owner Leadership, Business Analysis and Subject Matter Expertise to deliver enhanced and streamlined capabilities spanning across all aspects of fraud.
Lead the assessment of potential new projects, analyzing opportunity and defining approach and business case
Prioritize opportunities and set the agenda for team's work in the space in partnership with executives and leaders from across organizations
Manage relationships with third-party vendors, Enterprise Technology and other resources required to execute initiatives
Extensive cross-organization coordination including fraud operations, product & channel technology teams, strategy & analytics and cyber security
Lead a team of high performers, driving their engagement, growth, and results

What you will need to have:

Bachelor's Degree
7+ years of fraud risk management and strategy experience in consulting, strategy, business development, operations, technology, banking, fin-tech or related experience.
Knowledge of the Payment industry and Fraud capability management.
Confident communicator with the ability to interact at all levels.
Experience identifying new ways to approach risk management and thinking creatively.
Experience leading large projects, hitting goals, and succeeding.
Problem solving and analytical skills, including proficiency in SQL and Expertise in Excel.
People leadership experience.

What would be great to have:

Results-oriented and comfort working in a fast-paced environment requiring prioritization and ownership.

Job Title: Production Print Pre-Sales Analyst - East Region
Job Description:
Overview:

Responsible for providing expert technical advice, consulting to sales teams and customers in design and implementation of complex and enterprise Production Hardware, solutions, and professional services. Provide technical support in sales presentations, customer training, and the delivery of professional services as well as produce customer samples.

Responsibilities:
Collaborates with the sales team on the evaluation of prospective customers, account strategy, and possible enterprise printing application solutions; and then participates in sales calls.
Participates in on-site visits to customers for meetings, surveys and inspections.
Meets with customer IT staff as a technical advisor.
Collaborates on RFP responses and provides on-going project management support on large, complex, diverse and challenging solution architecture and implementation.
Responsible for conducting customer training classes and providing installation and integration direction of advanced Color Solutions. In addition, will participate in the preparation of large, high-value sales proposals, ensuring configurations are complete and accurate.
Interfaces with the sales team as a technical advisor during sales cycle of software workflow solutions through professional services.
Trains customers on all products using Professional Services, not product training.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience is required, plus 5 years of related experience.
Relevant business experience relating to printing pre-sales and post-sales support in production environments
Understands and is comfortable using the Adobe Creative Suite product, Quark Xpress and/or other standard Color composition and management tools and respective file formats (JPEG, TIFF. EPS, PDF).
Extensive travel may be required, up to 70% travel with overnight stays (valid drivers' license and acceptable driving record necessary). Certain minimum auto insurance coverages are required.
Enterprise Specific: In-depth knowledge of network topologies and design, which includes basic implementations skill of Production Solutions Portfolio
Production Specific: Color management professional and EFI certification and an in-depth understanding of color profiling systems, screening sets, color calibration, and ICC profiles, as well as an understanding of black and white production printing and the associated data streams and data conversion software products.
An understanding of complex systems solutions, integration and networking in Windows, UNIX, and Macintosh environments

The compensation range for this role is $53,700- $109,480. The listed salary range or contractual rate excludes bonuses, incentives, differential pay, and any other forms of compensation or benefits. Training, professional development, and mentorship

Location: Rahway, NJ

Need a contractor to support our animal health commercial planning from an operational point of view.
We need someone who can synthesize the information given to them and then create a professional, easy-to-digest format for socializing the information with top executives.
Kind of like creating a commercial business plan – in an innovative, beautiful, and very clear and concise way.
These documents will be signed, sealed, and delivered to our entire leadership team.
The job is to retrieve and consolidate high-priority objectives from 8 key markets and build a 'commitment document' at local, regional, and global levels.

Must have experience in creating / building SharePoint sites.

Need someone who is a strategic thinker and can synthesize information in way to get the main messages easily understood by an international audience of business leaders
Change management skills needed to 'sell' the change resulting in the commitments being made to these new country level plans, rolled up regionally, and globally
Need a strong designer and synthesizer of information.
Someone who can create beautiful power points or PDFs. Ability to create visual documents.
Someone who is very detailed and willing to think about how we can best 'market' these business plans across the MAH leaders.
MS Office suite, designing experience.
Anybody with corporate strategy exp., PMO, Business operation background, or commercial operations or strategic communications and business analysis experience.
Who can create executive-level presentations, and understand the life science or Animal health industry.

Salary: Up to $45.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

reating / building SharePoint sites.: 3 years (Preferred)
Change management: 3 years (Preferred)
market business plans: 3 years (Preferred)

Summary:

The Information Security Engineer is a member of the corporate enterprise security team. The team has overall responsibility for enterprise IT security. This role will be focused on keeping systems and devices hardened against attacks as well as monitoring and responding to security events. The Information Security Engineer is responsible for identifying, investigating, and remediating any vulnerabilities in the company security posture that introduces risk to the company or its patients.

The Information Security Engineer assists in development of security strategy, policy and procedures. The Engineer interacts with managers, system owners, data stewards, compliance and risk management staff to assess and understand their security needs. The Engineer provides assistance, recommendations, and security procedures and ensures that the user community understands and adheres to relevant policy and procedures to maintain security.

The position calls for an individual who understands business operations, information technology and security, and can collaborate with IT experts and business executives. The candidate must have demonstrated leadership specific to technical information security issues as well as an understanding of business processes and regulations. High level communication skills are essential to successfully translate technology and security requirements into business terms. It is expected that the incumbent will be a self-starter and will act with minimal supervision.

Responsibilities include design and review of security controls, monitoring of internal/external access controls and security safeguards to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information systems assets.

Essential Functions & Responsibilities:

Participates in the cyber security strategic planning process. Assist in the identification, evaluation, selection and implementation of security technologies.
Provides security design, consultancy, and assessment services; and introduces improvements in technical security standards and security implementation patterns and designs.
Develops security policy, procedures, and related metrics; reviews and contributes to the improvement and standardization of security systems across the entire IT environment.
Participates in projects and assists in the execution of project plans to help ensure compliance with all external regulations and laws, and internal policies, rules, and standards.
Stays up to date regarding potential and emerging information security threats, vulnerabilities, and control techniques and assist in the efforts to research, test, and recommend new technologies and products for implementation within the corporate computing network to mitigate threats/risks.
Develops formal training and awareness training and events to ensure that the user community understands evolving threats and adheres to necessary policy and procedures.
Works closely with business owners and IT staff to ensure adequate security solutions are in place for all IT systems and platforms to sufficiently mitigate identified risks and meet business objectives.
Interact daily with the user community to understand their security needs and provide assistance in remediation of security-related issues.
Develop and implement a certification process for new technologies or new versions of existing technologies.
Audit Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery operational procedures.
Conducts risk assessments and vulnerabilities assessments. Works with the business owners through completion of mitigation efforts. Generates risk, vulnerability and risk mitigation documentation.
Maintains awareness of latest security risks. Analyzes potential impact of new threats and exploits. Identifies operational gaps in existing controls. Communicates risks to relevant business units and implements risk mitigation improvements.
Engages with compliance staff to ensure compliance with all applicable rules, regulations, laws, and standards and that information technology operational procedures are in place to generate required logs / artifacts for compliance audits and provides support for compliance audits.
Conducts regular and ongoing audits of enterprise-wide compliance with information security and IT control standards and policies and document results. Assists in the resolution of audit findings through analysis, problem determination and development of cost-effective solutions.
Audit provisioning and use of administrative privileges.
Manages the security aspects of cloud service implementations and operations.
Participates in the development of incident response plans.
Participates in incident response, investigation, and recovery including those requiring the application of forensic practice. Produce activity, progress and management reports as required.
Operates and manages systems designed to detect malware and protect assets from malware.
Ensures that security systems remain up to date with respect to emerging exploits.
Writes and maintains technical documentation including security design documents, test plans, project plans, procedures, incident reports and troubleshooting guides.
Manages the use of external resources involved in the performance of security services, i.e., penetration tests, vulnerability scans, event monitoring, and other potential managed security services.
Serves as technical expert resource to Cyber Liability underwriting and claims personnel.
Provides an escalation path for operations and deployment staff to resolve security related issues.
Acts as escalation point for vendors to resolve security related issues.
Work hand in hand with Managed Detection & Response (MDR) partner to remediate any identified risks.
Sets standards for network access controls, account management, perimeter security devices, and website filtering systems and conducting ongoing security audits.
Sets standards for the security configuration of all inbound and outbound communications, remote access, VPN’s (B2B and Client) and conducting ongoing security audits.
Sets standards for the security configuration of LAN’s, WAN’s, and WLAN’s and ongoing security audits.
Executes periodic penetration tests.
Selects, installs, configures, operates, maintains and supports domain specific security incident and event monitoring solutions (IDS, IPS, Firewall, VPN, ISE, WAF, DLP, SIEM, Web Proxies, Vulnerability Scanners, etc.) and analysis of logs for the corporate IT environments.
Sets standards for early detection and fast reaction to unexpected “suspicious" situations (i.e., unusual traffic volume, port attacks, rogue devices in the network, etc.).
Participates in network design activities to ensure the creation and implementation of secure network connectivity solutions.
Creates governance processes for implementations and changes to authentication, authorization and encryption algorithms and key management.
Audits network security practices against internal policies and procedures and taking corrective measures as necessary.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Essential Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in MIS, Computer Science, or related field with exposure to information security.
Minimum of five (5) years of Information Security experience.
Security or technology certifications strongly desired (e.g., CISSP, SANS, CCSP, SSCP, Microsoft).
Project management and/or business analysis experience highly desirable.

Knowledge/Skills/Experience:

Experience with Microsoft Windows Server Administration.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server Administration.
Experience with Cisco Meraki technology stack.
Experience with File System Auditing Software.
Experience working with Intrusion Detection Systems.
Experience working with Two-factor authentication solutions.
Healthcare industry knowledge desired.
Well-developed oral and written communication skills.
The ability to work within the technology group with technical experts and with non-technical business process experts.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to provide excellent customer service.
Ability to solve problems quickly and effectively.
Willingness to provide solutions that will exceed the needs of the business.
Ability and desire to learn about the company’s lines of business to better analyze significant problems and opportunities.
Effectively performs duties and responsibilities with accuracy, attention to detail, and support for organizational policies.

Education:

Preferred Education: 4-year college degree
Years of Relevant Experience: 3 plus years

Job Summary

The Performance Measurement Lead will provide analytical and functional support to the Electric Asset Strategy Group. The position specifically mines and collects data, performs analysis, and uses analysis to identify trends, potential causes and the likelihood of future outcomes and historical data. This position also provides technical/analytical expertise and functional support in the area of Reliability and Asset Strategy, and functional analysis for process and initiatives (e.g. applying machine learning algorithms and statistical models to existing data sets in order to identify trends/patterns that predict the probability of an asset failing). Support for identifying, prioritizing, and coordinating implementation efforts for the top Utility strategic objectives, as well as the reporting and metrics/measures of those efforts. Lead or Reliability Review presentation development for Senior Leadership.

Work with a team to develop project plans for analytical studies, help secure the resources necessary to achieve plan and work with the team to execute the study. This will include:

Understanding the data-analytical problem presented
Identifying data sets and variables necessary to perform the analysis
Securing access to the data and extracting the data in a logical and efficient manner
Cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and uniformity
Devising and applying models and algorithms to mine the data
Using statistical and machine learning tools to identify patterns and trends
Interpreting the data to discover solutions and opportunities
Communicate finding to stakeholders using visualization and other mean
Job Responsibilities
Provide analytical and program support to the Electric Asset Strategy group.
Gather and link data from diverse sources in order to preform analyses, identify trends and correlations, develop and track metrics, identify performance gaps, deliver actionable information and present opportunities for improvement.
Apply predicative analytics to extract information from existing data sets in order to determine patterns and forecast future outcomes.
Support the assessment, analysis, development and implementation of program related data and material.
Develop a method for storing, tracking data and electronic files (i.e., Microsoft SharePoint, network drives, ect.), and design with recommendations for consolidation, security, efficiency and usability improvements.
Lead on presentation development for Senior Leadership and all LOB’s in the utility.
Design, develops, and delivers standardized databases, forms, queries and reports for capturing, organizing, tracking, retrieving, assembling, and disseminating data and metrics from the following:
Internal and External Stakeholders
Reports as determined by Utility senior management
Develops and maintains databases, spreadsheets, presentations, documents, PowerBI data visualization files, ect.
Preforms all essential aspects and function of the job as well as any other specific job requirement
Job Specific Qualifications
Required:

BA/BS Degree or equivalent experience
Minimum of 5 years relevant professional work experience: 5 to 7 years of business analysis/professional experience working with large data sets
Ability to support thoughtful decisions by gathering, transforming, and analyzing data to develop and document conclusions and/or recommendations
Demonstrated organization and high level of analytical and quantitative analysis skills
Proficiency with MS Office products (e.g. Excel, Access, Word, PowerPoint, ect.)
Experience in data mining, database development, query and report design, or programming (e.g. SQL, SAS, Python R)
Demonstrated experience with predicative analytics tools and techniques
Demonstrated ability to develop new approaches with applicable tools to measure success
Detail oriented, driven and able to effectively work independently
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and effectively communicate results of analytic models and insights from data mining to subject matter experts and team members
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across department boundaries and build and maintain relationships within our AMCS. Electric Operations and IT departments and participate in cross functional teams
Must foster an inclusive work environment and respect all aspects of diversity. Successful candidate must demonstrate and value differences in others strengths, perspectives, approaches, and personal choices

Role Description

SMBC is in process of leading a Digital Transformation across our Americas Division as we continue to modernize our technology, focus on our data driven approach, grow and plan for the future. As a result of this expansion we are seeking a Senior Middleware Support Engineer to work in the Applications Architecture and Production Support departments. The candidate for the IBM Integration Bus (IIB) formerly known as WebSphere Message Broker (WMB) support position will be responsible for documenting, maintaining and dynamically building simulated message to test IIB flows and message models. The IIB candidate is also responsible for troubleshooting issues and assisting with code reviews to ensure optimal solutions are being delivered. The IIB Support candidate will be involved with on-going maintenance and Production support of all Bank's application internal and external interfaces.

The ideal candidate must have at least 8 years of experience in IIB and also a very good understanding of UNIX, Linux and Windows operating systems as well as Korn Shell scripting. The candidate should also be familiar with IBM’s Rational Integration Tester application (Green Hat) and websphere service registry and repository (WSRR). This candidate will work with various application team members and developers to perform their duties and they will be responsible for maintenance and support of the existing interface processes including investigation of issues and production support for the Bank's operation. The candidate will also be responsible for creating documentation for the processes that they support as well as updating documentation for processes that they are changing and/or enhancing. This position will be a key member of JRIA's Production Support team.


Role Objectives: Responsibilities
Provide support on technical issues requiring in-depth debugging and expertise in production Middleware software applications.
Work with the Development Middleware and Interface teams to support changes through the SDLC.
Work with team members and technologies to fulfil projects and technical requirements.
Support various development teams across the Americas and EMEA to ensure middleware components are tested and deployed through the environment.
The role requires a high level of skills to support critical middleware components providing technical guidance and leadership across the organization.
Qualifications and Skills
8+ years of experience with IBM WebSphere Message Broker 7.0+/IBM Integration Bus 9.0
Strong WebSphere Message Broker and WebSphere MQ technology skills required to provide architecture and design solutions in the areas of Information Integration Architecture and Governance.
Provide subject matter expertise based on past experiences of SOA and ESB implementations.
Experience in creating Message Models/Sets and Message Definitions using WSDLs, XML Schemas, MRM and TDS formats (CSV, SWIFT, NACHA and X12).
Experience in migrating message flows and message sets from WMB 7.0 to IBM Integration Bus 9.0.0.1
Experience in creating, performance tuning, and troubleshooting message flows.
Experience in supporting message flows using Compute Nodes, SOAP Nodes, HTTP Nodes, Routing Nodes, Mapping Nodes, Java Compute Node, Java Custom Nodes, FileInput and FileOutput Nodes and Database Nodes. Experience in Programming Languages: Korn Shell scripts, PERL, Java, SQL, C, C++.
Experience with project management, business analysis and IIB toolsets.
Experience in working with Operating systems such as UNIX (AIX), Linux (RHEL), Windows (2008/2012).
Experience in working with Databases such as Oracle 9i, 10G, 11i, PL/SQL, Stored Procedures.
Experience with a wide variety of testing tools and techniques (ex. MBTestClient, JUnit and Test Director).
Management skills to coordinate Change Management and production issues among multiple departments (Business, Operations, Vendor).
Excellent communication (oral and written) skills are a must.
Experience with DataPower, WSRR, BPM, Rational Integration Tester (IBM Green Hat) and some other IBM tools preferred.
Computer skills are a must with the following software tools:
Database: Oracle 9i /10G/11i, PL/SQL Stored procedure.
Application: WebSphere Message Broker v7.0 or higher and/or IBM Intergration Bus 9.0, IBM WebSphere MQ v7.0 or higher, MQFTE v7.0 or higher
Programming languages: Korn shell, Java, XML, Perl
Ensure Service implementation consistency, speed of delivery, and promote reuse through creation of reusable middleware assets.
Additional Requirements

Ability to work on an on call rotation for weekend maintenance or out of hours support as needed.

Job Title: Physical Security Operations Center Senior Analyst (San Antonio- Night Shift)
Job Description:
Organization: Corporate Functions/ Corporate Services & Sustainability

Location: San Antonio, TX


Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

People in Corporate Functions contribute to the running of Accenture as a high- performance business through specialization within a specific functional area, and grow into internally focused roles by deepening their skills and/or developing new skills within an internal functional area.

Role: Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst (Crisis Coordinator)


This role is onsite in San Antonio, TX. Candidate must be open to relocate to San Antonio.

Job Description:


The Security Operations Center (SOC) Senior Analyst will be responsible for assessing, analyzing, and responding to incidents related to safety and security around the globe. The role requires daily use of tools/systems (e.g. access control, video management, risk feeds) to detect impact to Accenture’s people, products, property, or brand image and alert the appropriate response stakeholders. Specifically, incidents may range from extreme weather conditions, political instability, crime, terror, civil unrest, and other personnel issues. In addition, the Analyst will be responsible for customer service tasks to provide critical information and assistance to travelers, static employees, and potential third parties. This role will be based in San Antonio, Texas and reports to the SOC Shift Supervisor.

Key Responsibilities:

Assist company employees in all concerns that pertain to safety, security, and property

Act as initial point of contact to aid all employees, travelers, and others contacting the SOC

Monitor and operate security systems to include access control and CCTV, along with environmental monitoring and mass notification systems

Respond quickly and initiate action related to alarms, phone calls, and environmental monitoring and alerting systems

Notify, assist, and direct external emergency personnel and internal resources as necessary

Dispatch security officers or law enforcement personnel for alarm response, calls for service and emergency situations

Execute protocols and communicate at all levels across the globe to employees, site security leads, safety & security staff or contracted officers as needed

Manage information flow to and from an incident

Maintain operational logs, conduct daily shift checklists, handover reports, and incident reports

Ensure all forms of communications, such as e-mails, phone conversations, and client interactions, are conducted in a courteous and professional manner, confidentially, and documented appropriately

Coordinate with Accenture’s Corporate Security regional leads on incident detection and management

Ensure that complete and accurate information is entered in the incident management system

Utilize and execute protocols and standard operating procedures to effectively manage global incidents

Monitor travel safety and security of company's staff

Maintain situational awareness of current global current events

Monitor and respond to global alerts and events effecting company facilities and employees providing immediate information and assistance as needed

Initiate mass communication notifications as required

Notify leadership of events effecting business operations and employees

Ensure proper handling of highly confidential information

Perform other duties assigned by supervisors related to security and safety


Location:

The role is located in San Antonio, TX and requires to be in the office.


Hours & Shift Requirements:

Night Shift (11:00pm - 7:00 am CST) - Note - This is a 24/7 operations center and critical to have flexibility to work any shift required as needed to support the business


Training:

Individuals receive paid training


Travel:

No travel is needed for this position




Basic Qualifications:

Associate degree or minimum of 2 years of security work experience in Military, Law Enforcement, Government, Corporate Security, Customer Service, Communications or Academia


Preferred Qualifications:

Experience identifying anomalies in a physical environment and performing first-line investigations

Experience with emergency response protocols & processes

Bachelor’s degree in Business, International Relations, Political Science, Communications, or other Humanities-related degrees

Minimum 1-year experience in a Security Operation or Command Center role

Bilingual (English/Spanish/Portuguese)

Experience with Genetec video solutions or CCure 9000

Proficient in Microsoft Windows and Office Suite

Ability to analyze threats and envision potential or real time impact to operations

Ability to respond quickly and calmly to emergencies and stressful situations exercising proper judgment and decision-making skills

Professional skills:

Great active listening skills

Rapport building skills

Patient and empathetic attitude

Adaptability and flexibility

Strong Customer Service skills

Strong consensus, team building and negotiating skills

Ability to work overtime on short notice

Strong cultural sensitivities

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Ability to multitask in a fast-paced, at times stressed work environment

Strong team player

Comfortable with high-tech work environment, and constant learning of new tools and innovations

Demonstrated leadership in professional setting; either military or civilian

Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting; either military or civilian

#LI-NA

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst with Oracle Cloud EDM
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY

Business Analyst for the Oracle Cloud EDM team supporting a global instance of ePCBS. They will work with multiple stakeholders to gather business requirements for development on Oracle EDM and other platforms.
They will work with the technical team to develop new products and test them.
Be the client facing lead for support and training of new and existing developments.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Work with Business Owners and Oracle EDM implementation partners to turn business requirements into technical documents
Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) for new build, break fixes and enhancements. Tasks include research, write up, and working with the technical team to deliver requirements.
Convert BRDs into stories for a JIRA boards
Maintain JIRA board to track agile development
Lead scrum calls with technical and functional teams
UAT and QA testing for development and break fixes
Primary lead on client facing and ad hoc projects such as the new report, input template, and interface creation
Prepare and provide trainings for clients for new users and new developments. Trainings can be standard or custom made to agencies when presented.
Be primary lead for user support. Provide user support all the following levels:
Tier 1 access and software questions is questions such as password rest.
Tier 2 are training questions on current functionality.
Tier 3 is production issue resolution. Require coordination with technical and development groups and may lead break-fix or enhancement development.

Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance or computer science
Minimum of 5 years accounting/finance or development experience
Financial acumen
Experience with Agile development method
Strong analytical and organizational skills
Must have strong work ethic
Excellent communication skills (including, presentation, written and verbal)
Attention to detail a must
Solutions-provider, strategic problem solver
A proven autonomous worker
Ability to switch gears quickly
Ability to multi-task
Must be flexible and adaptable to change
Computer literate; proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Power Point, Excel) required
Knowledge Oracle EDM a plus
Knowledge of SAP ERP a plus.

Best Regards,

Sindhu Yadav

Edgewell is a global team of over 6,000 visionaries, doers and makers. Our secret is people, and we have an inspiring and collaborative global force of them. Our portfolio of over 25 brands touches lives in more than 50 countries by making useful things joyful. Together, we reimagine good mornings and endless summers, strive for more sustainable ways to beautify and bond, and do it all with not only confidence but determination.

Position Summary

To make sales calls on retail accounts to achieve goals in sales volume, market share, and share of shelf; to educate, partner, and build loyalty to the brands at multiple levels in the retail organizations serviced. The primary way the Territory Manager (TM) executes these goals is to prepare and deliver presentations to Department Heads, Store Managers, and District Managers. The other principle function of the (TM) is to provide Direct Store Delivery (DSD) service to retail outlets.

Universal Accountabilities

1. Develop and provide the unconstrained shipment forecast: Develop and provide the Supply Planning/Operations with a 24-30 month rolling demand forecast in units/$ for the assigned segment. The forecast becomes the basis of the LEs (Latest Estimates), Operating Plans, and Financial projections. Ensure the timely hand-off of the demand plan to supply planning.

2. Manage and maintain forecast models and tools.

3. Monitor forecast accuracy and bias. Communicate findings and recommended actions to the teams.

4. Participate as an active team member on the brand team(s) for responsible brands.

5. Develop and manage key data that impacts the forecast: historical data, new product projections, promotional lifts, customer/channel specific trends, etc.

6. Understand all promotional and pricing strategies, determine and communicate impacts on business to appropriate functions in a timely manner.

Specific Accountabilities

1. Execute management’s sales strategies to achieve goals of volume growth, market share, and proper Brand/SKU representation.

2. Provide Direct Store Delivery service. This includes selling and writing orders with the Telxon handheld computer; physically delivering or shipping product to accounts; and then merchandising/maintaining proper inventories. Inventory control is critical to minimize end-of-season returns. Another vital function of the (DSD) service is keeping a regular schedule to provide the appropriate service frequency level based on account volume.

3. Entrepreneurial mindset, to seek and develop new business, and to develop existing accounts to their fullest potential.

4. Maintain administrative duties such as expense reports; monthly inventory; vehicle condition reports; account records; tracking reports; and weekly, monthly and quarterly records.

5. Maintain timely and open communications with management, distribution centers, and other territory managers.

Additional functions

1. Share information with others on team to increase account penetration, increase volume, increase market share, and share time-saving ideas.

2. Attend meetings, trade shows, develop and participate in integrated marketing functions.

3. Help with projects assigned by management.

Required Skills and Experience

1. Background/Experience/Education required: Sales experience; high school diploma.

2. Skills and Abilities required: Good verbal communication skills. Good organizational time management and administrative skills. Good business analysis skills in order to identify sales trends, prioritize tasks and objectives, and solve day-to-day problems that are encountered.

3. Physical requirements: Physically able to work long hours merchandising. Physical ability to drive short and/or long distances (depending on geographic size of territory).

Some lifting and handling of cases required.

Working Relationships

Reports to: Area, District or Business Manager

Directly supervises: Seasonal Sales Merchandiser(s) (SSM) in high volume territories

Type of supervision received: 1 monthly field visit.

Internal contacts: Human Resources, MIS, Distribution Facilities, Accounts Receivable

External contacts: Retail Account Personnel, Integrated Marketing Contacts

Work Environment

Travel

The salary range for this position is $52,000 - $78,000. The actual base salary offered to a candidate may vary based upon factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, time in role, base salary of internal peers, prior performance, business sector, and geographic location. In addition to base salary, the competitive compensation package may include, depending on the role, participation in an incentive program linked to performance.

We aim to bring joy to not only the products we create and the people we serve, but our colleagues across the globe too.

Job Title: Senior SAP Indirect Tax and Vertex Implementer
Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

As part of the Global Product Design & Development Team the successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing, designing, developing, and delivering solutions in the Indirect Tax area of the template in a Professional Services environment. The role supports processes across the Operational and Financial areas of the template as well as supporting the Vertex O series system integration and reporting.

The position requires an Indirect Tax resource with extensive experience implementing US/Canada tax solutions in SAP using the Vertex system as a bolt-on. Must have hands on experience with Vertex including Vertex integration with SAP, Vertex Accelerator, tax rates/tax reporting, SAP Tax procedure configuration and SAP pricing configuration. Candidate should have strong business analyst skills with experience on Sales & Purchasing processes along with good knowledge of US and Canada indirect tax regimes.

This position requires a versatile person that can be both technical and process oriented to be able to work with the technical team as well as explaining system solutions to a non-technical audience.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

The Indirect Tax Functional resource is responsible for managing requirements, leading and implementing solutions, and supporting/owning the indirect tax solution implemented for North America integrating SAP and Vertex.

Along with other team members, this position will engage frequently with business users, managers, project leaders, and functional leads to discuss specific business needs, gather detailed business requirements ensuring a full understanding of what is required to determine solution options as well as support existing solutions.

This role includes responsibility for the following:

Prioritizing and managing scope for applicable localization requirements in consultation with key business stakeholders: liaising with the internal SAP teams, Shared Services Teams and Business partners as well as external financial advisors and our consultancy partners
Responsible for analyzing, solutioning, designing, configuring, enhancing and testing the integrated tax solution for US and Canada in SAP interfaced to Vertex within the P2P and OTC area.
Responsible for Accelerator configuration, FI, SD and MM tax set-up and related master data that meets the US and Canada legal/business/usability requirements while being consistent with the global template
Design, build and support integrations to external tax authorities where needed
Provide Level 4 support - Ability to identify and diagnose problems and resolve/implement solutions
Prepare comprehensive documentation according to the project methodology for all aspects of requirements, development, testing and implementation
Perform comprehensive testing of solutions, including regression testing before any changes are released to QA and Production
Perform walkthroughs and demos – demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills in order to express identified solutions in terms understood by the business
Be able to adapt and quickly learn new areas to be able to deliver integrated solutions
Ensure assigned deliverables are managed and delivered on a timely basis in accordance with the project plan
Be proactive and have ability to multi-task, work will be required on multiple projects as well as leading some projects
Liaise with other team members to communicate planned releases, change impact, and co-ordinate communication and training needs
Any other duties as directed by the Global Manager

EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

Essential:

Strong business process knowledge/expertise with an ability to analyze complex business scenarios and translate to optimal solutions
Minimum of 8 years' experience implementing indirect tax solutions in SAP for US and Canada with extensive Vertex experience
Bachelor's degree in information technology or business-related field required or equivalent years of experience in the field
Completion, at minimum, of 3 distinct SAP implementations
At least 3 years' hands-on experience SAP > Vertex O Series (preferably version 9.0) integration experience
Extensive experience implementing SAP solutions for Canada and US indirect tax requirements using Vertex application for tax determination and tax reporting
Direct hands-on configuration/enhancement experience with Vertex Accelerator
Experience with Vertex interface administration
Extensive experience of SAP FI Tax Configuration, and MM/SD Pricing along with related master data
Knowledge of indirect tax impact on SAP invoice verification/FI AP invoice processing and SAP Order related billing is required
Ability to understand complex business/tax requirements within the business processes and communicate effectively with a non-technical audience
Able to execute high quality deliverables with minimal direct supervision
Team player that can collaborate with cross-team resources to build and deploy end-to-end solutions
Strong communication/presentation skills

About the Role
The Sr. Staff SAP PP Analyst is a seasoned individual who will join the IT ERP team to support the ongoing SAP implementation project and other application areas specific to the Production Planning module (Also known as Forecast to Production). The ideal candidate is well versed in the SAP PP module with strong knowledge of manufacturing industry. They will be responsible for the solution designing, configuration, implementation, and delivery of functions relevant to the production planning module for the ongoing SAP implementation and future SAP enhancement projects.
What You will Do
Working with global teams to gather requirements and translate them to technical capabilities
Design, develop and deliver sustainable/scalable, global solutions to achieve defined business goals
Proactively communicate and collaborate with the business users to analyze the functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements Use Cases, Use Interface Document)
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously and capable of managing projects of various sizes and complexity.
Support users with SAP function troubleshooting and trainings
Act as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Lead/support active and upcoming Projects & System Enhancements and support issue resolution on production applications
Effort estimation, solution design and project delivery
Work independently and stay well versed with best practices in SAP, specifically in a manufacturing environment
What You Bring
BS in computer science, Information systems or related discipline
7+ years of experience with formal Business Analysis
8+ years SAP Functional experience, specializing in SAP PP module preferably in discrete manufacturing
Strong configuration capabilities in SAP Production Planning and experience in Variant Configuration
Demonstrated ability to design and configure SAP ECC PP Module with expert knowledge of discrete manufacturing industries including but not limited to MRP, Demand Management, shop floor activities, confirmation, BOMs, routings, serialization, and batch management
Good Overall understanding and experience in the SAP supply chain modules (PP, SD, MM, WM)
At least 8 years of experience in enhancing standard objects and developing custom objects in SAP ECC with at least two full life cycle implementations
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and functional requirements.
Experience in working with Shop floor/Manufacturing execution systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, business users, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Knowledge of i2 planning system is preferred but not mandatory.

Job Title: Sr. Manager/Associate Director - Analytics Consulting (CPG, Marketing Analytics)
Job Description:
Tiger Analytics is an advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for several Fortune 100 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our consultants bring deep expertise in Data Science, Machine Learning, and AI. Various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner, have recognized our business value and leadership. We are seeking someone with a good blend of business consulting skills and a data analytics background. If you are passionate about working on unstructured business problems that can be solved using data, we would like to talk to you.

Responsibilities

Work on the latest applications of AI and Analytics to solve business problems in the Marketing and Media space for CPG / Retail customers.
Conduct solution and requirement workshops involving business and analytics stakeholders.
Leverage marketing & media best practices to define and design advanced analytics solutions.
Participate in discussions with team members to select and apply relevant analytic techniques and create actionable business insights.
Ability to understand the business context by discussing existing data models with senior client leaders and deriving useful business insights.
Ability to break down a project into specific tasks involving business analysis, data science, and engineering.
Direct teams of business analysts to create data-driven solutions.
Define solutions using data analytics frameworks to solve data-driven business problems.
Report the results and insights to the business stakeholders, engaging them through a good data story driving activation.
Responsible for making presentations to senior management, communicating results to business teams, and developing plans to help operationalize analytic solutions.
Being able to communicate with and manage expectations across stakeholders effectively.

Requirements



8-10 years of professional work experience with at least 5 years in business data analytics in the Marketing and Media space.
Prior experience working in the consumer goods / Retail/ Pet care industry.
Experience in leading marketing / media analytics programs.
Experience working with large data sets would be preferable (with an emphasis on business analysis problems).
Experience working with offshore teams.
Graduate in Business Analytics or MBA or equivalent work experience.
Ability to engage with executive/VP-level stakeholders from the client’s team to translate business problems into a high-level analytics solution approach.
Strong project management and team management skills and ability to work with global teams.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning algorithms.

Benefits

Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging, and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.
